story:
OUR LEADING LADY

Our Lead Actress playing Lady Simone - Mia Clyburn

 

A Wishing Well in Brooklyn

A Kim Afreeka Flick

An Art Enriched Short Film With Vibrant Urban & Cultural Art Expressions from Graffiti, Street Art, Canvas Art, Poetry, Music, Architecture and Cinematography. Repping the Borough of BROOKLYN to the Fullest.

Set in the late 1980's, This Film Tells The Story of Lady Simone Monroe, An Honor Student (Who is Destined For Greatness) and That Ambigious Day Her Mother Dies of A Drug Overdose.

This Culturally relevant film shares The Important Message of Inner Strength, Perseverance and Unconditional Love, Sprinkle with a Little Black Girl Magic.

Our Long Term Goal is to Submit to Festivals and Be eligible to compete as a Short Film for a Academy Award, then to continue telling the story in a full feature film.

 

MAGICAL CREATIVE TEAM

We have collectively worked on many independent and commercial projects individually and this will be the first time we teamed up to work together creatively.

Kim Afreeka: Writer, Producer & Director (Art Therapist turned Filmmaker) My vision is to merge various art expressions within the medium of film while telling intriguing and compelling stories with layered and complicated characters.

Lee Robinson: Music Director will make sure we don't miss a beat with the Sound Quality, The Score and the Soulful Soundtrack.

Makesha Williamson: Casting Director  will ensure the right talent is in the right roles, so the message and theme of the film can be delivered flawlessly.

Cassandra Nunn: Art Director will ensure the art and set design are aligned with the overall theme of the film making it not only pertinent, but esthetically beautiful.  

 

WHAT'S PERK- ALATING?

We have a wonderful Line Up of Perks to get you as much or as little involvement as you may want, from a Fierce SHOUT OUT on Social Media Outlets to Associate Producer Credits. You get to choose.  

WHERE'S THE FUNDING GOING?

This will be a SAG-AFTRA Signatory Film, So Most of the Moolah will go to our Dynamic and Large Cast of 15 professional actors and actresses, plus 25 Extras and Bits.

$3200 

will cover talents pay for our 4 day shoot, insurance and teacher fees for all minors on set.

$800

will cover Craft Services and Catering to ensure Everybody is properly Fed and Nourished.

$1600

will cover Equipment and Location Rentals, Transportation Expenses and Wardrobe.

$400

will cover Additional Production and Permit Fees.   

 

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT:

SPREAD THE WORD and while you at it, SPREAD LOVE, It's the Brooklyn Way.

Thank You For All Your Awesome Support!

Kim & Crew

story:
Short Summary

Driver,  A noir-style web series starring Rhett Johnson.  Rhett brings intensity, talent and good looks; Damon Wood brings a vision, a script, relationships with craftsmen and actors, and a track record of finishing projects.  Driver  is no vanity project. Our goal is to create a quality series that deals with the middle age condition and provides some new actors of all ages and races a chance to do something other than stand in the background or do limited "48 hour-style" projects.  The story is full of characters at the apex of their crises.  Driver  is fast-paced, taut, gritty and stylish.  Above all, the show is close-up and almost uncomfortably so.  Like the confines of a car, this story has very little leg room.

The pilot episode is to be funded in part by this campaign. Directed by Damon Wood, who brings over 20 years of independent film and video production, and starring Rhett Johnson, a professional actor based in Atlanta, Georgia, Driver  is certainly not G-rated, but it is discreet. Many of the characters' lives hang in the balance and discretion is their only friend.  Sexy?  Yes.  Gritty? Yes.  Gratuitous? No.  It is a world only exposed through the eyes of the Driver, who unfortunately cannot understand the danger of his choices until it is too late.

What We Need & What You Get

Written as a web series, Driver  is 13 episodes, culminating in the death of The Driver, its main character. It is finite. One story of many stories, some significant and some simply interesting, humorous or misleading. Full of suspense, action and a pathos for the down-trodden, Driver  is about a fractured life-- one that must end rather than be fixed.

We need $ 5,000.  What for? Here:

  • To pay actors
  • To pay craftsmen and women (hair/mua, grips, pa's, artists, etc.)
  • To acquire graphic art
  • Creation of series website
  • To arrange music and sound effects
  • To promote and raise funding for the resulting series

That amount, $ 5000, won't really pay for a genuine quality series pilot.  Nope.  The partners will need to contribute three times that in time, equipment, locations, post-production and legal work,  But it will insure that actors and workers get paid up front (not in that elusive "back end") for their toil.

And what do you, the patron, get for your donations, aside from the satisfaction of seeing a new, interesting entertainment product?  Here:

  • $ 10 The Hitchhiker- Gets a personalized thank you and Production Still
  • $ 25 Rider -  Also gets a digital download of the pilot
  • $ 50  Easy Rider - Also gets a Driver T-shirt
  • $ 100 Repeat Offender - gets the T-shirt and Special Thanks Credit and invitations to the Premiere
  • $ 500 gets all that and a cameo in the pilot, you can even die if you want to!
  • Greater amounts will land you as a Producer and we need to talk!

Based on the pilot script, $ 5,000 would break down into $ 385 per page of the script.  That's to get actors, MUA, PA's, crew members, locations, transportation, props, craft services and other up-front costs. Considering the small, tight independent action/suspense production that is planned, the actually per page cost would be in the neighborhood of $ 750 - $ 1000 per page.  I am pledging to get that done.  I'm simply asking for help, whatever help you can afford.  I promise that your money will be spent on employing others.

The Impact

Your contribution will put creative people to work. This project is more than just about "getting it done."  We want to launch careers.  We want to entertain.  We want to make a story that is compelling, keeps you guessing, sets expectations and then WHAM! blows your mind.

Risks & Challenges

The number one risk is a shortage of talent, time or money.  You should never let those problems stop a production, and we will not let that happen.  This project shoots in late September through October 2016.  I promise that this pilot will be legally protected, completed and shown publicly.  I will see to it that it goes to competitions, conventions and gets in front of funding sources so that the series may continue.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Let's say you can't contribute.  That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and get some buzz about Driver.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools, please! 
  • Do you have a skill or time you want to contribute?  Contact me.
  • Do you know a craftsman or actor you want to recommend to us? Do it.

And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much.

Help get the word out and get some buzz about Driver.

Do you know a craftsman or actor you want to recommend to us? Do it.

story:
We are sure our film "Out Of This World" will be an intergalactic success!! 

YOU can be part of this extra terrestrial mystery!!

We need YOUR help to make this film!!


Saeed is a 45 year old conspiracy theorist who believes without a shadow of a doubt that extra terrestrial life exists (He’s right, obviously).

Toby is a 23 year old skateboarding lad and a total skeptic.

These differences in background, age and opinion don't seem to matter, the two are still best of friends.

The friends make an extra terrestrial discovery that throws their lives into chaos and pushes their friendship to the limits. Will their relationship survive? Will they survive? Or will they be probed to within an inch of their lives? 

Actors Saeed Ashiq and Ryan Gilmartin stargazing during the audition process.


The purpose of this interstellar project is to create an entertaining, emotionally engaging film that will be entered into film festivals around the world and get wide exposure for everyone involved, including YOU.

The film will also be a calling card to obtain funding to turn the short into a feature film.

We believe in giving you something before asking for something in return, so we’ve made the above video for your entertainment… it's a sneak peek introduction to our characters.

We're shooting in Manchester in September 2016.

"OUT OF THIS WORLD" will be an unforgettable experience.



We’ve included a small payment for each of our crew members in our budget.

Our bare minimum target is £3566 If we go “InDemand” and pass this amount we’ll pay our crew more than the gesture we’ve budgeted for by dividing any extra funding equally between us.


The building of a flying saucer model for use in the film and also... a top secret extra terrestrial prop. Which you will see plans for here before the film is released.

The production standard of the props which are already in production is very exciting and we can't wait to bring them to life on screen.


Two of our cast, Saeed Ashiq and Martin Partington have been involved from the beginning of the project. The role of Toby will be played by extremely talented actor, Ryan Gilmartin.

 

Ryan has years of experience across theatre, radio, film and television. Here's a link to his casting call pro page: http://www.castingcallpro.com/uk/actor/profile/ryan-gilmartin


Martin Partington will play the character of... Partington (one that was written specifically for him). Martin has experience playing a range of characters in short films over the past three years, he will be stepping up to play a main role in the film.


Our talented team have worked together on many projects before.

Producer Chiara Marchino has an extra Terrestrial level intelligence. She is an excellent negotiator and has produced a wide variety short films.

Director Gareth Soens-Hughes is a Royal Television Society nominated short film director and a self proclaimed egotist.

Leading the camera department is Royal Television Society and Hollywood International Film Festival award winning Director of Photography Theo Kirkpatrick. He can light a scene with the best of them along with quick witted, slightly mental gaffer Craig Shepherd. 

Sound Designer Martyn Ellis is well known for his excellent skills in all things sound and love of his own jokes.

Key Grip Aiden Bell is known for his determined attitude and no nonsense approach. Aiden works on high end TV commercials and feature films, recently working on a feature starring Sean Bean and Ruth Wilson. He has also worked as a jib assistant on Peter Kay's Car Share.

Our talented heads of the Art Department Rhiannon Clifford and Martin Butterworth will be leading a dedicated team in creating all manner of extra terrestrial props, spaceships and goodies and also creating more mess on the set than anyone else. Rhiannon has freelanced in the art department for the last 5 years, winning best Art Design and Costume at Screen Stockport Film Festival.

Our excellent VFX designer Oliver Bates won best VFX at Utah Film awards for the short called "Kiss the Devil in the Dark", has done VFX for Coronation Street and the 4oClock Club (a BBC children's TV series) Oli can manipulate time and space. Enough said.

Eleri Lovegrove is our incredibly gifted Make Up Artist. She will be designing and creating some prosthetics for one of the characters. Which one is....Top Secret! 

1st Assistant Director Hannah Saul is well organised, a people person and extremely loud (which makes her ideal for her role) Hannah is also an award winning short film producer and is currently working for a production company based in Manchester.

Dedicated Editor Andrew Mills will cut the film together. Andrew is known for his quick editing skills and has experience with various editing projects.

story:
A Few Details About Me is a moving film about a thirty-year-old woman who realizes her life holds very little meaning in this world.  Not matter what she does she feels she hasn’t made a difference to anyone. But as she faces the biggest struggle of her life, she knows she must change her course to find self-worth. She experiences inner turmoil as well as external challenges.

A Few Details About Me stars Ella Rose Swinimer, an Ottawa, Canada based actress who has previously worked with the production company, Interquel,  in the 2009 film Searching for the Big One.  Just like how the story unfolds on screen, we have undertaken a fresh approach to filming. Traditionally, a script is prepared in pre-production and the actual shoot of the film takes place over a number of weeks or months. For A Few Details About Me, we have been working on pre-production and production side by side. It has been illuminating, particularly as we have shot footage of the solo scenes. We are now at the stage where we need to cast and shoot scenes with the main character Imogene's best friend, Cassandra, who is rather bohemian, somewhat quirky. She sees through pretentiousness - calls 'em how she sees 'em.

We would like to get a known talent to play this part, and are looking for an actress who has previous film and/or television experience: someone with maybe a bit of a “draw” or a “name”.  While we cannot pay large talent fees, we hope this crowdfunding campaign will help defray costs that would be comparable to a minimum fee scale payment. By supporting independent filmmaking, you can  We hope you will be part of making that happen!

A Few Details About Me is an Interquel Productions Inc., film; it is written, directed and produced by John Stopa.  A Fall 2017 release date is planned.

story:
YOU CAN HELP!

By giving towards the event now you can ensure its success! There is no fee to attend this event, so the more donations the better. This campaign is simply a way for us to collect funds in advance so that we can spend it on the things needed to ensure that you, your friends and family will have a fantastic time this year.

Sure, buying a t-shirt on the day of the event helps. However, those funds will go toward 2017, not 2016. This is a way to put your money towards 2016.

WHAT ARE FUNDS USED FOR, YOU ASK?

Examples include (but are not limited to) the following:

  • materials for activities
  • design costs
  • volunteer t-shirts
  • directional and parking signage
  • posters, banners, flyers
  • programs & maps
  • atmospheric themed decor

WHAT YOU RECEIVE AS AN INDIVIDUAL SPONSOR:

#1: A well organized event, with plenty of signage, programs, maps & volunteers.

#2: For $10 - name recognition on a scroll in the storefront window of 'Tomes & Scrolls.'

#3: For $30 or more - your very own event t-shirt that you won't have to wait in a line to purchase on the day of the event. It will be mailed to your doorstep!

Sounds pretty good, right?

 

If you have any questions regarding this campaign, email: scottsvillemagicministry@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

EN My name is Ariam Tekle, I am of Eritrean origin and I was born and raised in Milan. This documentary stems from the need to recount the experiences of a generation of immigrants’ children that so far has been ignored. I trust being part of what is known as the Second Generation immigrants has automatically made me more sensible and keen to immigration, integration, identity and similar issues. I strongly felt the need of this documentary since Second Generations are currently discussed as Italy’s new phenomenon. This has made a whole generation invisible, a generation that is instead an integral part of the Italian society, and specifically in the case of Milan.

IT Il mio nome è Ariam Tekle, sono di origine Eritrea nata e cresciuta a Milano. Questo documentario nasce dalla necessità di raccontare l'esperienza di una generazione di figli di immigrati che è stata completamente ignorata. Far parte di quella che viene chiamata Seconda Generazione di immigrati credo mi porti automaticamente ad essere più sensibile ed interessata a tematiche come immigrazione,integrazione ed identità. La necessità di realizzare questo documentario l'ho sentita principalmente in quanto ad oggi in Italia si parla di Seconde Generazioni come un fenomeno nuovo. Questo porta a rendere invisibile una generazione che in realtà è parte integrante della società attuale italiana, in questo caso milanese.

FR Je m'appelle Ariam Tekle, je suis d'origine érythréenne, mais je suis née et j'ai été élevée à Milan. Ce documentaire vient d'un besoin de relater les expériences d'une génération d'enfants d'immigrés, réalité restée inconnue jusqu'ici. Faire partie de ce qu'on appelle la seconde génération d'immigrés m'a rendue automatiquement plus sensible aux problématiques liées à l'immigration, l'intégration et l'identité. J'ai ressenti fortement le besoin de réaliser ce documentaire depuis que l'on parle en Italie de cette seconde génération comme d'un nouveau phénomène. En effet, c'est toute une génération qui est invisible, alors qu'au contraire elle fait partie intégrante de la société italienne, et de la ville de Milan en particulier.

EN Why ''Appuntamento ai Marinai''?
Largo Marinai d’ Italia, located in the center of Milan, has been a meeting place for many of the protagonists. Afternoons and evenings spent chatting on benches or playing at the basketball court, Parco Marinai has become for them a symbolic place. The chosen title, in addition to the obvious reference to the past, aims to make the public part of this meeting. This documentary wants to be an intermediary arranging an appointment, where more elements may find and discover themselves: the past and the present, places, pictures, experiences, stories and people.
Hence why a rendezvous in Largo Marinai d’Italia, to meet and get to know the characters with their stories; through an audio visual work set to improve the understanding of the reality of foreign communities living in Italy for almost half a century, like the Eritrean one.

IT Perché ''Appuntamento ai Marinai''? Largo Marinai d'Italia, situato nel centro di Milano, è stato un punto di ritrovo per molti dei protagonisti. Pomeriggi e sere passate a chiacchierare alle panchine o a giocare al campo da basket, il parco Marinai è diventato per loro un simbolo di incontro.
Con la scelta del titolo, oltre al riferimento al passato, si vuole invitare il pubblico a questo incontro. Un documentario come intermediario che organizza un appuntamento, dove più elementi tra loro possono trovarsi, scoprirsi e conoscersi: passato e presente, luoghi, fotografie, esperienze, racconti e persone.
Ecco perché un rendez-vous in Largo Marinai d'Italia, per incontrare e conoscere i protagonisti con le loro storie; attraverso un lavoro audio visivo si vuole favorire la conoscenza di realtà di comunità straniere in Italia presenti ormai da quasi mezzo secolo, come quella eritrea.

FR Pourquoi « Appuntamento ai Marinai » ?Largo Marinai, situé dans le centre de Milan en Italie, a été un lieu de rencontre pour beaucoup des protagonistes. Des après-midi et soirées passés à discuter sur des bancs ou à jouer au terrain de basket-ball... Parco Marinai est devenu pour eux une place symbolique. Le titre choisi, en plus d'être une référence évidente au passé, vise à inviter le public à cette rencontre. Ce documentaire se veut un intermédiaire pour fixer un rendez-vous, où des éléments peuvent être découverts : le passé et le présent, les endroits, les images, les expériences, les histoires et les gens.Donc pourquoi un rendez-vous à Largo Marinai en Italie ? Pour rencontrer et apprendre à connaître les personnages et leurs histoires ; ce à travers un travail audiovisuel destiné à améliorer la compréhension de la réalité des communautés étrangères vivant en Italie depuis presque un demi-siècle, comme la communauté érythréenne. 

What We Need & What You Get

EN The foreseen budget planned for this project amounts to € 5000 and includes:

- Shooting

- Video editing / Post production

- Sound Correction

I kindly invite you to consider supporting my project and to take a look at the great prizes allocated for each contribution!

You should know: the project will still be carried out, even without reaching the desired budget. Getting the whole sum would allow me to remunerate for the work of this documentary.

IT Il budget previsto per questo progetto è di 5000€ e comprende :

- riprese di copertura/ultime interviste

- video editing

-post produzione

- sound correction

Vi invito a considerare di supportare il mio progetto e di dare uno sguardo ai fantastici premi previsti per ogni contributo!

Importante da sapere: nel caso in cui non riuscissi ad ottenere l'intero budget, porterò avanti la realizzazione del progetto. Ottenere l'intera somma mi permetterà di retribuire parte del lavoro per questo documentario.

FR Le budget prévisionnel pour ce projet est de 5000 euros, et inclut :

- le tournage

- la post-production

- la correction du son .

Je vous invite à soutenir ce projet et jeter un œil aux cadeaux offerts pour chaque contribution !

L'obtention de la somme totale désirée me permettrait d'être rémunérée pour la réalisation de ce documentaire. Il est toutefois à noter que le projet sera mené à bout, que ce budget soit atteint ou non. 

The Impact

EN A documentary that looks to the past to understand the present and build the future, resolving and overcoming the problems that have hindered the process of integration of the children of immigrants in Italy. The enormous enthusiasm shown by the people involved showed the importance of implementing and disseminating this documentary. Giving voice to those who had not yet have one on issues that closely affects them, could help in formulating a deeper reflection about it. Understanding the integration process is not a one way, but should be obtained by involving the host society making it the main observer and not an external act

IT Un documentario che guarda al passato per capire il presente e costruire un futuro risolvendo e superando le problematiche che hanno ostacolato il processo di integrazione dei figli di immigrati in Italia. L'enorme entusiasmo mostrato dalle persone coinvolte sottolinea l'importanza di realizzare e diffondere questo documentario. Dare voce a chi non è avuta su temi che li riguarda strettamente, può dare un contributo per una riflessione più approfondita a riguardo. Concepire il processo di integrazione non a senso unico ma coinvolgendo la società ospitante rendendolo attore principale e non osservatore esterno.

FR Un documentaire qui s'intéresse au passé pour comprendre le présent et construire le futur, trouvant une solution et surmontant les problèmes qui entravent le processus d'intégration des enfants des immigrants en Italie. L'énorme enthousiasme manifesté par les personnes impliquées dans ce projet montre l'importance de la mise en œuvre et de la diffusion de ce documentaire. Donner une voix à ceux qui n'en ont jamais eue sur des questions qui les affectent personnellement pourrait mener à une réflexion plus profonde à ce propos. Comprendre le processus d'intégration ne se fait pas d'une seule manière. Comprendre le processus d'intégration n'est pas une voie à sens unique. Cet exercice devrait impliquer la société accueillante, qui deviendrait alors l'observateur principal de ce phénomène et non pas un acteur externe. 

Other Ways You Can Help

EN

  • If you can't give us contribute, please share this campaign.
  • Check the web site www.appuntamentoaimarinai.com, the facebook page www.facebook.com/appuntamentoaimarinai, and share with your family, friends and all your contacts!
story_txt:
Short Summary
EN My name is Ariam Tekle, I am of Eritrean origin and I was born and raised in Milan. This documentary stems from the need to recount the experiences of a generation of immigrants’ children that so far has been ignored. I trust being part of what is known as the Second Generation immigrants has automatically made me more sensible and keen to immigration, integration, identity and similar issues. I strongly felt the need of this documentary since Second Generations are currently discussed as Italy’s new phenomenon. This has made a whole generation invisible, a generation that is instead an integral part of the Italian society, and specifically in the case of Milan.
IT Il mio nome è Ariam Tekle, sono di origine Eritrea nata e cresciuta a Milano. Questo documentario nasce dalla necessità di raccontare l'esperienza di una generazione di figli di immigrati che è stata completamente ignorata. Far parte di quella che viene chiamata Seconda Generazione di immigrati credo mi porti automaticamente ad essere più sensibile ed interessata a tematiche come immigrazione,integrazione ed identità. La necessità di realizzare questo documentario l'ho sentita principalmente in quanto ad oggi in Italia si parla di Seconde Generazioni come un fenomeno nuovo. Questo porta a rendere invisibile una generazione che in realtà è parte integrante della società attuale italiana, in questo caso milanese.
FR Je m'appelle Ariam Tekle, je suis d'origine érythréenne, mais je suis née et j'ai été élevée à Milan. Ce documentaire vient d'un besoin de relater les expériences d'une génération d'enfants d'immigrés, réalité restée inconnue jusqu'ici. Faire partie de ce qu'on appelle la seconde génération d'immigrés m'a rendue automatiquement plus sensible aux problématiques liées à l'immigration, l'intégration et l'identité. J'ai ressenti fortement le besoin de réaliser ce documentaire depuis que l'on parle en Italie de cette seconde génération comme d'un nouveau phénomène. En effet, c'est toute une génération qui est invisible, alors qu'au contraire elle fait partie intégrante de la société italienne, et de la ville de Milan en particulier.

story:
Where the money goes!

I will keep this part short and sweet, just like me:) You can contribute as little or as much as you possibly can because every penny helps and there are perks if you contribute a certain amount. 

  • Talent
  • Pre-production
  • Film
  • Post-preduction
  • Soundtrack production and original music score - (music really does make the movie)
  • Film Festivals  

 

What's in it for YOU?

Not only will you receive good karma and my undying gratidute, but also the awesome PERKS to the right of the page!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

I know that times are hard, and you may not be able to contribute financially, even if you really want to. But don't beat yourself up, you can still help by sharing my campaign with others! Also you can stop by my Facebook fanpage, Just Ask Ariel, and "Like" it while you're there!

story:
(Tutte le informazioni in Italiano piu' in basso)

In the tradition of great ensemble movies like "The Big Chill" and "Breakfast Club", we want produce this inspiring story about a group of Generation-X friends that get together to celebrate a wedding. Too focused on their personal failure and too ill-equipped to really help each other, they will face a traumatic event that will force them to rethink what really matters in their lives.

Nicole (mid 30s) is a struggling writer who misses her ex boyfriend; Chris (mid 30s) is a frustrated studio musician who misses his band; Mary (mid 30s) is a married yoga instructor who misses some excitement. They’ve been best friends since high school and they get together to celebrate the wedding of another high school BFF, Julia. 

Nicole brings some motivational books and a notepad, Chris his guitar and a bottle of Jack, Mary brings Ted (mid 40s), her workaholic husband, and a pregnancy test. 

It’s all fun and games until Adam (50s), Nicole’s ex, arrives with his new girlfriend, the exotic and clever Veronica (mid 20s), and Pandora’s box is opened. 

Now Nicole wants Adam back, Chris wants to get drunk and laid, and Mary confesses she’s having an affair. While everything goes sour, their personal dramas must be put on hold when tragedy hits and the wedding is suddenly cancelled.

 

And now, let's start to get personal.

My name is Simone Bartesaghi and I’m the director and producer of ‘It hits you when you know it'.

As you can see from my profile, I’m Italian, and yes, in case you were wondering, I know how to make a great pizza.

I moved to Los Angeles 12 years ago with my wife. At that time, I was chasing a dream. Now I am living it.

My projects and I have won several international awards (lately 'Best Screenplay' and 'Best Director to Watch' with the feature film RUN) and now I’m also a professor in filmmaking at the Santa Monica College and a published author of a book called “The Director’s Six Senses”. 

Why am I bragging so much about myself? It’s not my intention to brag, just to share with you the fact that I live and breath film 24/7, because truly, I love every aspect of this art form.

The reason why I embarked on this project is because I love the inspiration that derives from ensemble movies like “The Breakfast Club” and “The Big Chill”, and I don't think that there are enough out there anymore.

Thanks to the great story written by Elisa Manzini, I finally have the opportunity to make a movie in that tradition and I'll do my utmost to make it happen.

 

This project has already attracted the attention of very talented and creative artists.

Starting with the impeccable taste for talent, the Casting Director and industry veteran, Valerie McCaffrey, (known for American History X, Hard Candy, Dark City and Babe), to the creative depth of the Cinematographer, Jon Philion, (you've seen his work in the indy movie Hate Crime and, of course, his camera skills in the Avengers, Suicide Squad, and War of the Worlds) to the rich and vibrant Set Designer and industry veteran Barbara Dunphy, (The Men Without a Face, Reindeer Games and Monk).

 

To tell this great story, we need resources.

Thanks to the contribution and support of the Los Angeles Film School, we already have a place to shoot (in the legendary Main Stage) and have a portion of the equipment. 

But it’s not enough.

First of all, we need, of course, actors. Oh yes. Convincing, talented, passionate actors that will breath true life into the characters.

But we also need a crew to shoot, more props and decorations, a few more tools to make the movie look professional and… of course, we need to feed everybody!

And this is where you come in. We need your support and your donations to reach the budget for our project and to start principle photography on December 16th.

Here is how we are going to use your funds - based on the budget and the independent nature of our project, the money will be invested according to the following guidelines:

The reason why we decided to do a flexible crowdfunding campaign is based on two facts:

  1. We know our budget: we know what the least amount of money we need is and what the most amount of money we need is. Both budgets will allow us to create a great story but, as you can imagine, one allow us to access different talents and more 'technical toys' then the other. The story won't change, but the opportunities accepted by the market will change drastically. After all, this is still an industry, right?
  2. Investors are welcome: we are reaching out to different kinds of sources, and for the one of you that might be interested in investing in a movie, we are right here, ready to share all the details of our business plan with you. Contact us at sibamedia@gmail.com.

 

Why should you do it?

Well, if the story pitch is not enough and my italian charm didn’t cast a spell on you, well, we still have many perks for you, whatever the level of contribution you can and want to give. Depending on your contribution, you can enjoy the following; a signed copy of the script, a visit on the set, a special one-on-one encounter with the Director (myself), the title and credit of Executive Producer, and all the way up to the professional coverage and commentary of your own script. I'm sure you'll find further motivation in our perks list.

But to me, the thing that is most important is what I call the Intangible ROI, or, 'return of investment'. The Intangible ROI is a special kind of return that only movies can provide.

  1. First, a movie doesn’t have a due date. There is no expiration. When a movie is done, it’s forever.
  2. Second, it does have a life of its own. A movie can provide financial and emotional rewards for a life time, an eternity.
  3. Third, a movie can contribute to the enrichment of society and the enrichment of each other, and this art form is something we call ‘cinema'.

And of course, we are perfectly aware of the fact that not everyone can support us with money. But you can still help us!

Here is how:

  • Please spread the word about our campaign, and if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us!
  • If you have the capability to help us through 'in kind' services or products, contact us ASAP.
  • Share our campaign with your social network pals and through the Indiegogo share tools!

Whether you do it for us, for the special perks, or for your Intangible ROI, whatever your motivation is, please help us contribute to society with our little cautionary tale.

 

The list of perks that we have created tries to offer a variety of goods and services that will make you proud for supporting us. Take advantage of the professional experts involved in the project, and access a true production experience!

Considering that the characters of our movie all belong to Generation-X, and that their teenage years were between the mid 80s and 90s, we thought that it would be appropriate to pay homage to those years' best movies and legendary quotes. Are you ready?

Let's start with "I was born ready" (Big Trouble in Little China)...it is our Thank You!

We'll give you a big THANK YOU that grants you access to all our updates, along with a classic souvenir from the movie (the signed script) and the FULL SET EXPERIENCE where you can see what's happening on the set every day via streaming.

And, one of my favorites, the song game ('I feel the need, the need for speed'). This is a game that the characters play in the movie, and we are going to play it with you. Play the game with us and get the song from iTunes.

You can also take advantage and get connected with the Director and book author, again, myself, Simone Bartesaghi. I have won international festivals both as Director and as Writer, am the author of the book "The Director's Six Senses", and a directing and screenwriting teacher at the Santa Monica College. If you want to know more about the movie and how I prepared for it (Director's Vision), you can contribute, and we can have a one on one interview about how to become a director and you'll receive a copy of my book (Director's Six Senses). If you have one, I can even read your script and write out a special coverage and give constructive commentary on it (Directing Consulting).

The last group of perks are the biggest and best payback for your help. 

Everything gets real with the last group of perks: with Associate Producer, Executive Producer and Special Executive Guest, you'll get real movie credits, real contact with the crew, and even a trip to the set.

 

 

As with every film production, we are going to face many challenges and risks. The way we are mitigating these risks is through assembling a team of highly skilled and experienced professionals that have been in the trenches for a while and can navigate the treacherous waters of production. We're also taking advantage of the logistical and organizational opportunities that the crew members can access thanks to their wide and unique networks.

Thanks to these elements, and all our hard work, we believe and know we will succeed.

If, at any time during this adventure, it will become apparent that the movie cannot be produced and therefore the perks cannot be delivered, we decided that all the funds will be returned to the donors.

We truly think that, when you see this movie on the big screen, you'll be proud to be enlisted as one of the early supporters that believed in this great story.

 

Thank you everybody,

We wish you all the best,

Simone Bartesaghi and The Production Team

Avreste mai immaginato di poter partecipare ad un'impresa come questa? Stiamo facendo qualcosa di veramente straordinario e con il vostro supporto ci riusciremo. Cominciamo dall'inizio.

LA STORIA

Nella tradizione di “Il grande freddo”, “Breakfast Club” e "Compagni di Scuola" vogliamo raccontare una storia su un gruppo di amici della Generazione X che si ritrovano per celebrare un matrimonio. Troppo focalizzati sui loro fallimenti personali e con un bagaglio emotivo troppo pesante per aiutarsi a vicenda, i sei amici dovranno affrontare un evento traumatico che li costringerà a ripensare cosa è che conta veramente nella vita.  

Nicole è una squattrinata scrittrice a cui manca il suo ex, Adam; Chris è un musicista frustrato a cui manca la sua band; Mary è un’istruttrice di yoga sposata con Ted e le manca una vita eccitante; sono migliori amici fin dalla scuola superiore e si ritrovano per celebrare il matrimonio di Julia e Jimmy.

Nicole si porta dei libri e gli appunti per l'eternamente rinviato nuovo libro, Chris la chitarra e una bottiglia di whiskey per trovare l'ispirazione giusta, e Mary porta il marito, un avvocato arrivista e, di nascosto, un test di gravidanza.

L’atmosfera sembra allegra e giocosa finché arriva Adam che si presenta con Veronica, la sua nuova fidanzata, giovane, esotica, intraprendente. Ed il classico vaso di Pandora viene aperto rivelando sogni, drammi, segreti e fantasie.

Ora Nicole vuole riconquistare Adam, Chris vuole ubriacarsi e Mary confessa di tradire Ted.

Mentre tutto va a rotoli, i loro drammi personali vengono improvvisamente eclissati quando una tragedia mette in pericolo il matrimonio.

 

E ora, veniamo a noi!

Mi chiamo Simone Bartesaghi e sono il regista e produttore di “It hits you when you know it”. Sono italiano e da quando sono arrivato con mia moglie in America 12 anni fa mi sono rimboccato le maniche per avverare il mio sogno e per imparare a fare la pizza, perche' da queste parti non se ne trova.

Oggi sono un regista e sceneggiatore con diversi film alle spalle (Run, Downstream) e premi internazionali. Sono anche professore di regia e sceneggiatura al Santa Monica College e autore di un libro, che uscira' presto anche in Italia, che si intitola "The Director's Six Senses" (I sei sensi del regista).

Direi che il sogno lo sto proprio vivendo. E la pizza? Ebbene sì, anche gli Italiani che ci vengono a trovare me lo dicono, faccio una pizza da leccarsi i baffi!

Non vi dico tutte queste cose per vantarmi, ma solo per condividere con voi l’amore che ho per il cinema in tutti i suoi aspetti.

Il motivo per cui mi sono appassionato a questo progetto è perché amo i film d’insieme come “Il grande freddo”, “Breakfast Club” ed anche il nostrano "Compagni di Scuola" e non penso ce ne siano abbastanza oggigiorno. Sembra che manchi l'ispirazione giusta per raccontare questo tipo di storie.

Grazie alla bellissima storia scritta da Elisa Manzini ho finalmente l’opportunità di fare un film di quel genere.

Il progetto ha già attratto l’attenzione di molti artisti di talento, a partire dalla direttrice del casting Valerie McCaffrey (conosciuta per American History X, Hard Candy, Dark City e Babe), sino al direttore della fotografia Jon Philion (Avengers, Suicide Squad e La Guerra dei Mondi) passando per la scenografa e veterana dell’industria del cinema Barbara Dunphy (L’Uomo senza faccia, Monk e Reindeer Games).

 

ECCO COSA VI OFFRIAMO

Grazie alla passione di molti colleghi che hanno riconosciuto il valore del nostro progetto, siamo riusciti a mettere insieme un team assolutamente vincente e ad accedere a opportunita' uniche.

Siamo in contatto con grandi attori interessati alle parti (aggiornamenti sull'argomento in pochi giorni), inoltre avremo accesso al teatro di posa della Los Angeles Film School e all'utilizzo di equipaggiamento e attrezzature come telecamere, luci e carrelli.

Ma i tempi sono ristretti, dobbiamo girare entro la fine dell'anno o tutte queste opportunita' svaniranno.

Ed è qui che entrate in gioco voi. Ci servono il vostro aiuto e le vostre donazioni per raggiungere il nostro budget e iniziare a girare il 16 dicembre.

Essendo questo un film indipendente, ecco come useremo i fondi:

Se la passione per il cinema non e' abbastanza, se la storia che vogliamo raccontare non e' abbastanza, se la voglia di creare qualcosa di unico e speciale non e' abbastanza, allora abbiamo creato anche dei benefici tangibili (in Inglese li chiamano PERKS).

Li trovate nella colonna qui a destra. Hanno nomi 'eccentrici', sono infatti tutte citazionida film degli anni 80. Ogni "Perk", contiene una serie di 'benefici', dal copione firmato dalla sceneggiatrice e dal regista, ad una visita sul set, da un incontro col regista per avere dei consigli professionali a un credito come Produttore Esecutivo e tanto altro. Potrete trovare sicuramente qualcosa che vi interessa.

Per gli appassionati, vediamo se riconoscete i film dalle citazioni...

"I was born ready (Io sono nato pronto)" - donazione di $ 10 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto e un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda.

"Yippie Ki-Yay motherfuckers (Yippie Ki-Yay, figli di puttana!)" - donazione di $ 20 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e una copia digitale del copione firmata.

"Roads? Where we are going we don't need roads! (Strade? Dove stiamo andando non c'e' bisogno di strade!)"  - donazione di $ 25 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film e un invito alla proiezione privata.

"Bueller. Bueller. Bueller (Bueller. Bueller. Bueller)" - donazione di $40 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film e un invito alla proiezione privata.

"Nobody puts Baby in a corner (Nessuno puo' mettere Baby in un angolo)" - donazione di $ 80 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film, un invito alla proiezione privata e una canzone di Gun Hill Royals.

"How much love, sex, fun and friendship can a person take? (Quanto amore, sesso, divertimento e amicizia un uomo puo' sopportare?)" - donazione di $120 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film, un invito alla proiezione privata, un film degli anni 80 e l'esperienza virtuale sul set.

"My name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, prepare to die (Il mio nome e' Inigo Montoya)" - donazione di $200 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film, un invito alla proiezione privata, l'esperienza virtuale sul set e una copia del libro "The Director's Six Senses".

"We came. We saw. We kicked its ass! (Venimmo. Vedemmo. E lo inculammo!)" - donazione di $ 300 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film, un invito alla proiezione privata, l'esperienza virtuale sul set, una copia del libro "The Director's Six Senses" e la possibilità di chiacchierare per un'ora su Skype con il regista.

"Ok, campers rise and shine! (In piedi campeggiatori, camperisti e campanari!)" - donazione di $ 1,000 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film, un invito alla proiezione privata, una copia del libro "The Director's Six Senses", il credito di Associate Producer e una telefonata con la sceneggiatrice e uno degli attori per giocare al vostro Song Game (troviamo la canzone adatta a voi e ve la cantiamo al telefono).

"E.T. Phone Home (E.T. telefono casa)" - donazione di $ 2,500 - In cambio ricevete gli aggiornamenti sul progetto, un ringraziamento nei titoli di coda e su IMDb, una copia digitale del copione firmata, una copia digitale del film, un invito alla proiezione privata,  una copia del libro "The Director's Six Senses", l'ingrediente segreto della nostra ricetta, una canzone di Gun Hill Royals, un film degli anni 80, la telefonata con la sceneggiatrice e uno degli attori per trovare la vostra canzone del Song Game e il credito di Produttore Esecutivo.

Fateci sapere quanti ne avete indovinati. Ne arriveranno altri presto.

Per sapere cosa contiene ogni pacchetto basta cliccarci sopra e se volete versare la cifra, inserite i vostri dati e premete 'Submit Payment'.

Ma vi confesso che per me, la cosa più importante è ciò che chiamo l'Intangible ROI o ritorno di investimento intangibile, che solo un film può dare.

Per prima cosa un film non ha una data di scadenza, ma è per sempre; una volta che viene prodotto ha una vita autonoma e puo' essere visto e apprezzato da persone di paesi diversi, persone di generazioni diverse per ... sempre.

Secondo, il tipo di potenziale 'ritorno' non e' solo economico o finanziario, ma anche emotivo. La storia e' stata scritta per creare emozioni e per ispirare non solo quelli che l'hanno scritta e prodotta, ma soprattutto il pubblico. Non penso che ci sia momento migliore di oggi per contribuire alla nostra societa' con una storia che ispiri ottimismo.

Terzo, cosa c'e' di meglio di poter dire: ho contribuito ad un'opera che appartiene all'arte del cinema e di cui poter essere orgogliosi?

Siamo consapevoli che non tutti voi potrete darci un aiuto finanziario, ma potete aiutarci lo stesso. Come?

Spargendo la voce su questa campagna (e se avete domande, noi vi rispondiamo!), donando prodotti nel caso abbiate una linea di prodotti che possiamo mostrare nel film e condividendo questa campagna sui social media con i vostri amici e familiari.

Qualunque sia la vostra motivazione per darci una mano, aiutateci a realizzare questa nostra fiaba moderna, grazie infinite!

 

Simone Bartesaghi e il team di “It hits you when you know it”
story_txt:
(Tutte le informazioni in Italiano piu' in basso)
In the tradition of great ensemble movies like "The Big Chill" and "Breakfast Club", we want produce this inspiring story about a group of Generation-X friends that get together to celebrate a wedding. Too focused on their personal failure and too ill-equipped to really help each other, they will face a traumatic event that will force them to rethink what really matters in their lives.
Nicole (mid 30s) is a struggling writer who misses her ex boyfriend; Chris (mid 30s) is a frustrated studio musician who misses his band; Mary (mid 30s) is a married yoga instructor who misses some excitement. They’ve been best friends since high school and they get together to celebrate the wedding of another high school BFF, Julia. 
Nicole brings some motivational books and a notepad, Chris his guitar and a bottle of Jack, Mary brings Ted (mid 40s), her workaholic husband, and a pregnancy test. 
It’s all fun and games until Adam (50s), Nicole’s ex, arrives with his new girlfriend, the exotic and clever Veronica (mid 20s), and Pandora’s box is opened. 
Now Nicole wants Adam back, Chris wants to get drunk and laid, and Mary confesses she’s having an affair. While everything goes sour, their personal dramas must be put on hold when tragedy hits and the wedding is suddenly cancelled.
 

And now, let's start to get personal.
My name is Simone Bartesaghi and I’m the director and producer of ‘It hits you when you know it'.
As you can see from my profile, I’m Italian, and yes, in case you were wondering, I know how to make a great pizza.
I moved to Los Angeles 12 years ago with my wife. At that time, I was chasing a dream. Now I am living it.
My projects and I have won several international awards (lately 'Best Screenplay' and 'Best Director to Watch' with the feature film RUN) and now I’m also a professor in filmmaking at the Santa Monica College and a published author of a book called “The Director’s Six Senses”. 
Why am I bragging so much about myself? It’s not my intention to brag, just to share with you the fact that I live and breath film 24/7, because truly, I love every aspect of this art form.
The reason why I embarked on this project is because I love the inspiration that derives from ensemble movies like “The Breakfast Club” and “The Big Chill”, and I don't think that there are enough out there anymore.

Thanks to the great story written by Elisa Manzini, I finally have the opportunity to make a movie in that tradition and I'll do my utmost to make it happen.
 
This project has already attracted the attention of very talented and creative artists.
Starting with the impeccable taste for talent, the Casting Director and industry veteran, Valerie McCaffrey, (known for American History X, Hard Candy, Dark City and Babe), to the creative depth of the Cinematographer, Jon Philion, (you've seen his work in the indy movie Hate Crime and, of course, his camera skills in the Avengers, Suicide Squad, and War of the Worlds) to the rich and vibrant Set Designer and industry veteran Barbara Dunphy, (The Men Without a Face, Reindeer Games and Monk).
 

To tell this great story, we need resources.
Thanks to the contribution and support of the Los Angeles Film School, we already have a place to shoot (in the legendary Main Stage) and have a portion of the equipment. 
But it’s not enough.
First of all, we need, of course, actors. Oh yes. Convincing, talented, passionate actors that will breath true life into the characters.
But we also need a crew to shoot, more props and decorations, a few more tools to make the movie look professional and… of course, we need to feed everybody!
And this is where you come in. We need your support and your donations to reach the budget for our project and to start principle photography on December 16th.
Here is how we are going to use your funds - based on the budget and the independent nature of our project, the money will be invested according to the following guidelines:

The reason why we decided to do a flexible crowdfunding campaign is based on two facts:

We know our budget: we know what the least amount of money we need is and what the most amount of money we need is. Both budgets will allow us to create a great story but, as you can imagine, one allow us to access different talents and more 'technical toys' then the other. The story won't change, but the opportunities accepted by the market will change drastically. After all, this is still an industry, right?
Investors are welcome: we are reaching out to different kinds of sources, and for the one of you that might be interested in investing in a movie, we are right here, ready to share all the details of our business plan with you. Contact us at sibamedia@gmail.com.

 

Why should you do it?
Well, if the story pitch is not enough and my italian charm didn’t cast a spell on you, well, we still have many perks for you, whatever the level of contribution you can and want to give. Depending on your contribution, you can enjoy the following; a signed copy of the script, a visit on the set, a special one-on-one encounter with the Director (myself), the title and credit of Executive Producer, and all the way up to the professional coverage and commentary of your own script. I'm sure you'll find further motivation in our perks list.
But to me, the thing that is most important is what I call the Intangible ROI, or, 'return of investment'. The Intangible ROI is a special kind of return that only movies can provide.

First, a movie doesn’t have a due date. There is no expiration. When a movie is done, it’s forever.
Second, it does have a life of its own. A movie can provide financial and emotional rewards for a life time, an eternity.
Third, a movie can contribute to the enrichment of society and the enrichment of each other, and this art form is something we call ‘cinema'.

And of course, we are perfectly aware of the fact that not everyone can support us with money. But you can still help us!
Here is how:

Please spread the word about our campaign, and if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us!
If you have the capability to help us through 'in kind' services or products, contact us ASAP.
Share our campaign with your social network pals and through the Indiegogo share tools!

Whether you do it for us, for the special perks, or for your Intangible ROI, whatever your motivation is, please help us contribute to society with our little cautionary tale.
 



The list of perks that we have created tries to offer a variety of goods and services that will make you proud for supporting us. Take advantage of the professional experts involved in the project, and access a true production experience!
Considering that the characters of our movie all belong to Generation-X, and that their teenage years were between the mid 80s and 90s, we thought that it would be appropriate to pay homage to those years' best movies and legendary quotes. Are you ready?










Let's start with "I was born ready" (Big Trouble in Little China)...it is our Thank You!
We'll give you a big THANK YOU that grants you access to all our updates, along with a classic souvenir from the movie (the signed script) and the FULL SET EXPERIENCE where you can see what's happening on the set every day via streaming.
And, one of my favorites, the song game ('I feel the need, the need for speed'). This is a game that the characters play in the movie, and we are going to play it with you. Play the game with us and get the song from iTunes.
You can also take advantage and get connected with the Director and book author, again, myself, Simone Bartesaghi. I have won international festivals both as Director and as Writer, am the author of the book "The Director's Six Senses", and a directing and screenwriting teacher at the Santa Monica College. If you want to know more about the movie and how I prepared for it (Director's Vision), you can contribute, and we can have a one on one interview about how to become a director and you'll receive a copy of my book (Director's Six Senses). If you have one, I can even read your script and write out a special coverage and give constructive commentary on it (Directing Consulting).
The last group of perks are the biggest and best payback for your help. 
Everything gets real with the last group of perks: with Associate Producer, Executive Producer and Special Executive Guest, you'll get real movie credits, real contact with the crew, and even a trip to the set.
 


 

As with every film production, we are going to face many challenges and risks. The way we are mitigating these risks is through assembling a team of highly skilled and experienced professionals that have been in the trenches for a while and can navigate the treacherous waters of production. We're also taking advantage of the logistical and organizational opportunities that the crew members can access thanks to their wide and unique networks.
Thanks to these elements, and all our hard work, we believe and know we will succeed.
If, at any time during this adventure, it will become apparent that the movie cannot be produced and therefore the perks cannot be delivered, we decided that all the funds will be returned to the donors.
We truly think that, when you see this movie on the big screen, you'll be proud to be enlisted as one of the early supporters that believed in this great story.
 
Thank you everybody,We wish you all the best,Simone Bartesaghi and The Production TeamAvreste mai immaginato di poter partecipare ad un'impresa come questa? Stiamo facendo qualcosa di veramente straordinario e con il vostro supporto ci riusciremo. Cominciamo dall'inizio.LA STORIANella tradizione di “Il grande freddo”, “Breakfast Club” e "Compagni di Scuola" vogliamo raccontare una storia su un gruppo di amici della Generazione X che si ritrovano per celebrare un matrimonio. Troppo focalizzati sui loro fallimenti personali e con un bagaglio emotivo troppo pesante per aiutarsi a vicenda, i sei amici dovranno affrontare un evento traumatico che li costringerà a ripensare cosa è che conta veramente nella vita.  Nicole è una squattrinata scrittrice a cui manca il suo ex, Adam; Chris è un musicista frustrato a cui manca la sua band; Mary è un’istruttrice di yoga sposata con Ted e le manca una vita eccitante; sono migliori amici fin dalla scuola superiore e si ritrovano per celebrare il matrimonio di Julia e Jimmy.Nicole si porta dei libri e gli appunti per l'eternamente rinviato nuovo libro, Chris la chitarra e una bottiglia di whiskey per trovare l'ispirazione giusta, e Mary porta il marito, un avvocato arrivista e, di nascosto, un test di gravidanza.L’atmosfera sembra allegra e giocosa finché arriva Adam che si presenta con Veronica, la sua nuova fidanzata, giovane, esotica, intraprendente. Ed il classico vaso di Pandora viene aperto rivelando sogni, drammi, segreti e fantasie.Ora Nicole vuole riconquistare Adam, Chris vuole ubriacarsi e Mary confessa di tradire Ted.Mentre tutto va a rotoli, i loro drammi personali vengono improvvisamente eclissati quando una tragedia mette in pericolo il matrimonio. E ora, veniamo a noi!Mi chiamo Simone Bartesaghi e sono il regista e produttore di “It hits you when you know it”. Sono italiano e da quando sono arrivato con mia moglie in America 12 anni fa mi sono rimboccato le maniche per avverare il mio sogno e per imparare a fare la pizza, perche' da queste parti non se ne trova.Oggi sono un regista e sceneggiatore con diversi film alle spalle (Run, Downstream) e premi internazionali. Sono anche professore di regia e sceneggiatura al Santa Monica College e autore di un libro, che uscira' presto anche in Italia, che si intitola "The Director's Six Senses" (I sei sensi del regista).Direi che il sogno lo sto proprio vivendo. E la pizza? Ebbene sì, anche gli Italiani che ci vengono a trovare me lo dicono, faccio una pizza da leccarsi i baffi!Non vi dico tutte queste cose per vantarmi, ma solo per condividere con voi l’amore che ho per il cinema in tutti i suoi aspetti.Il motivo per cui mi sono appassionato a questo progetto è perché amo i film d’insieme come “Il grande freddo”, “Breakfast Club” ed anche il nostrano "Compagni di Scuola" e non penso ce ne siano abbastanza oggigiorno. Sembra che manchi l'ispirazione giusta per raccontare questo tipo di storie.Grazie alla bellissima storia scritta da Elisa Manzini ho finalmente l’opportunità di fare un film di quel genere.Il progetto ha già attratto l’attenzione di molti artisti di talento, a partire dalla direttrice del casting Valerie McCaffrey (conosciuta per American History X, Hard Candy, Dark City e Babe), sino al direttore della fotografia Jon Philion (Avengers, Suicide Squad e La Guerra dei Mondi) passando per la scenografa e veterana dell’industria del cinema Barbara Dunphy (L’Uomo senza faccia, Monk e Reindeer Games). ECCO COSA VI OFFRIAMOGrazie alla passione di molti colleghi che hanno riconosciuto il valore del nostro progetto, siamo riusciti a mettere insieme un team assolutamente vincente e ad accedere a opportunita' uniche.Siamo in contatto con grandi attori interessati alle parti (aggiornamenti sull'argomento in pochi giorni), inoltre avremo accesso al teatro di posa della Los Angeles Film School e all'utilizzo di equipaggiamento e attrezzature come telecamere, luci e carrelli.Ma i tempi sono ristretti, dobbiamo girare entro la fine dell'anno o tutte queste opportunita' svaniranno.Ed è qui che entrate in gioco voi. Ci servono il vostro aiuto e le vostre donazioni per raggiungere il nostro budget e iniziare a girare il 16 dicembre.Essendo questo un film indipendente, ecco come useremo i fondi:Se la passione per il cinema non e' abbastanza, se la storia che vogliamo raccontare non e' abbastanza, se la voglia di creare qualcosa di unico e speciale non e' abbastanza, allora abbiamo creato anche dei benefici tangibili (in Inglese li chiamano PERKS).Li trovate nella colonna qui a destra. story:
About Me

Hello, my name is Hutch Bailey and from a young age I have been passionate about photography. I moved to Fayetteville from Atlanta about 3 years ago and immediately wanted to share my view of Fayetteville with the world. As you can see from the short video, an iPhone camera can only do so much.

What We Need

I need $800 to buy a EOS Rebel T6i Video Creator Kit (linked)

I believe this is all I need to begin creating great and motivational videos and content.

If I get any funds over $800, those will be donated to http://wish.org 

 http://shop.usa.canon.com/shop/en/catalog/eos-rebel-t6i-dslr-18-55mm-is-stm-lens-rode-videomic-go-shotgun-microphone-video-kit

The Impact

My creations will inspire and empower those who need it most. My pictures and videos will show those people what they are capable of with drive and a little creativity.

story:
We’ve built the Queen’s Castle – now we have to fill it up!

Hey, remember back on the 22nd March, when Queen Constance Hall shared a link to rafikimwema.com with an impassioned plea to help raise funds to build a second safe house at our farm in Nakuru, Kenya, for sexually abused little girls? Of course you do, because what happened in the hours and day following her post were a demonstration of the very best of humankind and community.

Constance set forth a trickle of empathy, and what returned was a tidal wave of love, kindness and hope. By 10am the following morning our campaign to build a ‘Queen’s Castle’ had raised $150,000 – DOUBLE the original target of $75,000. And thanks to kindness and generosity of people just like you, $200,000 was raised in less than one month. Rafiki Mwema was able to build the ‘Queen’s Castle’ and so much more.



The ‘Queen’s Castle’ now stands tall – ready to provide refuge and a future to 19 very vulnerable young girls, however we need so much more than walls and a roof. The time has come to call on you for a little more help, because we need to furnish the ‘Queen’s Castle’ before the girls can move in.

We’ve crunched the numbers, and what we need is $35,000 so that we can provide items like beds, bedding, mosquito nets, a fridge, cutlery, plates, towels and so much more so that these young Queens may be afforded the dignity that simple creature comforts like these provide. By taking care of these needs for them – the needs that most of us don’t even have to think twice about in our own lives - we can allow them to focus on themselves, and begin healing from the unimaginable trauma that has been burdened upon them.

Need further motivation?

We are eternally grateful for the awareness that you bring to our cause with every share, every click, and every cent you are kind enough to bid for us.

So we don’t want to ask you to donate for nothing. We know the feeling of helping these kids is immeasurable in dollars, we really do, but we’d love to give something back too.

This gorgeous painting created by artist Cat Lee was originally created for our recent Event in Byron. It was auctioned off to a lucky winner who purchased it as a surprise for his wife ... who happens to be Constance Hall! #onyabill

We have permission from both artist Cat Lee and lucky winner Constance to reproduce this print named ‘Malkia Mtoto’ (small queen) to raise funds for our home.

So, here’s what we’re thinking, you can donate towards furnishing the ‘Queen’s Castle’ and receive this print in return!

Donate $25 – you’ll get an A5 sized print of ‘Malkia Mtoto’

Donate $50 – you’ll get an A4 sized print of ‘Malkia Mtoto’

Donate $100 – you’ll get an A3 sized print of ‘Malkia Mtoto’

Example of Print below.  Frame not included. 

We will also send you this card to explain where the money has gone in case you are gifting this to someone!

But, as always we want you to help however you can. You don't HAVE to purchase a print. If you would just like to make a donation no matter how big or small we appreciate anything you can do from as little as $1.. as we have seen with the success of the Queens Castle, every single dollar helps. 

You can help in many more ways

We know that money can be difficult to come by, and we truly do appreciate every single cent that you entrust to us for the care of these children.

If you can’t spare a cent today, we understand, and we want you to know that awareness, for us, is just as valuable. Please join us in our THUNDERCLAP on the day of the Queen's Castle opening!  Join up here and sign up to post the status to your facebook or twitter at the same time as many others to make the most impact!

Please join our online communities, please keep talking about us with your friends, please share our campaigns and please keep ‘Queening’ along with Constance and all of our ambassadors who share the work we are doing. It is so important, and we need you to keep doing it..

story:
Hey, my name is Glacier Rohrer. Since I was young, Star Wars has been a large part of my life. You couldn’t walk through my room without stepping on Yoda’s ears or someone’s lightsaber. I cried when Episode 3 came out but I couldn’t see it until the following week in theaters. I was obsessed with anything Star Wars I could get my hands on, including books and comics. I also bought a video camera at a very early age and started making short films, I loved writing scripts and bringing my ideas to a screen.

 A few years after Revenge of the Sith came out, my love started to fade. I got older and life became what is to be expected out of adulthood; hectic and stressful. Then, amazing news came: Disney unveiled they would be continuing the Star Wars Franchise in the form of 3 more movies, and on top of that, Star Wars story movies on the side. I was so ecstatic, after 2 years at college, I dropped out and got two full time jobs, saving money and putting everything I had into this project: Chaos Evolved. I was inspired again, the kid in me had emerged once more.

 A friend of mine, Matt Seames, sat down with me and in one night and day we wrote a script that was a work of art. I’m serious, this story will blow your mind, and I pray every day I can share it with all of my fellow fans. This campaign is so important to me, because of all the sacrifices I have made for it. I have spent over $20,000 just from personal expenses to make this film happen, because of my love for Star Wars and for film. This will be an achievement of a lifetime, and I want the contributors to know every donation matters. You have the chance to help fund quite possibly the greatest Star Wars feature length fan film to date, and win an opportunity to be on set with us for the whole ride! We hope you can be a part of what we are trying to accomplish, and take part in something in a galaxy far far away!

 

 

  • If at the end of our campaign, we do not reach out funding goal, the money you have donated will still go to all the respective departments, they simply will receive less per. All rewards however, will remain unaltered. We will make sure you are provided what you paid for, no excuses!

 

  • We absolutely need you guys to make this happen. Without donations, this project fails and we end up making a backyard lightsaber video. There have been a lot, and we mean ALOT of fan films that didn't go as big as they would have liked, or stopped production all together, due to money restraints and lack of resources. This is why there are only a handful of decent Star Wars fan films to date; they didn't fundraise the money. Star Wars is HUGE, and we hope to find thousands of fans like us to help change that for Chaos Evolved and future fan films to come.

 

Glacier Rohrer (Producer/Director/Writer/Actor)

Lilton Stewart III (Director of Photography/Editor)

Simoneau Wagner (Production Manager)

Michael McMahan (Sound Technician)

Devin Todd (Sound Editor/Graphics)

 

  • Making films is expensive and time consuming. Many of the people already involved in this project, use all their free time off work, to make sure things are running smoothly. We have overcome some big hurdles, but there are so many more to come. We can fight through this if we are financially set to tackle any and all obstacles we come to face. It may be weather, equipment and outfit malfunctions, or stress related breakdowns, but we will be okay if we work together and are aided by YOUR support. We are willing to give everything we have to ensure this movie happens.

 

Some of you amazing fans may not have the money to help us out, but that doesn't mean you can't contribute in other ways!

  • SPREAD the word about Chaos Evolved to friends and family, every person counts, and we would greatly appreciate a mention of our film to more people around the globe!
  • Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools as well, it only takes a second!
  • Let's make this thing viral!

If at the end of our campaign, we do not reach out funding goal, the money you have donated will still go to all the respective departments, they simply will receive less per. All rewards however, will remain unaltered. We will make sure you are provided what you paid for, no excuses!

Michael McMahan (Sound Technician)

Devin Todd (Sound Editor/Graphics)
 


Making films is expensive and time consuming. Many of the people already involved in this project, use all their free time off work, to make sure things are running smoothly. We have overcome some big hurdles, but there are so many more to come. We can fight through this if we are financially set to tackle any and all obstacles we come to face. It may be weather, equipment and outfit malfunctions, or stress related breakdowns, but we will be okay if we work together and are aided by YOUR support. We are willing to give everything we have to ensure this movie happens.
 


Some of you amazing fans may not have the money to help us out, but that doesn't mean you can't contribute in other ways!

SPREAD the word about Chaos Evolved to friends and family, every person counts, and we would greatly appreciate a mention of our film to more people around the globe!
Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools as well, it only takes a second!
Let's make this thing viral!

story:
For more than three years we have followed Rhodessa Jones and the Medea Project: Theater for Incarcerated Women/HIV Circle.  This remarkable, diverse ensemble of women worked together across colors, ages and backgrounds in their creation and performance of “Birthright?” - powerful stories of surviving rape, asserting their reproductive rights and living with HIV.

The women’s personal truths, their creative process and their performances are framed by the current political storm over choice - the fight to protect women’s reproductive rights and full access to quality health care. 

The “Birthright?” documentary project brings the Medea Project story to the screen, giving life and reach to their work beyond the Bay Area performances. 

Our goal is to reach a national audience with the work of Rhodessa and The Medea Project, and to provide advocates for women’s rights and health with compelling stories.  The project includes a full length documentary about the Medea project and their creation of "Birthright?,"  a video version of the complete performance at Brava Theater in SF,  short web-friendly stories excerpted from the film that focus on critical issues - choice, living with HIV and surviving rape - and an engagement guide tailored to diverse audiences. 

Advocacy groups will be provided with materials free of charge. We need your help to get this finished and available to communities across the country. 

TRAILER:

“Birthright?” is not content to simply shed light on the pervasive oppression of women and minorities; rather, it's intent on crushing it, and its method is through the rawness of their stories… aggressive, unapologetic, self-assured femininity.” San Francisco Chronicle

The Medea Project, founded and led by Cultural Odyssey’s Rhodessa Jones, is among the most provocative of contemporary theater workshops. The original idea for "Birthright?" grew out of conversations between the Medea Project and Planned Parenthood in the greater Bay Area. 

Rhodessa Jones: “We’ve learned that Planned Parenthood plays into the lives of many of the broken and wounded people. Our company is creating a tapestry, a patchwork quilt…sharing women's stories of survival.”

Many of the Medea project women - against all odds - have emerged from the shadows of addiction, violent abuse, jail and hopelessness to the sisterhood of Medea and the spotlight of the stage to tell their stories. The artistic vision documented is itself path-breaking - bringing together women of diverse experiences to find their voices and create professionally produced theater directly from their own lives. The women of the Medea Project are an inspiration.  Please join us in any way you can. If you cannot give, help spread the word. Use the share tools.  Share our campaign video and the "Birthright?" documentary preview. Email friends and family.


“In over thirty years of working professionally in media production and distribution, the Medea women bring the most compelling and unique story with which I’ve had the privilege to become involved.”   Bruce Schmiechen, Producer

The immediate funding goal of $24,500 will bring the documentary through story editing to final post-production. Donors of $20 or more will each get preview videos of excerpts from the “Birthright?”  theatrical performance. (If we reach beyond the editing stage goal via this campaign, all additional funds will go to completion and distribution. Contributions are through the 501c3 fiscal sponsor, Cultural Odyssey.)

Donations are tax-deductible, excepting material value of "perks."

Still photo credits: David Wilson
