story:
About 'Humans of Someone'

Every one of us is a central character in the story of our lives.

In the same story, there are peripheral characters who they have their own centralities - or stories where they are the central characters. It's both an infinite jest and a sigh, this life.
Which is to say that there is no periphery.

We're all at the peripheries of someone else's existence.
Every one ‘is’ a different movie. And I want to tell you the first few things about this one.

Humans of Someone (HOS) is a love story of strange madness.
The film follows a man who gets obsessed with a filmmaker whose films become inextricably entwined with his own life and the people in it.

And I always wanted the film to sort of feel like a void (or blank space) into which any viewer can insert himself/herself. To swim in its wandering, mildly distracted look at everything (and itself). To unmake it to feel real.
Where someone is anyone.

It's an epic of the intimate - and hence, universal.
So it only makes sense that we make this film a 'social experience'.

Watch the first look video of the film here.


About us

We, aum-i artistes, are a hybrid team of filmmakers, writers, musicians, designers, culture curators, insight sherpas, zombies (and even Yogis) who've come from all meaningful corners of the Earth to tell one beautiful story at time.

We’ve been doing a lot of work in the television and independent music industry for years, and wish to make something for ourselves now - something pure, something bespoke. 
Something that we've tried to convey in our prologue here.

If it moves you, please pledge as much as you can and be a part of our film.

 

How we made the film so far

HOS is a life-sized film and by no means a summer blockbuster. How could it be!
We started shooting the film with just one person, and cast the others as we went along.
It was made with the wonder lusts of a child and the restless energies of a housewife - over a course of more than a year across weekends and locations like a deprived circus camp.

Picture 2 Canon 5D Mark III cameras and a crew - the size of a modern urban family on a Diwali night (hardly 10 people at most).

If you were to come up with a metaphor for how we made this film, recall how you made your college magazine (without any funding from the college). It was like removing a kidney stone by google-searching ‘How To Remove A Kidney Stone’. If the patient survives, it's not because of his desperation or Google's genius, but simply because he wanted to.


Why we're here now

This film is being produced independent of any major studios, so every dollar raised by this campaign is going directly towards the budget.

HOS has been in development since 2014 and many variables have changed over the years. Location, crew and timelines have impacted the overall budget tremendously. 
But we have some incredible footage now that we're really excited about. 

And we need the money that we’re asking for to make the film we set out to make.
That’s why we’re here on Indiegogo and that’s why 100% of the money raised by this campaign will go towards making this film the best film it can possibly be. 


What we're asking

From directing to shooting to producing to editing, this has largely been a do-it-ourselves show for the better part of the last 2 years. We've courageously invested all our time, money, and imagination to get the project this far, and it's been the most rewarding experience of our lives, both personally and professionally.

What's completed at this point:
Script/Casting/Shoot/Production/Rough cut/Posters/Prologue video/First look video

Now, it's time to take the project to the next level and that's where you, our friends and the Indiegogo community, come in. We aim to raise a minimum of $30K to get to our next steps - finish post production and inspire a wide distribution and theatrical release. 

The following is the work we need the money for:

  • Title Graphics
  • Sound Design & Mix
  • Background Score
  • Color Correction
  • Trailer
  • Soundtrack Album
  • Premiere Screening 
  • Film festivals & Outreach
  • Distribution & Theatrical Release


What we're hoping

We wanted to make a film you’d use as a pillow to rest your heart on.
We made it so you could see (yourself in) it.

Looking back, may be we've achieved some of it. Because when I think about how we made this film, I can't help but think about where I'd be if we hadn't made it. I'd be living someone else's life - at some job, staring at a screen as if staring at it long enough would open it and let me out of there. If I got better at it, I'd have been promoted to Chief Staring Officer with insurance, a wife and kids who'd hate me and... okay, may be I'm getting too ahead of myself here.

But I guess that's one way of educating yourself in film - by surrounding yourself with prisons, you invariably start looking for half-open doors, half-open stories.

Because the distance between the life you ‘are’ living and the life you ‘could be’ living is the true measure of good art. I'm not saying that HOS is good art, but 'making' HOS or anything that gets you out of your misery is good art. (Van Gogh painted the ‘Starry Night’ while in an asylum.)

So I'm sitting here thinking - someone somewhere would read this and smile with me; global history and culture will drastically change with that smile. That person will want to pick up a camera or a paper and do something with it - the World will never be the same after that smile.

We wanted to make a film where you'd figure out your own ways of seeing. Because the history of cinema is the history of someone responding. So go ahead, respond :)
 

Other ways you can help

Even if you cannot financially support our campaign, we would be grateful if you can help us spread the word on your favorite social media hangouts - and find people who might want to contribute.

We wanted to make a film where you'd figure out your own ways of seeing.
Because the history of cinema is the history of someone responding.
So go ahead, respond :)
NOW. 

- Nitin Nath
Screenwriter/Actor, Humans of Someone

Key Cast & Crew

Nitin Nath, Madonna Sebastian, Meghna Nair, Methil Devika, Sudipto Balav,
Dhanya Varma, Ida Yoana, Ayaz Salim, Mathai Fenn.

Directed by Sumesh Lal/Story, Screenplay & Dialogues by Nitin Nath
DOP - Vipin Chandran/Editor - Alby Nataraj
Associate Directors - Aneej P Jayan, Parvati Prakash
Sound Designer - Krishnanunni
Costume Designers - Sunitha Prasanth, Remya Suresh
Art - Premkumar Kottakkal
Production Designers - Sherafudeen, Akhilesh KR
Designs - Gokulraj
An aum-i artistes production.

To know a little bit of everything about the film, follow facebook.com/humansofsomeone

To unmake it to feel real.Where someone is anyone.It's an epic of the intimate - and hence, universal.So it only makes sense that we make this film a 'social experience'.Watch the first look video of the film here.

About us
We, aum-i artistes, are a hybrid team of filmmakers, writers, musicians, designers, culture curators, insight sherpas, zombies (and even Yogis) who've come from all meaningful corners of the Earth to tell one beautiful story at time.We’ve been doing a lot of work in the television and independent music industry for years, and wish to make something for ourselves now - something pure, something bespoke. Something that we've tried to convey in our prologue here.If it moves you, please pledge as much as you can and be a part of our film.
 
How we made the film so far
HOS is a life-sized film and by no means a summer blockbuster. How could it be!We started shooting the film with just one person, and cast the others as we went along.It was made with the wonder lusts of a child and the restless energies of a housewife - over a course of more than a year across weekends and locations like a deprived circus camp.
Picture 2 Canon 5D Mark III cameras and a crew - the size of a modern urban family on a Diwali night (hardly 10 people at most).
If you were to come up with a metaphor for how we made this film, recall how you made your college magazine (without any funding from the college). It was like removing a kidney stone by google-searching ‘How To Remove A Kidney Stone’. If the patient survives, it's not because of his desperation or Google's genius, but simply because he wanted to.

Why we're here now
This film is being produced independent of any major studios, so every dollar raised by this campaign is going directly towards the budget.HOS has been in development since 2014 and many variables have changed over the years. Location, crew and timelines have impacted the overall budget tremendously. But we have some incredible footage now that we're really excited about. And we need the money that we’re asking for to make the film we set out to make.That’s why we’re here on Indiegogo and that’s why 100% of the money raised by this campaign will go towards making this film the best film it can possibly be. 

What we're asking
From directing to shooting to producing to editing, this has largely been a do-it-ourselves show for the better part of the last 2 years. We've courageously invested all our time, money, and imagination to get the project this far, and it's been the most rewarding experience of our lives, both personally and professionally.What's completed at this point:Script/Casting/Shoot/Production/Rough cut/Posters/Prologue video/First look videoNow, it's time to take the project to the next level and that's where you, our friends and the Indiegogo community, come in. We aim to raise a minimum of $30K to get to our next steps - finish post production and inspire a wide distribution and theatrical release. The following is the work we need the money for:

Title Graphics
Sound Design & Mix
Background Score
Color Correction
Trailer
Soundtrack Album
Premiere Screening 
Film festivals & Outreach
Distribution & Theatrical Release


What we're hoping
We wanted to make a film you’d use as a pillow to rest your heart on.We made it so you could see (yourself in) it.

Looking back, may be we've achieved some of it. Because when I think about how we made this film, I can't help but think about where I'd be if we hadn't made it. I'd be living someone else's life - at some job, staring at a screen as if staring at it long enough would open it and let me out of there. If I got better at it, I'd have been promoted to Chief Staring Officer with insurance, a wife and kids who'd hate me and... okay, may be I'm getting too ahead of myself here.
But I guess that's one way of educating yourself in film - by surrounding yourself with prisons, you invariably start looking for half-open doors, half-open stories.
Because the distance between the life you ‘are’ living and the life you ‘could be’ living is the true measure of good art. I'm not saying that HOS is good art, but 'making' HOS or anything that gets you out of your misery is good art. (Van Gogh painted the ‘Starry Night’ while in an asylum.)
So I'm sitting here thinking - someone somewhere would read this and smile with me; global history and culture will drastically change with that smile. That person will want to pick up a camera or a paper and do something with it - the World will never be the same after that smile.
We wanted to make a film where you'd figure out your own ways of seeing. Because the history of cinema is the history of someone responding. So go ahead, respond :) 
Other ways you can help
Even if you cannot financially support our campaign, we would be grateful if you can help us spread the word on your favorite social media hangouts - and find people who might want to contribute.We wanted to make a film where you'd figure out your own ways of seeing.Because the history of cinema is the history of someone responding.So go ahead, respond :)NOW. - Nitin NathScreenwriter/Actor, Humans of Someone
Key Cast & Crew
Nitin Nath, Madonna Sebastian, Meghna Nair, Methil Devika, Sudipto Balav,Dhanya Varma, Ida Yoana, Ayaz Salim, Mathai Fenn.Directed by Sumesh Lal/Story, Screenplay & Dialogues by Nitin NathDOP - Vipin Chandran/Editor - Alby NatarajAssociate Directors - Aneej P Jayan, Parvati PrakashSound Designer - KrishnanunniCostume Designers - Sunitha Prasanth, Remya SureshArt - Premkumar KottakkalProduction Designers - Sherafudeen, Akhilesh KRDesigns - GokulrajAn aum-i artistes production.To know a little bit of everything about the film, follow facebook.com/humansofsomeone

story:
How it started…

My name is Arkadius. I'm a 3D designer and a barista. I've spent few years of my life making coffee as a barista, coffee event manager, and coffee shop manager. One of the things I have learned is the importance of efficiency. After seeing advancements made with the espresso machines, more barista tools designed to help protect barista's wrists, I decided to challenge the way we "coffee makers" clean the portafilter after each espresso. 

 

. . . 

After almost 2 years of prototyping and 7 iterations of QuinSpin here we are :)

 

. . .

QuinSpin - actually does the job it's designed to do! :) It’s a fast, silent, clean, and healthy way to clean your coffee basket! 

 

. . .

Together with my small team of hardworking people, we are running pre-production with help of different suppliers. We're using HP MJF technology at the moment which is a high-quality type of 3D additive manufacturing

.

.   .   .

Let me clear that we have UK and PCT patents pending for specific features of QuinSpin, so we will be using HP MJF Technology anyway for our drills and brushes. We want to make sure you get the right fit for your coffee basket!

.   .   .

QuinSpin's features: 

Drill designed according to the geometry of your coffee basket 

 

Brush head trimmed to fit your coffee basket

 

Interchangeable heads

.   .   .

Correct technique of use:

1.Drill head ->
2. Tiny pause when lifting allows the motor to slow down a bit. ->
3. Proceed to brush

.   .   .

Our patent-pending brushes can be refurbished to help reduce plastic waste.
The brush should last min 10 000 cycles or longer. 
TIP: If it's spinning - don't press it harder. Using force not gonna help with better results. You can only slow down the motor and deform the brush faster!

Be gentle :) It's about the technique, not force! 

 

We will be providing bristles replacement as an Add On.

Smile :)

 

 

What we'd love…

We would LOVE for you to see the benefit of QuinSpin! 
After getting quotes from multiple companies that can help us grow we need to raise around 60 000 GBP. It's around 300 crowdfunded QuinSpins. 

The money would go for:

2 mold injection forms ( 1 for the QuinSpin main unit and the 2nd one for a "family" mold for the smaller components) (This is the longest process that can last up to 10 weeks)

Designing custom packaging for QuinSpin ( Min order quantity 1500 pieces. Lead time around 3-4 weeks)

Setting up the assembly line, warehouse and employing more people to our team

We are also considering our own MJF production. HP in the UK is ready to help us out, but it all depends on how well our campaign will do! We will keep you posted!

 

What's in it FOR YOU...

First you can be proud you're helping to bring QuinSpin - the missing piece to efficiency - to LIFE!

and of course some PERKS :)

QuinSpin - portafilter cleaner, so you can finally stop exploiting your wrists, get rid of the dirty clothes, and stop making your hands look like you're a car mechanic! :)

 

ADD - ONs

 

 

Feedback…

Your support is precious to us! We know QuinSpin will benefit the coffee community worldwide! Not only speeding up the process of cleaning coffee baskets, but also eliminating the sudden noise of banging and protecting your wrists! 

We have over 100 pre-production QuinSpins already roaming in the world and constantly providing feedback. 

 

 

Check out Instagram profiles below for more feedback:

@Barista Group Australia

@SocraticCoffee - Australia  

@Kliewe coffee elements - Germany

@MrEspresso - Greece 

@Chalk Coffee - United Kingdom

And our profile  @quin.spin for more feedback from around the world!
 

One final push…

We have waited long with the launch of the crowdfunding campaign. We wanted to test QuinSpin in real-life conditions and be sure it does the job it’s designed to do. For the last 2.5 years, we were making mistakes so once our campaign is launched, there would be no surprises.  We have found suppliers and manufacturers, who provided us with quotes and lead times.  All we need now is for a few hundred people to see the benefits of QuinSpin!
Can you see it?

If you aren’t able to contribute to our campaign, please spread the word. Maybe you know some baristas or your friend or family owns a coffee shop? We’d appreciate all the effort :)

Thank you!

story:
Following two successful campaigns, Ensō Essential is our next collection of pure titanium cutlery sets made with affordability in mind. Ensō Collection was created to promote healthier eating and eco-sustainability.



Whether it’s fine dining, daily breakfast or a picnic with friends, enjoy Enso’s comfort and style on every occasion. Made with highest-quality pure medical grade titanium, Ensō brings the experience of fine dining to your table. 



When titanium is exposed in air, a very thin layer of titanium atoms interact with the oxygen to create a nano-coating of titanium dioxide (Titania). Titania-based nanocomposites subjected to light are remarkably effective in repelling microbial growth. Making your food not only safer to eat, but tastes fresher and better.
 


Remember the weird taste of stainless steel? Titanium is completely tasteless — it’s almost like a natural part of you. It's used widely in high-end jewelry because it causes no allergic reaction — good news if you struggle to find a set without stainless steel and nickel.



With a high quality portable carrying case, now you can bring Ensō with you anytime, anywhere.



Titanium is natural, non-toxic and eco-friendly material. Ensō is made from pure medical grade titanium which is considered as the most biocompatible metal due to its non-corrosive nature.



It's almost indestructible and it can withstand seawater for 4000 years without any corrosion. Needless to say — it's dishwasher safe. You can pass it onto your children and their children’s children. 4000 years is a long time in an era of one-time-use disposable cutleries. That’s why we provide a lifetime warranty on every Ensō set.
 




We are expanding our colour pallet with two additional options from the start — Gold & Stealth Black. These are special limited editions made for Kickstarter backers only!

PressKit

For Press Inquiries: ti22@thingyfy.com

For Wholesale Inquiries: ti22@thingyfy.com

For General Inquiry & Support: info@thingyfy.com







This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 800+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $350MM raised between them.

story:
The Garrnish Pesticide Purifier is the game-changing way to remove more than 90% of common pesticides, and a massive 99.9% of Chlorpyrifos and Dichlorvos pesticides. The future of clean eating is here!

Did you know that almost all of your fruits and veggies are covered with pesticides even after you wash them? Even certified organic produce use "organic pesticides". 

Conventional blueberries can contain as many as 52 different types of pesticide residues!

Use the Garrnish Pesticide Purifier to remove up to 99% of common pesticides, so you can eat clean with peace of mind. 

Electrolysis splits water molecules into (H+) and (OH-) ions, resulting in tiny microbubbles filling the basin. 

This electrolyzed water creates an alkaline environment, and along with the existing chlorine in your tap water, breaks the benzene ring, or the molecular structure of chemical pesticides rendering them into harmless non-toxic substances easily washed away with water.

Don’t have chlorine in your water? No problem! Just add a pinch of table salt. 

Gotta Love Science! 

 

 

We even sent the Garrnish Pesticide Purifier to SGS, the world’s leading lab testing, inspection, and certification organization headquartered in Switzerland.

SGS lab tests showed that over 99.9% of the most common pesticides, Chlorpyrifos and Dichlorvos, were removed after just 10 minutes!

Each person commenting below has actually used our Garrnish Pesticide Purifier for around 8 months. We gave them prototypes to use in daily life and got their feedback. 

 

The Garrnish Pesticide Purifier is easy to use. Simply fill the basin with water, add your produce and turn it on. All you have to do is give it a stir once in a while!

While organic produce is overall better than conventional, there are actually over 20 chemicals used in organic farming. Pesticide sprays from airplanes can also drift onto nearby organic farms.

Despite how convenient they seem, produce washes and sprays have been tested to be ineffective at removing pesticides. They even tend to leave their own residues behind, so the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) recommends not to use them. 

Dispense with the mess and keep your kitchen looking as clean as your purified veggies. After use, just give the purifier a quick rinse and you're good to go.

The Garrnish Pesticide Purifier's clean, modern design and wireless charging dock blends into any kitchen, you can even fold it up for easy storage.

 

After working on air purification products for the past 8 years, we wanted to focus on other aspects of human health. Food has always been an obsession of ours, but the abundance of pollutants in our food, specifically chemical pesticides, worries us deeply. 

 

In California, we’re blessed with easily accessible organic foods, but many have still been tested to contain pesticides. Conventional produce can contain up to 50 different types of pesticides on a single fruit. 

 

Just Google “pesticides on blueberries”! The US uses 85 different pesticides that are outlawed in many other countries in Europe. 

 

We couldn’t settle with that being the status quo. To us food is personal, and food should be nourishing.

 

After years of hard work, we’re so proud to launch the Garrnish Pesticide Purifier. 

 -Henry, Founder of Garrnish

 

 

Disclaimer: This product does not claim to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent diseases.

story:
Due to Popular Demand

Last year we introduced BARE Knives. High-quality, affordable, and sustainable cookware.  We were blown away to reach our funding goal within 24 hours. Since then we've been getting emails asking when we would produce more knife types.  So, not wanting to disappoint, we're back. And we have all the knives you'll ever need!

 

We've spent the last year testing, redesigning, and retesting. We're ready to introduce BARE Knives 2.0. The be-all and end-all of knife sets. Our knives are razor-sharp, carbon-negative, and come with a lifetime warranty. The mountain pattern on each knife stops most foods from sticking. And honestly, it just looks gorgeous. 

You'll buy directly from us. With no middlemen and a crowdfunding volume discount, you get an incredible one-time-only price.

 

What Our Backers Say

We are very proud of a 4.7 / 5.0 average rating from our backers. Our previous campaign was a success thanks to our amazing backers. We have used all their feedback in designing our knife set and improving our products.

 

But My Butter Knife Also Works?

Sure, you can cut a sirloin steak with a cheap plastic paring knife and some elbow grease. You might even enjoy the steak. But what if we could make slicing that steak enjoyable too!? And that's just it, you're supposed to enjoy cooking. 

Before you know it, you'll even want to slice some vegetables! We all know: homemade food is healthier food. We want you to enjoy cooking. And with the right tools, it's even faster than ordering in.

 

The Right Knife For The Job

A good set of kitchen knives will last you a lifetime. To ensure every kitchen task is covered we designed a 5-piece knife set. Check out the sharp details that make each knife unique!

These five knives combined, cover the complete spectrum of kitchen tasks.  There are, however, two additional knives we absolutely love. 

The Nakiri is perfect for cutting straight slices or julienne. It's the perfect vegetable knife. The Kiritsuke on the other hand excels at meat and fish. Cutting sashimi or a large piece of meat, this 10-inch sword makes easy work of it.

We are aware you might have never heard of these knives, and probably have never seen the need for them. But we know how amazing and unique these knives are and we want you to have them. Because we reached our stretch goals, everyone who pledged for a 5 piece set will receive these knives for free.  These knives make cooking so much more fun. We would feel bad not getting them to you.

 

How We Maintain An Honest Price

Traditionally retailers mark up the products they sell between 50 and 100%. This means you could be paying double for the same goods. This doesn't sit right with us.

Separately these 5 knives will cost more than €300,-.  If we reach our stretch goals the 7 knives you'll receive have a combined MSRP of €483! We're offering our complete set to you for only €149,-. We can offer you this price because we ship directly to you, unlike traditional retailers. No middlemen or retailer markup means more knives for your money. 

With your pledges, we are able to manufacture a large batch of knives. Because of the large batch size, we are able to reduce production costs. This means even more discount.

What Makes Our Knives Great

We have designed our knives for a lifetime of use. Below you can find all the nitty-gritty design details. 

 

Our Manufacturing Process

Under tremendous pressure and heat, a steel blank is imprinted with our unique mountain pattern. This does three things. Firstly, through a mechanism called 'work hardening', it hardens the surface of the knife steel. Secondly, the mountain pattern reduces surface tension during cutting, which means food does not stick as much. Lastly, the mountain pattern signifies our sustainable approach. 

The blanks are then reheated, quenched, and tempered to 58HRC. Next, we grind the primary bevel under continuous water cooling. After fitting and finishing the hardwood handle our knives are sharpened by hand.

 

Sustainable Production

We believe in responsible production. We compensate for all CO2 emitted making and shipping our knives 10 times over. Last year we compensated more than 33.000 kg of CO2. That's about as much as a car driven around the planet 9 times. We do this because we believe companies should take responsibility for their emissions. 

We invest in tree planting projects to offset our carbon footprint 10 times. Planting trees is an effective way to compensate for carbon emissions. A tree absorbs C02 from the air and releases oxygen during its lifetime. Trees also provide a habitat for various species of animals. 

 

The Rewards

 

Add-ons 

 

The Strip

Our magnet strip makes sure your knives are stored safely and will not get damaged banging around in a drawer.  Easily holds your full set. Made from natural Acacia hardwood. The magnet strip measures 45 x 6.5 x 2.5 cm (17.7 x 2.5 x 1 inch). Mounting hardware is included!

 

The Block

Ahh yes, the block... a 4 kg heavy, solid wood, magnetic knife block. A commercial nightmare. Expensive to manufacture, and difficult to ship. Try telling that to an engineer who just spent the afternoon gleefully thinking up formulas to find the optimal width to height ratio and magnetic holding force for a knife block. 

Traditional knife blocks have three big issues:

They get unsanitary on the inside because you can not clean the slots.  

You can never see what knife you are reaching for. 

You have a fixed number of slots, which means you can't store any extra knives. 

Max tried to solve all the problems at once.  So after 26 concepts (yes, really, 26 different knife blocks), Max concluded that the most efficient solution to these problems is to have a solid wood block with magnets on all sides.  It's super easy to clean and it can store all the knives you'll ever need in plain sight. 

Our first reaction was;  can't we make it a little smaller? To which Max's reaction was a list of formulas that proved any smaller or lighter would result in the block tipping when grabbing a knife. At the end of the day, the numbers man is usually right. Therefore the block measures 27 x 15 x 15 cm (10.5 x 6 x 6 inch).

So that is how we ended up with a solid 8-pound knife block. We absolutely love the look and feel, and (especially Max) would love to ship them to you. However, we can't produce the block in small batches due to the tooling cost. This is why it is a stretch goal that will be unlocked if we're lucky enough to reach €200.000,-.

 

How We Got Here

We have spent the last year developing knives and testing prototypes. We asked our backers for feedback and used their input to guide our process. By testing and redesigning we make sure each knife is perfectly engineered for its specific purpose.

We have improved our manufacturing process to ensure every knife is razor-sharp right out of the box. 

 

What We Need

Materials have been sourced, designs have been finalized and our manufacturing partner in China is ready to rock. We need to produce a large volume of knives to be able to sell our set at the incredible discount we're offering. Only through volume, we are able to reduce production costs to the point that you get the knives you deserve for the BARE minimum. (pun intended)

Timeline

We'll ship all rewards January. Our main focus is quality, we stand behind our products. We'll not ship a single knife until we are satisfied it exceeds our quality standards.  On our last campaign, we shipped about a month later than planned due to the global pandemic, despite our best efforts. This time around we're starting our campaign a month earlier to ensure we're able to deliver on time. 

 

Customer Service

We believe in customer care. We aim to make sure everyone who supports us by backing our campaign gets exactly what they were promised.  Anything less is unacceptable. Don't believe us? Below are few reviews we received on our last campaign. 

 

About Us

Four years ago we started BARE Cookware with the goal to develop high-quality and sustainable cookware. We think that having good tools is half the work, and we want everyone to be able to afford good tools. 

We're of the opinion that cooking can and should be fun. Having the right tools can make it even more fun.  Having fun in the kitchen makes leading a healthy lifestyle easy!

We used the feedback of our amazing community to develop the ultimate set of kitchen knives. Taking good care of our knives makes them last a lifetime. Therefore we have created a learning center on our website which covers all knife-related topics. From cutting techniques to sharpening tips to hardwood handle maintenance. We've got you covered.

 

Return policy. Indiegogo is a platform that allows innovators to offer their creations and ideas at discounted prices. These funds go towards initiating production and launching of the product, resulting in a product that the backer can enjoy. In accordance with Indiegogo Terms of Use, we will not offer refunds or returns for items that are not defective. However, in the event that you receive a faulty item, you are welcome to contact us at info@barecookware.com

Global Shipping. We are happy to ship worldwide. The shipping rate to your country will be indicated in the check-out menu when making a pledge for this campaign. Please note that the price of the item does not include additional duty and taxes that may apply as per local laws of importation.

Rewards will be shipped from the Netherlands, the UK, and the US. This means backers from the EU, the UK, and the US will not encounter any duties or VAT.
story_txt:
Due to Popular Demand
Last year we introduced BARE Knives. High-quality, affordable, and sustainable cookware.  We were blown away to reach our funding goal within 24 hours. Since then we've been getting emails asking when we would produce more knife types.  So, not wanting to disappoint, we're back. And we have all the knives you'll ever need!
  
We've spent the last year testing, redesigning, and retesting. We're ready to introduce BARE Knives 2.0. The be-all and end-all of knife sets. Our knives are razor-sharp, carbon-negative, and come with a lifetime warranty. The mountain pattern on each knife stops most foods from sticking. And honestly, it just looks gorgeous. 
You'll buy directly from us. With no middlemen and a crowdfunding volume discount, you get an incredible one-time-only price.
 

What Our Backers Say
We are very proud of a 4.7 / 5.0 average rating from our backers. Our previous campaign was a success thanks to our amazing backers. We have used all their feedback in designing our knife set and improving our products.

 

But My Butter Knife Also Works?
Sure, you can cut a sirloin steak with a cheap plastic paring knife and some elbow grease. You might even enjoy the steak. But what if we could make slicing that steak enjoyable too!? And that's just it, you're supposed to enjoy cooking. 
Before you know it, you'll even want to slice some vegetables! We all know: homemade food is healthier food. We want you to enjoy cooking. And with the right tools, it's even faster than ordering in.


 
The Right Knife For The Job
A good set of kitchen knives will last you a lifetime. To ensure every kitchen task is covered we designed a 5-piece knife set. Check out the sharp details that make each knife unique!

These five knives combined, cover the complete spectrum of kitchen tasks.  There are, however, two additional knives we absolutely love. 

The Nakiri is perfect for cutting straight slices or julienne. It's the perfect vegetable knife. The Kiritsuke on the other hand excels at meat and fish. Cutting sashimi or a large piece of meat, this 10-inch sword makes easy work of it.
We are aware you might have never heard of these knives, and probably have never seen the need for them. But we know how amazing and unique these knives are and we want you to have them. Because we reached our stretch goals, everyone who pledged for a 5 piece set will receive these knives for free.  These knives make cooking so much more fun. We would feel bad not getting them to you.
 

How We Maintain An Honest Price
Traditionally retailers mark up the products they sell between 50 and 100%. This means you could be paying double for the same goods. This doesn't sit right with us.
Separately these 5 knives will cost more than €300,-.  If we reach our stretch goals the 7 knives you'll receive have a combined MSRP of €483! We're offering our complete set to you for only €149,-. We can offer you this price because we ship directly to you, unlike traditional retailers. No middlemen or retailer markup means more knives for your money. 
With your pledges, we are able to manufacture a large batch of knives. Because of the large batch size, we are able to reduce production costs. This means even more discount.

What Makes Our Knives Great
We have designed our knives for a lifetime of use. Below you can find all the nitty-gritty design details. 

 
Our Manufacturing Process
Under tremendous pressure and heat, a steel blank is imprinted with our unique mountain pattern. This does three things. Firstly, through a mechanism called 'work hardening', it hardens the surface of the knife steel. Secondly, the mountain pattern reduces surface tension during cutting, which means food does not stick as much. Lastly, the mountain pattern signifies our sustainable approach. 
The blanks are then reheated, quenched, and tempered to 58HRC. Next, we grind the primary bevel under continuous water cooling. After fitting and finishing the hardwood handle our knives are sharpened by hand.

 
Sustainable Production
We believe in responsible production. We compensate for all CO2 emitted making and shipping our knives 10 times over. Last year we compensated more than 33.000 kg of CO2. That's about as much as a car driven around the planet 9 times. We do this because we believe companies should take responsibility for their emissions. 
We invest in tree planting projects to offset our carbon footprint 10 times. Planting trees is an effective way to compensate for carbon emissions. A tree absorbs C02 from the air and releases oxygen during its lifetime. Trees also provide a habitat for various species of animals. 

 
The Rewards

 
Add-ons 


 
The Strip
Our magnet strip makes sure your knives are stored safely and will not get damaged banging around in a drawer.  Easily holds your full set. Made from natural Acacia hardwood. The magnet strip measures 45 x 6.5 x 2.5 cm (17.7 x 2.5 x 1 inch). Mounting hardware is included!
 
The Block
Ahh yes, the block... a 4 kg heavy, solid wood, magnetic knife block. A commercial nightmare. Expensive to manufacture, and difficult to ship. Try telling that to an engineer who just spent the afternoon gleefully thinking up formulas to find the optimal width to height ratio and magnetic holding force for a knife block. 
Traditional knife blocks have three big issues:
They get unsanitary on the inside because you can not clean the slots.  
You can never see what knife you are reaching for. 
You have a fixed number of slots, which means you can't store any extra knives. 
Max tried to solve all the problems at once.  So after 26 concepts (yes, really, 26 different knife blocks), Max concluded that the most efficient solution to these problems is to have a solid wood block with magnets on all sides.  It's super easy to clean and it can store all the knives you'll ever need in plain sight. 

Our first reaction was;  can't we make it a little smaller? To which Max's reaction was a list of formulas that proved any smaller or lighter would result in the block tipping when grabbing a knife. At the end of the day, the numbers man is usually right. Therefore the block measures 27 x 15 x 15 cm (10.5 x 6 x 6 inch).
So that is how we ended up with a solid 8-pound knife block. We absolutely love the look and feel, and (especially Max) would love to ship them to you. However, we can't produce the block in small batches due to the tooling cost. This is why it is a stretch goal that will be unlocked if we're lucky enough to reach €200.000,-.
 
How We Got Here
We have spent the last year developing knives and testing prototypes. We asked our backers for feedback and used their input to guide our process. By testing and redesigning we make sure each knife is perfectly engineered for its specific purpose.
We have improved our manufacturing process to ensure every knife is razor-sharp right out of the box. 

 
What We Need
Materials have been sourced, designs have been finalized and our manufacturing partner in China is ready to rock. We need to produce a large volume of knives to be able to sell our set at the incredible discount we're offering. Only through volume, we are able to reduce production costs to the point that you get the knives you deserve for the BARE minimum. (pun intended)
Timeline
We'll ship all rewards January. Our main focus is quality, we stand behind our products. We'll not ship a single knife until we are satisfied it exceeds our quality standards.  On our last campaign, we shipped about a month later than planned due to the global pandemic, despite our best efforts. This time around we're starting our campaign a month earlier to ensure we're able to deliver on time. 

 
Customer Service
We believe in customer care. We aim to make sure everyone who supports us by backing our campaign gets exactly what they were promised.  Anything less is unacceptable. Don't believe us? Below are few reviews we received on our last campaign. 

 
About Us
Four years ago we started BARE Cookware with the goal to develop high-quality and sustainable cookware. We think that having good tools is half the work, and we want everyone to be able to afford good tools. 
We're of the opinion that cooking can and should be fun. Having the right tools can make it even more fun.  Having fun in the kitchen makes leading a healthy lifestyle easy!

We used the feedback of our amazing community to develop the ultimate set of kitchen knives. Taking good care of our knives makes them last a lifetime. Therefore we have created a learning center on our website which covers all knife-related topics. From cutting techniques to sharpening tips to hardwood handle maintenance. We've got you covered.
 
Return policy. Indiegogo is a platform that allows innovators to offer their creations and ideas at discounted prices. These funds go towards initiating production and launching of the product, resulting in a product that the backer can enjoy. In accordance with Indiegogo Terms of Use, we will not offer refunds or returns for items that are not defective. However, in the event that you receive a faulty item, you are welcome to contact us at info@barecookware.com
Global Shipping. We are happy to ship worldwide. The shipping rate to your country will be indicated in the check-out menu when making a pledge for this campaign. Please note that the price of the item does not include additional duty and taxes that may apply as per local laws of importation.
Rewards will be shipped from the Netherlands, the UK, and the US. This means backers from the EU, the UK, and the US will not encounter any duties or VAT.

story:
Welcome: MANOLI Cast Iron Skillet with a quick-release wooden handle for everyday use. 

Enjoy the safety and convenience of MANOLI Skillet. Equipped with a removable handle that includes a quick-release mechanism, the MANOLI Skillet lets you do your best cooking all while preventing yourself from getting burned. The cast iron used in this design allows this frying pan to withstand the harshest conditions, delivering an ultimate long-lasting experience. Use MANOLI Skillet on any surfaces, from your kitchen oven to a campfire, and take it with you to enjoy your time with family and friends.  

The MANOLI Skillet is made of a single piece of cast iron and has a natural non-stick coating. Use it for cooking and baking pleasure.

MANOLI is suitable for any type of kitchen ovens, from gas to induction. You can also put it on the grill, take it on a hike and use it on an open fire, and your hands will always be safe.

You can use MANOLI as a baking dish for anything with its removable handle: from baked goods to meats and desserts. It fits easily in any oven.

Thanks to the natural non-stick coating, this skillet will last you for years even with daily food preparation. MANOLI is also a healthier alternative to other frying pans that use non-stick ceramic coating.

Cast iron retains heat much better and has the greatest thermal mass, so it can transfer heat far beyond the surface of the skillet. The oil spreads evenly over the skillet surface and does not collect in separate drops because of the uniform heating of the skillet and the homogeneity of the material. As a result - there is an unsurpassed browning, perfect crust, juicy foods and perfectly golden brownies that no other skillet can offer. 

The Skillet is made of a single piece of cast iron using high-quality processing. MANOLI is not afraid of anything, You can cut right in it and wash it even with a metal brush. The skillet has thick walls that are resistant to temperature deformation. You don't have to worry that your skillet will bend over time. The highest quality will allow you to use this skillet after 10 years.

Manoli fits in any washbasin due to its removable handle, It can be easily cleaned by any means and devices. Just wipe it dry after use and place it even in the narrowest place. Save more space with MANOLI. 

What could be better than a breakfast prepared in the open air. Delight yourself and your loved ones with Manoli.

We've also manufactures a set of matching accessories (add-ons) to help you get the most out of your MANOLI skillet. Be prepared for any situation!

Accessories include: 

  • glass lid for all sizes of skillet
  • bamboo table stand

All accessories will be available as add-ons when ordering each or that skillet size via account.

LID is made of  boron silicate glass with bakelite handle. It allows the lid to withstand high temperatures and to use it in any conditions.

Bamboo table stand

The Bamboo tale stand has a universal 20 mm diameter. It is user-friendly with all types of frying pans. The table stand can ve washed easily as it is made of bamboo. Also it does not crack like most wooden coasters.

Everyday with MANOLI

How we made Manoli Skillet

We have found a problem that there was no any good size-fit easy-to-care & easy-to-handle safe skillet which can be taken on a hike. More often we can meet the situations when someone burned hands and it spoilt all the hike. That is why we have found an insight of creating such a skillet Manoli with a quick-release wooden handle. The idea was to use only eco-friendly and natural materials so to make and use a real quality product within many years and decades.

We have a partner which produce cast iron. We asked him to cast us a prototype according to our sketches.

Now we are testing the market and believe that the product will have a worldwide interest.

We want to raise money to manufacture molds for all sizes of skillets and to start mass manufacturing process.

Risks and challenges

The day-to-day world needs to solve every problem quickly and in style. Our creative team is ready and waiting to shoulder the enormous demands and to fulfil all our obligations during the production and order stages. We understand all the natural risks and technical difficulties, issues in the supply chain and the challenges that feedback brings.
MANOLI CAST IRON SKILLET has been preparing for a long time and we are now ready to make a great impression! You can relax and stay positive and well informed as we’ll do our best to satisfy all your healthy needs. Cook quality products – It’s easy when you have the passion and love for our product! MANOLI CAST IRON SKILLET is not just a new technology for cooking, but a hobby, a new way of relaxation and healthy cooking...This is a new healthy entertainment for Families, Friends and Colleagues!

story:
Production Samples for October 2021 Delivery:

 
Coffeejack with final Packaging:

Coffeejack Assessories (protective cases):

 

Why Espresso?

Espresso is the main brewing method for professional coffee shops/baristas as it can be made into any coffee variety and is richest in flavour.

Problem?

It is the most expensive process due to the high pressure required for the extraction. Hence why most high quality espresso machines exceed $2000!

Solution...COFFEEJACK™​

COFFEEJACK™ reaches pressures in excess of 9 Bar meaning it is able to produce professional quality espresso coffee at a fraction of the cost, with complete portability. You'll never require another way of making coffee!

 

 

How it all began...

"We grew tired of investing in expensive portable coffee makers and never experiencing the same quality espresso we could only get from a coffee shop. Second to that, we were guilty of using disposable cups, purely due to convenience. We knew we could engineer something better, something that fulfilled our desire for great coffee and helped the environment at the same time. We cannot express the level of passion and tenacity that has been invested into this project. It is factually the smallest espresso machine on the market (only 100mm high). But most importantly it ACTUALLY produces coffee shop quality coffee. This has been no easy task to achieve and we refused to stop until COFFEEJACK™ met our high standards and of those in the coffee industry. 

392 prototypes, one filed patent later and we've finally done it!  We are very proud to finally unveil our most exclusive project to the Indiegogo community. We are currently in production and will be posting frequent updates on the manufacture process.

Ultimate Portability, No Compromise on Quality

 

Gift something unique this year!

 

 

 

 

 

 

16 BILLION disposed coffee cups disposed every year with harmful plastic laminates and lids.

If you drank just one cup of take-out coffee per day, over one year, it would cost over $1100 (based on 2019 data for USA/Canada).Thats enough disposable cups to stack over twice the height of Miss Liberty.

Bear in mind, statistics state only 0.25% of cups are recycled. The rest find their way to landfill and the ocean. Lets do something about it.

COFFEEJACK™ = No disposable cups, up to 85% saving and the same great taste

 

How can we help?

Our goal for COFFEEJACK™ is to reduce the use of disposable coffee cups by making the quality and convenience available outside of expensive coffee shops

 

 

 

We felt strongly about using glass to give COFFEEJACK™ a unique quality feel. However, we also want it to be very durable for portability purposes. Therefore, we use a shatter-resistant borosilicate glass. It is more expensive than conventional glass but COFFEEJACK™ is a special product and we want it to be used and treasured for a lifetime!

 

We believe in COFFEEJACK™ so much that we went ahead and filed a patent. This technology is completely exclusive to HRIBARCAIN.

WORKING PROTOTYPE

This isn't our first time! We have a track record of delivering successful Kickstarter campaigns. Check out the links below:

 

Having people enjoy our products is more important than making profit. We recognise that this attitude is essential to growing our business. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read through our campaign. We hope you share even half the passion we have for COFFEEJACK™.

We are both Design Engineers who have worked in the manufacturing industry for a number of years. As Designers, we have a strong passion to innovate products where design has become stale and unchanged latterly in their existence. We were getting tired of wasting money on underperforming portable coffee makers. We knew there had to be a way to achieve cafe-quality coffee on the go. Many, many prototypes later and we cracked it!

All design work and machining prototypes have been done by ourselves. We also have a very good relationship with our manufacturers and talk on a daily basis. This is essential to ensure we can easily monitor production and ensure the very best quality.

Thank you for your time.

Why Espresso?Espresso is the main brewing method for professional coffee shops/baristas as it can be made into any coffee variety and is richest in flavour.Problem?It is the most expensive process due to the high pressure required for the extraction. Hence why most high quality espresso machines exceed $2000!Solution...COFFEEJACK™​COFFEEJACK™ reaches pressures in excess of 9 Bar meaning it is able to produce professional quality espresso coffee at a fraction of the cost, with complete portability. You'll never require another way of making coffee!  
 

All components are completely bespoke and engineered to the highest standardHow it all began..."We grew tired of investing in expensive portable coffee makers and never experiencing the same quality espresso we could only get from a coffee shop. Second to that, we were guilty of using disposable cups, purely due to convenience. We knew we could engineer something better, something that fulfilled our desire for great coffee and helped the environment at the same time. We cannot express the level of passion and tenacity that has been invested into this project. It is factually the smallest espresso machine on the market (only 100mm high). But most importantly it ACTUALLY produces coffee shop quality coffee. This has been no easy task to achieve and we refused to stop until COFFEEJACK™ met our high standards and of those in the coffee industry. 392 prototypes, one filed patent later and we've finally done it!  We are very proud to finally unveil our most exclusive project to the Indiegogo community. Lets do something about it.COFFEEJACK™ = No disposable cups, up to 85% saving and the same great taste How can we help?Our goal for COFFEEJACK™ is to reduce the use of disposable coffee cups by making the quality and convenience available outside of expensive coffee shops Bespoke Filter System COFFEEJACK™ can be used to make the coffee varieties shown above COFFEEJACK™ has gone through a vigorous design development process and all parts have been proven for lifetime use and maintenance.
  We felt strongly about using glass to give COFFEEJACK™ a unique quality feel. However, we also want it to be very durable for portability purposes. Therefore, we use a shatter-resistant borosilicate glass. It is more expensive than conventional glass but COFFEEJACK™ is a special product and we want it to be used and treasured for a lifetime! We believe in COFFEEJACK™ so much that we went ahead and filed a patent. This technology is completely exclusive to HRIBARCAIN.Prototype EvolutionBig moments throughout of prototyping stagesWORKING PROTOTYPE
 

 

We’ve essentially been able to release ‘Coffeejack Version 2’ for you all by utilising the COVID-19 lockdown time to make some fantastic design upgrades. Many of these features were suggested by backers so thank you for your feedback throughout the project.
Please see the images below indicating the changes and why they have improved Coffeejack.

 
1. Increased Volume of Water Chamber by over 20%. Now holds 90ml for those wanting a larger coffee, its your choice.
2. New Valve System. Instead of using metal ball bearings, springs and o-ring seals we have now moved to an all silicone system. This means improved user interaction when replacing valve seals and increased reliability.
3. Depth of Coffee Basket. This is a really important upgrade as it means an increased coffee yield for a given cup without basket obstruction. It also means a wider range of glasses/mugs can be used as it better accommodates the wall taper of the cup. We had to move around all the existing internals to make this improvement which meant a complete design overhaul.

4. Custom Branded ‘Soft Place’ Rubber. This means a silent, seamless transition when placing Coffeejack on the rim of a coffee cup. It also spreads the load whilst pumping, preventing any movement/ scratches on the cup or elevation stand.
5. Rubber Grip. Provides extra grip when twisting the coffee basket onto the bayonets. We found this useful when components are wet after being washed or in rainy/cold conditions.
6. Anti Drip Valve. On occasions, Coffeejack left the odd drip if all the water had not passed through the puck. Please note this valve does not prevent the system from being an unpressurised portafilter. Its shore hardness is only high enough to retain a water droplet. Additionally it provides air-tight freshness when storing the grind in our coffee basket carry case.
7. Soft Place Rubber. Prevents movement on a flat surface and provides a luxurious feel when placing on a table. This is a fine but noticeable detail for many quality products.

8. Rubber Seal. This has two purposes, first being that it will fully seal the chamber from unwanted dust/dirt during transit. This keeps the water chamber clean at all times. Secondly, it provides a ‘smooth rotation’ feel when locking the lid in the closed position.
9. Heavy duty Locking Mechanism. Although the old design worked, we had concerns about it breaking if it were to be mistreated. This design adds further protection incase any tiny hands find your Coffeejack!

10. Piston Lock. This feature locks both the lid and the piston in a secure closed position. This is important as these robust features must hold the internal compression spring in the loaded position.
11. Safety Water Trap. This is an additional component to the original design. If Coffeejack is knocked from the side, the downward facing chamfers prevent water splashing upwards. Whilst it protects against water splashes, it also allows water refill without removing the component every time.
12. Full Width Water Spreader. Increasing water flow area therefore improving espresso taste quality.
The design improvements above mean extra cost for us, not for you. You will receive a far superior product to the one you originally backed.
In addition to the above, we are contracting the expertise of a professional packaging design company. This means Coffeejack will arrive in highly presentable, gift worthy packaging with full instructions for use.
We appreciate packaging is a concern for many backers in that you may not want this for environmental reasons. We commend this view and will be sending a survey nearer the time of delivery where you will be able to opt-out of packaging if desired. We will provide a transit protected, eco-friendly alternative.
 
***********************

This isn't our first time! We have a track record of delivering successful Kickstarter campaigns. Check out the links below:       Having people enjoy our products is more important than making profit. We recognise that this attitude is essential to growing our business. Thank you so much for taking the time to read through our campaign. We hope you share even half the passion we have for COFFEEJACK™.We are both Design Engineers who have worked in the manufacturing industry for a number of years. As Designers, we have a strong passion to innovate products where design has become stale and unchanged latterly in their existence. We were getting tired of wasting money on underperforming portable coffee makers. We knew there had to be a way to achieve cafe-quality coffee on the go. Many, many prototypes later and we cracked it!All design work and machining prototypes have been done by ourselves. We also have a very good relationship with our manufacturers and talk on a daily basis. This is essential to ensure we can easily monitor production and ensure the very best quality.Thank you for your time.

story:
Introducing Operation Hunker Down by Holyoke Craft Beer! First, a little bit about us. We launched our small 1bbl nano brewery back in 2018 after a successful Kickstarter Campaign and winning first place in a local shark tank style pitch competition for entrepreneurs launching businesses in Gateway Cities like Holyoke, Massachusetts. 

Holyoke Craft Beer started as a dream of owner Mike Pratt to bring a brewery to the Holyoke community as a spot to gather and share exciting beer in the midst of a local revitalization. As residents of Holyoke, Mike and his wife Catherine wanted to make a positive, lasting contribution to their own hometown. Over the course of almost three years from first opening our doors, we did exactly that. 

We started with opening our cozy, basement taproom every Friday evening. A trip to our taproom brings patrons in touch with both the modern brewing process and the historical industrial era architecture of our home building at 208 Race Street. Our grand opening brought over 500 people to our inviting space. What a start! 

As our lineup of available beers expanded, so did our following. With that growth we were able to provide new entertainment options to our dedicated fans. We began to invite local musical talent to play, hosted trivia nights, had DJs spin, held a yoga session, and put on a theme night or two. We had a blast doing local events such as Celebrate Holyoke, the Holyoke Canoe Club Brewfest, the Volleyball Hall of Fame fundraiser, The Plan Grand Opening, Big Brother Big Sister Brews and Bites fundraiser, The Worthy Fest, and many more. With every event we felt as though our presence was growing. In the Spring of 2020 we were planning to have a huge St. Patrick’s day at the Holyoke Road Race with our PeoplesStout brewed in collaboration with PeoplesBank. We were on a roll and so happy to see things really coming together.

Then the Covid-19 pandemic hit, and overnight things changed for us. We no longer could welcome our fans to our taproom due to health concerns and state restrictions. So we pivoted! We transitioned to a strictly curbside offering with online ordering and beer-to-go pick-ups.  Our customers returned week in and week out for an entire year eagerly anticipating a time we could once again share a pint at the bar. Our loyal following kept us going and even gave us the energy to dig deep into our creative side throughout it all. Even after an intense year, we found the energy to collaborate with some  local artists to bring a special music video filmed at the brewery for the city of Holyoke to enjoy from home for St.Patrick’s day 2021 for the release of new Irish Stout called “Rolling in the Clover”. 

As the spring of 2021 approached and the vaccines continued to be rolled out, we saw an opportunity to pour pints in a safe way outdoors.  So we pivoted again, and we launched an incredibly successful beer garden at Armour Yard in collaboration with the owners of The Cubit Building. This quickly became the spot to be in Holyoke on Saturdays during the summer with food trucks and the Holyoke Farmers Market joining in on the fun.

Our plan was to reopen the taproom as the cooler months approached and Covid 19 receded. Unfortunately, due to circumstances out of our control in our current space and the persistence of Covid, we no longer see a path forward in our current location for our taproom. This is a huge blow to us as the taproom was key to our financial success and core to our mission.

So our plan is simple. Pivot! We’ve done it before and we know we can do it again. We are asking both our followers that love our beer and folks that wish for a thriving Holyoke economy to give us the chance to stay alive by supporting our Indiegogo Campaign while we work towards finding a new home for our taproom and navigate what we hope will be the last challenge of this awful pandemic.

Our plan that we have set out is to raise enough money ahead of time to allow us to forecast properly, pay for our rent, payroll, utilities, supplies, and more for the next 6 months so we don’t need to hibernate until next spring. In order to do that, we are looking for upfront can orders so we manage production while providing you the highest quality beer possible. Our campaign offers different levels of commitment from one 4-pack per month of our beer up to a full case (24 cans) per month. Without these up front commitments we would likely need to shut down production through the winter until we can reopen Armour Yard, and we really don’t want to do that. This campaign requires all or nothing to make it work. Your pledge will only be fufilled if we raise the full $16,000 by midnight on October 31st! So we are really counting on your loyalty and support one more time to keep us open and keep Holyoke vital. 

If you haven’t had a chance to try any of beers you can find us on draft at the following  locations below:

Luthier’s Co-op in Easthampton

99 Restaurant on Liberty St. in Springfield

99 Restaurant in the Holyoke Mall

The Boathouse in South Hadley

Smith’s Billiards in Springfield

Murphy’s Pub in Agawam

Delaney House in Holyoke

Tavern on the Hill

Paper City Bar & Grill

White Lion Brewing Dandelion at MGM in Springfield

Armour Yard

Upcoming Tasting Events with Holyoke Craft Beer -
Wykoff Country Club Chamber of Commerce Event 9/20

The Big E Valley Malt Tent  West Springfield 9/21

Gasoline Alley with Monsoon Roaster Springfield 9/25

Mike’s  Maze Sunderland  10/15 and 10/29

Night Market at Depot Square Holyoke 10/30

story:
I’M NOT A BARISTA  is a not-for-profit community that celebrates a universal love of coffee. Our Brewing Guide began as a humble way to share tips for making delicious coffee at home during the pandemic but has since grown into a worldwide representation of the people behind every cup.

 

We found that the coffee world was missing information and educative opportunities. The culinary world offers varieties of cookbooks and recipes from different chefs, but there was no equivalent for coffee products.

 

The I'M NOT A BARISTA brewing guide is exactly that – a collection of recipes, tested by coffee experts and skilled home brewers, for you to level up your coffee experience. We believe that anyone can brew and that everyone deserves good coffee. 

This is not just about the brewing recipes – it is about connecting you on a global scale with talented individuals who want to share their knowledge and technique for better brews. Our goal is to spread the love for drinking coffee around the world and to empower baristas - those we know by name and those we want to shine a light on.

 

 

There is nothing that delights us more than seeing our baristas and coffee lovers progress and be able to get their voices heard. It is honouring to know that we have been part of the process, but we want to do more. We would like to provide financial aid to members of our coffee community who have been immensely affected by the pandemic. In this, we will launch our #Tipabarista charity project and make donations to help baristas in need. 

 


We are aware that $100 for each barista won’t give a chance to turn around a business or get anyone too far, but we hope to provide some relief, happiness, and most importantly, hope. You are not alone, and we believe in you as professionals as well as human beings.

We firmly believe in being transparent with our followers and donors. To do so, we have linked a page from our website that details our donation status, with all necessary details regarding our incoming funds and their allocation. Click here for more info.

 

Today we live in a world dominated by social media, and sometimes, it can be hard to switch off. 2020 felt like a constant flow of negative news. This year, it seems that life is only getting more overwhelming. We believe that coffee can always bring some peace to our daily lives. Brewing a cup of coffee in the morning can serve as a moment of calm, and a time to reflect and relax.

 

Each card represents so much more than a recipe: it is a vehicle for connection in these lonely times. Each card represents a real coffee lover or a barista champion who you can reach out to, whether because you want to learn from them, show gratitude for their work or simply bond over your shared passion for coffee. Nothing is more powerful than this connection.
 
 

The brewing guide consists of forty-eight recipe cards from baristas around the world. These recipes are based upon community-verified and hand-selected major brewing methods:

AeroPress, Pour-over, French Press, or a Moka pot… Some cards also provide step-by-step visual instruction to help new home brewers.

Each card represents so much more than a recipe: it is a vehicle for connection in these lonely times. Each card represents a real coffee lover or a barista champion who you can reach out to, to follow their work, share your thoughts on their brews, and bond over your love of coffee. Nothing is more powerful than this connection.

 

 

Make music a part of your brewing experience - we asked recipe owners for their favorite brewing music, and we created an irresistible Spotify playlist to enhance your brewing routine. A compilation of forty-eight songs hand-picked by each of our collaborators, our aim is to make your brewing experience one that is peaceful and intimate. Each recipe comes with a specific song track to recreate the exact experience. To browse this playlist, scan the code below with your Spotify App.

 

 

To better help you connect with the coffee community, we have also added a QR code on each card to help you easily find the barista behind the recipe. If you really like the recipe, scan the QR code and connect. That being said, we understand that not everyone can afford to support our project. However, we believe everyone deserves good coffee - if you want to share any recipe, simply scan the code and share it with your friends.

 

This is not a one-time project that ends after the campaign. It is only the beginning, and we want to invite you to join us in our future projects. After trying all of these wonderful recipes, don't you want to share yours with us?

For this purpose, we prepared a special card just for you. Sharing is caring, so write down your favourite recipe and share it with the world.

 

The cards are symbolic of our community’s effort to create a collaborative product. 30 countries, 27 languages, 110 recipe testers, 10 volunteers, and 10 student interns, and literally thousands of hours.

Instagram / Linkedin / Facebook / Patreon 

 

 

 

 

You will get verified pour-over recipes from the most popular brewers like the V60 to fun and advanced recipes with Melodrip and Lilydrip. 

Pour-over recipe contributors:

Brandon O'Shea / Christos Klouvatos /  Hrishikesh Mohite / Tanty Hartono / Ronaldo  Hurtado / Łukasz Gałęcki / Michal Boček / Renan Dantas / Sarah J. Hannaway / Siew Hui Ong  / Tzanetos Dalletos / Ray Murakawa / Orkun Ustel / Zach Vasquez/ Priscila Pinho

We have included both inverted and standard AeroPress brewing methods from various champions, baristas, and home brewers to help you discover the fullest potential of this great American invention by Alan Adler.

 

AeroPress recipe contributors:

Ronița Dragomir / Kiki Kitcheman  / Alvin Cheng / Konstantinos Spanos / Fakhri Wiratama / Sulaiman Alalawi / Jared Dennison / Hafidz 'Ryuki / Nicole Battefeld-Montgomery / Tim Rogg / Paul Asquith / Pedro Martinez / Ricardo Saavedra / Wendelien van Bunnik / Smayah Uwajeneza / Naomi Carbin / Jessie Gao / Zarak Yusufzai

 
 

 

Italy has brought so many great inventions to this world, and the Moka pot is the most used brewing tool used in Italy today. How make tasty coffee with Moka Pot? Our Italian coffee bloggers and Moka Pot champions will share their secrets with you. 

Moka pot recipe contributors:

Valentina Palange / Arquimedes Rondon / Davide Spinelli / Andrea Panizzardi / Frankie Breda / Pierpaolo Caperna

Do you know that the French press is invented by Italians? French press, also called Cafetière, is one of the most versatile, and affordable tools you should always have in your kitchen or office.

French press recipe contributors:

Vasileia Fanarioti / Alejandro Cardenas / Clarijs Rob / Lucia Ng / Andrea Ley / Karolina Gaizauskiene

 

Special Smart brewing is easy with Clever Dripper, a cool immersion tool that simplifies your brewing process: grind, pour, wait, and drink. You will have two special recipes from World Barista Champion.

 

Recipe contributors:Kyohei Tanaka / Berg Wu / Youngjun Cho 

 

 

 

In short, I'M NOT A BARISTA is a not-for-profit company with the mission to empower coffee people behind the cup. We are working hard to become a international NPO in the near future. 

Our Values

In a world increasingly dominated by technology and functioning virtually, human connection is more important than ever. Behind every cup of coffee we drink, there is a story, a group of people, and a process. The journey from bean to cup is a craft that deserves to be acknowledged. Each coffee represents an opportunity to appreciate, celebrate, and advocate for the enthusiasm which upholds this entire industry. These are just some of the core values we stand for. 

 

Our Goal

Our goal is to tackle each of our projects with a renewed energy and zeal. Our coffee stories are meant to put a spotlight on baristas, placing an emphasis on the human aspect in coffee and helping to raise awareness for the people that are an important part of this industry, but sometimes get overlooked.

Building on this foundation, we want to use 2021 as a catalyst for increasing the tangible impact we have on baristas around the world. Our project is a mission inspired by the community which seeks to then give back to the community. Baristas work tirelessly to provide us all with our daily caffeine fix. More often than not their long hours of hard physical work receives too low a pay and the true value of their efforts is rarely recognised. Furthermore, the pandemic has been greatly detrimental for baristas on a global scale. As specialty cafés have closed their doors, both the barista’s profession and livelihood have been taken away. So, what can we do to help? Watch the video below and meet Micky Wang, founder of I'M NOT A BARISTA.

 

 
 

Other projects

 

#brewathome

#brewathome is a global social campaign on Instagram to help the coffee community and our customers during the current global pandemic. Through the #brewathome campaign, we are able to build a platform to connect everyone in the coffee industry. We team up with hundreds of international coffee brands to give back real value to the community.

Since last April, we have given away more than 400 bags of coffee and brewing tools to the coffee communities around the world. 

 

#coffeemoustache

This campaign aims to bring a smile to people’s faces and raise awareness of baristas’ mental health issues. 

 

 

We love sharing coffee stories and truly believe that these stories are inspiring baristas all over the world! With this in mind, we also know that a lot of you live busy lives, and sometimes finding the time to sit down and read a story is not that easy. With our podcast, now you can listen to all our coffee stories on the go! You can find us on Spotify, Apple Podcast, and Google Podcast now.

 Spotify Podcast / Apple Podcast / Google Podcast

 

What does coffee mean to us? Coffee is community. A big shoutout to these amazing Individuals from across the world who has worked on this product. Therefore, each card is representative of much more than just a recipe, it acts as a door leading the reader to a community of like-minded coffee individuals.

 

Interns involved in this project

Virginia Fanticini / Nicole Hilton / Antonio Montoro Diaz / Vicky / Anna Navoychik / Konstantina Votsika /  Lousia Campbell / Emilie Milne / Beste Semiz / Camille Lowe / Benedetta Locatelli

 

Volunteers

  • Designer: Guadalupe Delgadillo / Naomi Doedelz 
  • Copy Writing: Tigger Chaturabul / Vasileia Fanarioti / Ronița Dragomir / Anna Suffolk
  • Accounting: Chui Yan Yau 
  • Marketing: Tigger Chaturabul  / Zed Wong 
  • Project Consulting: Andrea Pernicano 
  • Videographer: Vladimir Vorslov
  • Barista actors: Nes Suvorova / Roman Zoller 

 

Recipe testers

Special thanks to the following overcaffeinated recipe testers who spent hours testing the recipes and providing valuable feedback to help deliver the final recipes to your hands.

Alejandro Cardenas /  Karolina Gaizauskiene / Daniella Gray / Sebastian Franzén /  Renan Dantas / Martijn Vanbuel / Mónica Lezama / Łukasz Gałęcki / Idan Horowitz / Fakhri Wiratama/ Faiz Noor / Martino / Michal Boček / Pravin Yadav / Siew Hui / Andres Randazzo / Guadalupe Delgadillo / Helio Moraes / bilal yıldız / Claudio Chávez / David Graus / Dawid / Eduardo Namura / Gerard Vecino / Hussain Alsanona / Muhammad farhan

 

Business supporters 

Again, coffee is community. During the project preparation, we received great support from the global coffee community who believe in our project and wish us success. 

Clever Dripper / E&B Lab Italy / Lilydrip / Melodrip / Home of coffee
