Whether you want a sprinkle or shower of salt, Moulin makes it effortless with 10x more output than standard mills and 10+ adjustable grind options. To top it off, its exquisite, minimalist design enhances any kitchen or dining setting. 
 
   Moulin lets you control salt size and volume with a simple twist. Instead of putting your coarse-grain, medium-grain, and finishing salts in 3 different bowls, Moulin has 10 grinding levels so you can adjust with precise granularity to the ideal size.The external dial hits everything between a fine powder (around 0) and a coarser grain (around 9). It technically goes "below 0" and "above 9”, plus in between each number, giving you 50+ grind options.  0 Powder Salt — Great for adding flavor to dishes you wouldn’t want to bite into and feel a grain of salt like homemade guacamole, dips, popcorn and sauces.  3 Fine Grain Salt —Perfect for adjusting the final level of saltiness of a dish like roasted vegetables, fish or pasta, much like the use of finishing salt (fleur de sel).  5 Medium Grain Salt —A must have for seasoning meat to pull proteins out from the inside before and during cooking, helping achieve caramelization as you cook without worrying about over-salting.  9 Coarse Grain Salt —Give it a few robust turns to salt your pasta water and make it burst with flavor, akin to Gros Sel.  The Moulin Salt Mill beats the pants off any other salt or pepper mill you’ve had in your hands because it was designed with intentional purpose from the inside out.Bearings & Burrs: Moulin Salt Mill uses alumina ceramic burrs and zirconia ceramic bearings specifically, because ceramic is rust and corrosion resistant.Interior Chamber & Exterior Finish: 6061 aerospace-grade, anodized aluminum. There is no paint to chip off or leach into the salt to contaminate it. It’s highly scratch resistant and will last a lifetime (or many!) of serious use.Gentle Bottom Ring: There’s a 316L stainless steel retaining ring (the same grade as used on high-end watches) on the bottom so Moulin sits nicely on any table without damaging the surface. It’s insert molded with a Viton ring (like in Formula 1 car engine gaskets) so it will never peel off.Lid: We integrated powerful Neodymium magnets into the lid to hold it on firmly during use, but still allow it to be pulled off when needed for quick refilling.  Despite the science, most “designer” and “pro-grade” salt mills use grinding mechanisms made of steel. And it doesn’t matter if it’s steel, stainless steel or carbon steel—eventually, salt corrodes all 3.This is the main reason we don’t recommend putting salt in the complementary Moulin Pepper Mill—it’s made of stainless steel which is ideal for pepper as it doesn’t corrode like salt.You don’t have to worry about what you put in Moulin. Large-grained salts, either refined from saltwater or mined salts like pink himalayan are fine. We simply recommend not to fill it with wet salt or fibrous spices, like cardamom. Moulin Salt Mill’s chamber fits approximately 90 grams of large-granule salt. This will vary depending on granule size and packing density. And when it’s empty, refilling has never been easier. Just pull and  "pop" the top off. Once filled, pop the lid back on and it will gravity-feed back on by floating down on a pocket of air.Plus, corrosion-resistant materials mean this won’t be hard to open for refills, ever.Weber went on to be in charge of implementing the glass screen for the first iPhones, but ultimately left Apple after 13 years to found Weber Workshops (WW). Their first product was a commercial-grade electric coffee grinder, and the team used that same expertise to redefine another frustrating kitchen item: the pepper mill. Moulin Pepper Mills have been such a success that naturally customers are asking for its companion: the Moulin Salt Mill.Weber created the matchless product you see today by rethinking the standard salt mill at Apple-level detail and delivering it at Apple-level quality.Weber created the matchless product you see today by rethinking the standard salt mill at Apple-level detail and delivering it at Apple-level quality.    As a long-time Product Design Engineer at Apple, I learned the difference between products created with purpose and those made for the sake of sales.On top of wasting resources and costing us and the environment more in the long term, these products don’t provide a quality user experience or spark joy in our daily lives.In the case of salt shakers and mills, the cheap ones are full of additives and barely work, while the supposedly high-end ones end up barely lasting longer than the $4 ones.Unlike cell phones, when these items are built with purpose and integrity, they can continue to serve us and improve our quality of life on a daily basis for decades, if not longer. That’s something I get excited about.As anyone with an Apple product can attest, the quality, look, and feel of any Apple product genuinely enhances the experience of using it. The designers and engineers spent innumerable hours sweating the details people didn’t even realize existed, and as products, that puts them on a different plane than the “cheaper” versions available at Walmart.You take quality photos with your iPhone to capture memories that are actually worth looking at later. It all adds up. This is especially true with cooking and eating. Both processes use the senses — taste, smell, touch, sight and even hearing — and the Moulin Mill greatly enhances both the cooking experience and the flavors of eating.This is all to say that we all enjoy high-quality products that deliver. They enhance our quality of life. That’s why Moulin Salt—and all Weber Workshops products for that matter—matter.   Rainfactory is a multiple-award-winning crowdfunding marketing agency that operates as a marketing department for growing brands. Rainfactory’s experienced team & data-driven, battle-tested approach ensure long-term market dominance for DTC eCommerce start-ups.

story:
BrewVide™ is all about simplicity and control. Built-in dual heating elements eliminate the need for propane, regulators, and burners and provide precision temperature control, while the ability to whirlpool and transfer to a fermentor using the integrated pump means that brew day just got a whole lot less cluttered.  

 

Tired of bad extraction and boil-overs? BrewVide™ offers precise temperature control from 70 degrees to boil using dual heating elements and a proprietary algorithm for control. 

 

Tired of stirring? BrewVide's built-in pump is oriented to provide a gentle stir or a powerful whirlpool on demand. 

 

Tired of dumping and racking? We were too. That's why we created a way to use BrewVide™ to easily transfer wort from your kettle to your fermentor. 

 

 

 

BrewVide™ is made to fit inside of just about any kettle out there, and the adjustable bracket makes it easy to position it higher or lower depending on how much liquid you are working with.

 

 

 

With an intuitive interface and capacitive touch buttons, BrewVide™ is as precise as it is simple to use. Our proprietary algorithm ensures fast temperature ramping without any risk of scorch. 

 

 

BrewVide™ delivers up to 1600 watts of power with a standard 120V outlet, making it more powerful than any other sous vide device on the market and can take 5 gallons of wort from mash temperature to boil in about half an hour. Read more about 120V brewing further down the page! 

 

Tired of stirring? We were too! That's why we built a powerful pump right into BrewVide™ that provides hands-free stirring and whirlpooling on demand. It also speeds the process of chilling when using an immersion chiller! 

 

The built-in magnetic drive sanitary pump can move up to 3 gallons per minute, making quick work of transferring your wort to the fermentor. 

BrewVide™ offers an incredible range of features that combine the precision control and compact size of a sous vide device, with the power and simplicity of an electric brewing kettle, while also building in whirlpooling and transfer via a powerful pump and an intuitive device and app interface. Did we mention you can still use your favorite kettle?

We designed BrewVide™ specifically for brewing but because it is essentially a sous vide on steroids, we have also found that it is fantastic for large batch sous vide! Where typical sous vide devices would struggle to maintain large batch temperatures, BrewVide™ can cook up to 5-10 gallons of meat with no problem. Yes, we measure meat by the gallon... You don't?

The BrewVide™ app is a very simple and intuitive interface that gives you the ability to create schedules, set temperatures, and monitor your progress. This app does not do everything for everyone. It is purpose-built to give you a better brewing experience. That's it.  

BrewVide™ Specs:

  • Height: 10in
  • Width: 7.5in
  • Depth: 3in
  • Bracket: 7in adjustment
  • Heating: Dual element 1600W
  • Pump: Sanitary magnetic drive
  • Pump Rate: Up to 3 gallons per minute
  • Voltage: 120V
  • Plug: North American GFCI
  • Interface: Capacitive Buttons & LCD display
  • Connectivity: Bluetooth
  • App: iOS & Android
  • Materials: Stainless Steel & food grade polymer

​

 

       

 

       

 

      

 

 

 

It all started with the idea and trend of using a sous vide device for brewing beer. Jumping in, we quickly discovered that there were many shortcomings that existing devices had. A long iterative process of design and prototyping helped us refine the functionality and user experience to where we are today. Once we validated the concept with prototyping, we then partnered with an incredible manufacturer who is ready to help us produce the final product. 

 

We are a small independent and experienced group of engineers, designers, and homebrewing enthusiasts who are passionate about creating products that make homebrewing a more fun, accessible, and social experience. 

 

Collectively we have worked at some of the largest corporations in the world and have lead successful hardware startups. We know what it takes to deliver a high quality product and are extremely excited to bring BrewVide™ to the market. 

You made it to the end.. You deserve a beer! (some homebrew of course.. )Thank you for considering backing us to help make BrewVide™ a reality. 

 

Happy Brewing!

Risks and challenges

It’s been a lot of fun bringing the BrewVide™ to life over the past few months, and lots of work: Design, engineering, app development, prototyping, and testing, and of course, listening to you, our fellow homebrewers, to make sure we developed features you care about.

But of course, there is plenty of work remaining to gear up for factory production and assembly, and we will continue to test and validate, ensuring quality and performance. We have done our homework and are confident in our timeline.

We will be providing regular progress reports, and we will be up-front about anything unexpected that may come up. What we will not do is cut corners. Not on quality and not on performance. You are trusting us by backing the BrewVide™, and we are not taking this for granted.

story:
No more dry microwaved meals, every meal will be hot, fresh and delicious. Add water and you're good to go. 

Our perk uses steam technology to heat food and maintain nutrients and flavour. The steam works to trap in goodness. 

Regular lunchbox -  Regular lunch boxes have held mankind back since the day they were invented. Besides the fact that they force us to eat cold meals, they’re prone to leaking, break down quickly and leave you feeling ill equipped and embarrassed.

Electric lunchbox - Have you ever tried one of these? If not, good. If you did, you probably already know that these products are often extremely bulky, not leak-proof, awfully designed and - most importantly, need an external power source to heat up. The latter is the most frustrating part of it all, having to depend on something limits where you can eat...

Microwave - Then there is the microwave. A great way to heat up your food, and a great way to destroy all of the goodness and nutrients in meal, before radiating the sh!t out of it. When you have survived the waiting line of hangry co-workers ( if there even is a microwave in the first place) they often end up looking revolting.

 

 

 

We’ve put our double sealing mechanism to the most scary test known to lunchboxes… SOUP! Where most lunchboxes perish when only thinking about spaghetti sauce or other basic types of food, The perk survived the hardest test with ease.

 

 

 

We support ShareTheMeal, an initiative of the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP). WFP is the world’s largest humanitarian agency fighting hunger. Being part of our vision ‘Freedom of Food’, we will give back to less fortunate children in developing world countries. For each perk that is backed during the campaign, we are donating 1 meal to children in need!

 

 

Risks and challenges

Our highly committed team consists of experienced engineers and entrepreneurs. We run out from our Headquarters in the Netherlands and have trusted partners in the USA and Asia. We believe in high-quality products and only work with parties that have the same intentions and mindset as we do.

We do believe that any project will come with risks and challenges till a certain extent. Despite our planning and preparations, there will be times where we will face problems and hardships. When these occur, we promise that we will communicate with full transparency and do our absolute best to mitigate.

story:
Summary

 

Caballo Rojo Coffee is a Latina founded and woman owned coffee company that focuses on creating great coffee and having a positive community impact. Based in Durham, NC, we seek the good of our city and the cities from which we source our coffee. Founder Gabriela chose the company name in honor of her late Abuelo who owned a popular roastery in Venezuela with the same name. As a company, we prioritize direct trade relationships with farmers, giving back financially to our Durham community, reducing our environmental impact, and paying a living wage to our employees. We have been roasting and sourcing coffee to Durham since 2016 and now we are finally opening a brick and mortar shop!

 

Our family has lived in the Braggtown neighborhood of North Durham for the past five years as we have grown our roasting company. (Fun fact: Gabi once roasted coffee out of the second bedroom in their first home.) This neighborhood is only 2 miles from downtown and it has one of the largest Latinx populations in Durham. We are passionate about seeing local businesses thrive in this part of Durham, and we believe that this is the best place for us to have a community-centric coffee shop. We hope to get some Latinx treats from Panaderia Pahuatlan, a bakery here in our neighborhood. For vegan and gluten free options we plan to partner with Durham bakers from Whisk and Rye, who have been coming to North Gate Park throughout Covid. Another local business that we are working with is King’s Red and White Grocery. As many of our neighbors know there are several tire shops in this part of Durham, and the longstanding one connected to King’s has moved locations. We jumped at the chance to put our shop there, and we are so excited to be right beside this amazing local grocery store that has been a thriving part of North Durham for decades. 

 

With your help, we can have this neighborhood coffee shop and community space open by the end of the year. We will be walkable from any neighborhood in North Durham along Roxboro Street and we are conveniently located near several bus stops. Along with any financial investment you are comfortable making, we would also love you to spread the word, and any ideas about how to better serve those in our community. We want to be a positive and safe place for every person in our North Durham neighborhood, ensuring that everyone feels welcomed and celebrated in our space. Below we have some working ideas that you can email us about if you have expertise or input.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Should you decide to contribute financially, where will your money go? 

We are happy to say that with our current business model and rent, we can sustain the roasting portion of our business in this space without any contributions. However, to start the coffee shop portion, we need contributions to help us change the space from an old tire shop to a coffee shop. 

This includes electrical, plumbing, ADA updates, permits and licensing, and cosmetic changes, which we estimate will cost $12,000. We will have plenty of seating indoors and outdoors so that our community has a space to hang out, including two garage bays. The left one will be full of tables, chairs, and couches, and the right one will be a roasting space/seating. Between the bays, we plan to install the bar where we will take and prepare orders. To outfit these spaces it will cost roughly $7,000 in materials plus local woodworker, Dustin Kavanaugh’s, free labor. 

Our goal is to raise $20,000 to outfit the space. Whatever we raise will help us open sooner rather than later. Any money raised over our goal will go to operating costs.

 

Are you excited yet? There are special perks with all levels of contribution, as follows: 

$15: One free drip coffee 

$35: Two free espresso drinks 

$50: Caballo Rojo T-shirt

$100: Caballo Rojo T-shirt  and two free espresso drinks 

$150: Bag of freshly roasted coffee and free espresso drinks 

$200: Caballo Rojo T-shirt and a bag of freshly roasted coffee

$250: Branded mug by Joe Sink pottery and Caballo Rojo T-shirt

$500: Caballo Rojo t-shirt, a bag of freshly roasted coffee , branded mug by Joe Sink Pottery, and two free espresso drinks 

$800: 5lb bag of freshly roasted coffee, branded mug by Joe Sink Pottery, and two free espresso drinks 

$1000: 5lb bag of freshly roasted coffee, two branded mugs by Joe Sink Pottery, Caballo Rojo t-shirt, and two free espresso drinks

$2000: Two 5lb bags of freshly roasted coffee, two branded mugs by Joe Sink Pottery, two Caballo Rojo t-shirts, and four free espresso drinks

 

Your friendly neighborhood coffee shop

 

Caballo Rojo Coffee has grown in recognition since Gabi started it in college. What has made it successful in the eyes of our community is unique connections with our customers as well as the farmers from which we source our coffee. These sweet interactions are the main reason we want to open a shop of our own in our neighborhood. Our main focus as a shop will be to have a team of employees who are authentic and care about the community they are serving. We want to fight the elitism that we all so easily fall prey to. Our goal is to walk humbly alongside our community, constantly looking for ways to improve and have a positive presence in our neighborhood. We don’t want to be “just another coffee shop,” and we believe by cultivating a caring and intentional team that we can be a safe space for everyone. 

 

Some of the other areas we are investing our efforts into are:

Reducing our environmental impact

Compostable paper products

Partnership with Gather Green, who helps us reduce waste

Compostable bags for retail coffee

Paying living wage to our employees

Sourcing locally when possible

Pastries from local minority-owned companies- Whisk and Rye and Panaderia Pahuatlan

Mugs made by local potter, Joe Sink

Continuing to source our coffee through direct trade partnerships

Providing fair prices on goods so that they are affordable for all

Opening the space to local artists for gigs/etc

Accepting community feedback on ways we can improve

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Thankfully, Durham has supported Caballo Rojo Coffee so well the past 5 years. We have slowly grown from an in-home roasting company to owning a large roaster in a coffee shop in Downtown Durham. We believe that this growth will continue as we create a shop of our own. 

 

Most challenges currently stem from getting the correct permits and approvals to change the use of the space from a tire shop to a coffee shop. However, we are working with a local architect to get a site plan approved as quickly as possible. King’s Grocery is gracious enough to allow shared parking with their store.

 

With advice from a few contractors it doesn’t seem like we will hit any major money pit problems with outfitting the space. We will hire contractors for plumbing, electrical and the like. Without funding for these things it will take longer for us to open. With your help, we can achieve these more quickly, and therefore open more quickly!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to other local ListServs and organizations! Share the news on your social media and tag us @caballorojocoffee. Your support and re-sharing of our social media posts is one of the most valuable things you can contribute.

We have slowly grown from an in-home roasting company to owning a large roaster in a coffee shop in Downtown Durham. We believe that this growth will continue as we create a shop of our own.  Most challenges currently stem from getting the correct permits and approvals to change the use of the space from a tire shop to a coffee shop. However, we are working with a local architect to get a site plan approved as quickly as possible. King’s Grocery is gracious enough to allow shared parking with their store. With advice from a few contractors it doesn’t seem like we will hit any major money pit problems with outfitting the space. We will hire contractors for plumbing, electrical and the like. Without funding for these things it will take longer for us to open. With your help, we can achieve these more quickly, and therefore open more quickly!Other Ways You Can HelpPlease spread the word to other local ListServs and organizations! Share the news on your social media and tag us @caballorojocoffee. Your support and re-sharing of our social media posts is one of the most valuable things you can contribute.

story:
Overview

At Hjortu Destilleri, we intend to make one of the first bourbon-style whiskies using only Danish ingredients. This is done using our own yeast strains which we find in the Danish nature. 

What is bourbon whisky? 

Bourbon is a type of whisky - broadly characterized by three distinct traits: 1) It must be made of a grain bill that is at least 51% corn, 2) It must be aged on virgin (new) oak casks, and 3) It has to be made within the US. 

We fulfil all the requirements for making bourbon except one: We make it outside the US. Hence, what we produce is a bourbon-style or bourbon-inspired whisky. We do, however, mature our spirit in virgin oak casks and our recipes are in accordance with traditional bourbon recipes. Furthermore, our products are made entirely from Danish ingredients and with our own strains of yeast!

 

Our still

In order to capture and emphasize the taste of our new make we have chosen to use a pot still. The majority of bourbon distilleries use column stills; however, in the quest for complexity in flavor, we went with a pot still which allows us to more precisely manage and adjust the flavor profiles of our whiskies: 

Our products

Our output is 100% Danish bourbon-style whisky:

As indicated in the image above, our first production will include two bourbon-style whiskies: One wheated and one high-rye. You can claim these for yourself by clicking the perks on the right! You will find that our products are competitively priced: Our hope is that this will motivate you to actually drink our whisky instead of letting it gather dust as part of your collection. 

The two whiskies will have different flavors: 

Adding wheat to our whisky gives it a smooth, sweet flavor. We age it in 200 L casks to give it a balanced profile and the final alcohol percent of 40-45% makes this bourbon-style whisky accessible for most.

Adding rye to our whisky provides a spicier, more peppery flavor, mixed with the intensity of the wood infusion that comes from aging it in a 50 L cask. As we keep this spirit at a cask strength of around 55-60% alcohol, our high-rye bourbon-style whisky will provide a premium taste that we hope even the most experienced taster will enjoy.

 

The team

 

Your contribution

It is no secret that our set-up is small. We can’t compete with the big scale productions of many other distilleries, nor is that our ambition. What we wish to do is make innovative, top-quality whisky. And we will not compromise on the quality of our product.

Your contribution will allow us to perform all of our experiments and to develop our products. Without your contribution we won't be able to unfold the full potential of our distillery. Help us achieve our whisky dream and cement Denmark as a stronghold on the whisky scene! 

If you don’t have the financial capacity or motivation to support us economically that’s okay! Luckily, there are other ways through which you can support us. Spread our name on social media and in your personal networks. Chances are you know someone who might be interested in whisky – let them know our name!

 

Timeline

Thank you so much for reading so far! Now that we've uncovered the basics of our project in general and who we are, we would like to get a little nerdy and elaborate on some of the ways that we want to run our distillery.

 

Mash bills

At Hjortu Destilleri we make bourbon-style whisky using the best Danish corn we can get our hands on - and lots of it. Our mash bills generally consist of 60-65% corn and just enough malted barley to ensure diastatic acitivty for proper starch conversion. So far, we include either wheat or rye in the grain bill, giving each whisky its own distinct character: 

Yeast

Serving a simple purpose of ethanol formation, yeast is often an overlooked contributor in the art of whisky crafting. Just like, say, the grain of choice, the distillation process, the maturation in casks all confer a significant impact on the properties of the bottled whisky, yeast metabolites formed during fermentation have a big say in the quality of this fine product.

Because, when yeasts break down sugars to form ethanol and carbondioxide, a plethora of other reactions take place simultaneously. These resulting molecules can impart flavors both beneficial as well as detrimental to the spirit. If the right yeast is used, compounds associated with e.g. fruity and floral flavors will be formed during the fermentation stage. These will then carry over into the distillate.

This is why we have decided to cultivate our own strains of yeast, which we harvest ourselves from plants we find in nature. After collecting populations of yeasts, we select strains fit for our purpose based on favourable qualities such as fermentation performance and the flavors they form. Having our very own 'house yeasts' is in line with age-old bourbon traditions!

 

Still

There are, very broadly, two main still types for distilling whisky: Pot stills and Column stills. Both come with a number of subcategories. In Scotland and Ireland, distilleries traditionally use pot stills (as do most Danish distilleries, by the way) – but in the US, and within the bourbon tradition, column stills are the preferred choice. There is a multitude of theory covering this subject, but the main rule of thumb is this: Pot stills produce more flavor and complexity, whereas column stills provide a cleaner, more refined product.

We have ourselves visited a number of distilleries and tasted countless bourbon whiskies. And although it is tradition to make bourbon-style whisky on column stills, we have chosen to use a pot still in order to capture and emphasize the taste as much as possible. This is not totally uncommon: We have visited a number of distilleries in the US, some of which also use pot stills. Inspired by the complexity and taste of their products, we decided to follow in their footsteps.

 

Casks

One of the criteria for making bourbon is that you have to use virgin casks – that is, casks that never have aged another spirit or liquid. Moreover, the cask has to be charred, meaning that the cask is burnt within, which helps unfold and develop certain tastes in the spirit.

According to this tradition, we have chosen to use charred virgin oak casks and will like many American distilleries begin with American oak. Later on, we are looking forward to start experimenting with different types of casks as well as finishes.

We have chosen to age the two products of our first production on two different sizes of casks. Out wheated bourbon-style whisky is aged on a 200 L cask, because the wheat requires a softer and smoother aging from the tree, since the taste is delicate and mild. Hence, it requires a lesser wood infusion. Our high-rye bourbon-style whisky, however, is aged on a 50 L cask. The rye is very distinct and potent in its taste and is often very hard to drown out – so we believe that it will benefit from a stronger wood infusion.

 

Experiments

We wish to be an innovative and experimenting distillery. We want to explore not only taste but also different methods and processes. This is why we also experiment with our own different strains of yeast – we just can’t help but explore the impact that it has on the final product.

We will also be experimenting with different grain bills in order to give different flavor profiles to our whiskies. A part of this experiment will also be to test the different cuts of our spirit and taste how the different cuts impact our whisky.

Finally, we want to experiment with different casks and finishes. We hope that in 3 years’ time or so we will continue aging some of our product in different casks. This could be casks that have aged sherry, port wine, rum or other spirits. We will also hope to finish on other types of wood – for example French oak or other wood types outside the oak family.

 

Thank you!

Thank you very much for reading our page! Should choose to buy a perk you are helping us launch our dreams of making Danish bourbon-style whisky. However, your contribution should be seen as exactly that - a contribution. Please keep in mind that, while we will do everything in our power to keep our production on schedule, unforeseen delays that are out of our hands may occur. In such case, we will of course inform our backers appropriately. In three years time, however, our first and foremost priority will be to provide our wonderful backers with their products!

story:
What is Yuno? 

Yuno is a line of Biotactical drinks designed to give you energy, confidence, good vibes, and a whole lot more. With 6 distinct varieties featuring different combinations of ingredients, you’ll find Yuno serves you in a variety of #lifehappens moments and beyond.

What is Biotactical? 

BioTactical is a term YUNO has coined to define the process of improving human performance at the biological level through botanical ingredients; spices, herbs, roots, fruits, berries, and seeds. By making slight tweaks to your diet, you can heal your gut and other healing benefits will follow suit. YUNO provides NATURAL and PRACTICAL ways to power up, relax, and everything in between. 

Why science-backed nutrition? 

With a commitment to the quality of every blend, Yuno is backed by science by harnessing research behind the gut-brain axis. The idea is that when your body is in balance and everything’s running smoothly, you run better as well.

These 2-ounce blends are convenient and portable, so you can always have your favorite Yuno on hand. They are also vegan and keto-friendly,  designed to pack the punch you need without any additives, crashes, or ingredients you can’t pronounce.

Yuno Energy | If you’ve got a particularly busy day ahead and need sustained energy that won’t make you crash, Yuno Energy is your go-to. This spicy yet sweet citrus and pepper blend works by giving your metabolism a boost, helping your body absorb and process nutrients to promote both mental and physical alertness. You’ll move right through that midday slump and feel light on your feet as you tackle all the challenges of your day. Yuno Energy is great when taken in place of your normal espresso shot.

Yuno Focus | When you have deadlines to hit but your mind won’t stop wandering, turn to Yuno Focus. By focusing on calming your mind, increasing your concentration and refreshing your eyesight as you stare at that screen, Yuno Focus helps you feel more attentive, alert, and able to tackle your task head-on. Unlike other fleeting focus drinks you may have tried, this fruity and refreshing blend gives you a sustained focus to channel throughout the day. Yuno Focus tastes great when made into a latte by adding a bit of milk.

Yuno Memory | If your brain is about to get a serious workout, give it the boost it needs with Yuno Memory. Formulated to help clear up a foggy brain and improve your mental acuity, you’ll want Yuno Memory by your side to enhance critical and creative thinking. This unique umami flavor will be your new favorite “brain food”, working particularly great when added to your favorite smoothie.

Yuno Uplift | For those searching for that little extra help to get through a stressful situation either socially or professionally, Yuno Uplift gives you the confidence you need to conquer anything. Yuno Uplift works by making you feel more relaxed and therefore, better able to be your wonderful self. Bold and full-bodied, Yuno Uplift is the perfect complement to your favorite glass of red.

Yuno Zen | If you have trouble unwinding or need to snap out of your funk, Yuno Zen is here to help. Whether it’s relaxing after a particularly stressful day or simply giving yourself a natural pick-me-up, Yuno Zen is made to make you feel warm and cozy inside. And once you’re feeling like that on the inside, you’ll be able to project that on the outside. We love Yuno Zen as the metaphorical cherry on top of your favorite ice cream sundae.

Yuno Dream | When all you need is just a good night’s sleep, turn to Yuno Dream to start counting more restful, nourishing Zzzs. Its drowsy experience soothes you into a natural state of relaxation, so your body can go into “repair” mode. This woodsy and sleepy blend ensures you will wake up feeling more naturally rested than ever. Simply warm it up with your choice of nighttime beverage and start counting sheep.

 

See how Yuno stacks up against your favorite beverages.

You might not think about your gut all that often. But it’s actually key to maintaining homeostasis in the body. After all, there’s a reason mom told you to “trust your gut”. That’s how important it is.

And this is not just about smoother trips to the bathroom. In fact, scientific studies show that the gut-brain axis is one of the most critical aspects of performance. If your gut-brain axis is out of whack, so are you. 

That’s why all Yuno blends are chosen ingredients shown to improve gut-brain communication. And with carefully-selected ingredients that naturally provide certain benefits like immunity, energy, and relaxation, each Yuno blend becomes a powerful little pack that makes you more YOU. No additives. No crash. No bullsh*t mystery ingredients.

 

The gut-brain axis is key to how active, happy, focused or relaxed you feel (or don’t feel). But why?

Well as it turns out, the gut holds the key to all those little neurotransmitters that are running around inside our bodies all the time. These are the little hits of serotonin and dopamine that the body serves up to make us happy, productive, and in control. 

Yuno works from the inside out, using the gut as a superhighway to your brain and delivering these neurotransmitters more directly. By targeting the gut in this way, we activate your body using an all-natural approach much different from using additives like caffeine. It’s all about optimizing the best you - straight from your gut to your brain.

At Yuno, we care deeply about the quality of our products - and that includes how they get made. We have adopted a carefully-considered zero waste, sustainable production process. Alongside our partner Grounded-Upcycling, we ensure that any residue created in the Yuno production process is turned into nutrient-rich food used to grow mushrooms. And when you’re done with your Yuno pack, you don’t have to worry about recycling it on your own because every delivery box will be able to be sent to and recycled by our partners at Terracycle at no additional cost to you. 

These efforts result in us being 12X more sustainable than a single can of soda. So you can feel great drinking Yuno and feel great about your low-impact on the Earth.

We founded Yuno because we believe in the power of nature. For us, it was important that we created a product that aligned with our values of transparency and effectiveness. The “natural” food market is cluttered with so many products making so many claims that it’s hard to know what you can trust.

Our company, Food to Heal, was founded on these principles. We make natural ingredients the heroes of our products, focusing on how unique product and flavor combinations together to achieve high-performance results.

With a background in food research, we had science on our side from the beginning. And that commitment to science carries through in everything we do. Our focus on the relationship between the brain and the gut enables us to provide a product that is grounded in nature but approached in an entirely new way.

We can’t wait to have you join the Yuno family.


Please check out the FAQ section available within Indiegogo, our website at www.yuno.nyc for more information, or drop us a line at hello@yuno.nyc if you have any additional questions!

story:
Cooking is to be found difficult, time-consuming. But with FIR+ Cooking Master and its unique Far infrared Ray Heating Technology, you can master the Michelin Quality Dining Experience in only 10-20min. Fast, Healthy, and Easy cooking.

 

10min Steak, 15min Stew & Boil, 20min Meal… Fast & Efficient

With FIR+, the cooking techniques and ingredients are most used by Michelin Star Restaurants. Now, you can not only have it at home but also enjoy the most efficient cooking speed realized by our Patented Far-Infrared Ray Generator.

 

20 Smart cooking system includes customizable DIY cooking functions

FIR+ combines Far Infrared Ray technology with precision temperature control to elevate your cooking skills to Michelin Master-Level. Turn a greenhand into a master chef instantly. Cooking becomes so easy to handle.

 

The 20 Cooking Menus are Steak, Lambchop, Chicken, Porkchop, Cod, Pancake, Cake, Cookie, Jam, Sandwich, Veggies, Porridge, Regimen M-boil, Regimen stew, Regimen Low-temp, Fry, Salmon, Soup, Defrost, and DIY.

Single-button operation. Simple & easy to cook countless cuisines and endless delicious possibilities.

 

A Large LED Display Makes Operation Straightforward And Intuitive. 

Set modes, choose functions, monitor temperature. What you see is what you get.

 

 

Low-Temp Cooking Function Retains Nutrients for Healthier Dishes.

120℃-200℃ Low-Temp Oil-Fry preserves UFA & Inhibits TFA, keeps trans-fatty acids away from your daily foods, and helps people avoid obesity.

 

 

FIR+ Cooking Master has a unique low-temperature cooking mode that guarantees nutrition and taste for any recipe.

 

Healthy STEW & BOIL Function is done in 15-25min, retains original taste without nutrients loss, and requires no oil.

 

No oil cooking reduces fumes for a healthier kitchen with cleaner air, won’t burn skin, operates quietly, and doesn’t require a vented range hood.

 

 

Proprietary Far Infrared Ray Heating Method

Patented Core Tech Ensures Professional Fine Dining Experiences, powerful Heating Method for Healthy Meals and Professional Quality Taste.

 

An Effective Heating Method Saves Time & Energy

Step up your cooking game to the next level! The molecular resonance generates an effective heat source that shortens cooking time while maintaining perfect taste.

 

Temperature adjustment allows precise temperature control from 70~500℃ (158-932℉), in 10℃ increments to satisfy all cooking styles. It’s a personalized DIY menu for you to free adjust!

 

High-Quality Die-cast Aluminum Pan and Lid

Thickened pan structure is durable and ensures heat retention & even heat distribution for better cooking & healthier results. The Pan Made by Die-Cast Aluminum is one of the most widely used materials in the North American family. Built Solid For Better Cooking:

 

Water-Based Non-Stick Coating

Non-stick and Easy To Clean: Concentrate on Cooking and Have Less Mess!

 

Artistic All Metal Industrial Design

With the removable pan design, FIR+ can be placed directly onto the table for serving and beautifully presents your cuisine for a pleasing dining experience with friends and family.
 

 
  • 500℃ Demo
  •  Intl' Authorized Lab SGS Report

Report of 'Non-Stick Pan testing' & 'Inhibit TFA Significantly'

story:
Oomph™ 2.0 patented system pressure brews coffee to the standard of a professional coffee maker and greatly outperforms any manual coffee maker. on the market.

 

 

 

Making the perfect coffee couldn't be simpler. Add up to 26 grams of coffee,  hot water, wait, and press. Oomph™ 2.0 will take care of the rest - coffee perfection! Enjoy the coffee on its own or add milk and sugar.

 

 

The video animation above shows internally how the Oomph™ 2.0 brews. Oomph™ 2.0 locks in the flavour and aromas after the brew. Simultaneously, the brewed coffee is separated from the grounds preventing bitterness.

 

 

 

As you can see, Oomph™ has been featured in some popular publications who all agree with just how good the coffee is from the Oomph. Along with this Oomph™ has featured on Radio shows, Podcasts and even BBC's Dragons Den, securing an investment from one of the Dragons. 

 

 

Being an amazing coffee maker is not where it ends... Once brewed, Oomph™ 2.0 locks securely to become a fully watertight, insulated travel cup.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 is made for more than just the kitchen and is the ultimate 2 in 1 coffee maker and travel cup:

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 makes amazing black coffee that can be taken anywhere! The easy-press piston design seals in the flavour after brewing until you are ready to drink. Completely self-contained within a watertight, compact travel cup, Oomph™ 2.0 will surpass your go-to kitchen coffee maker and enjoyed on-the-go.

 

 

Oomphs totally watertight design means no problems with accidental spills or carrying it around and that just brewed taste will be kept fresh and hot for up to an hour!

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 may be packed full of coffee wizardry but still only takes up the same space as many popular travel cups.

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 will fit in 96% of car cup holders and even if you are in the unlucky 4% it's watertight so can fit anywhere else.

 

 

Our case locking design is inspired by the Japanese methodology of Poka-Yoke. The casing now glides into the lock from any position so you simply can't get it wrong! With a reassuring CLICK, all that delicate aroma and fresh coffee taste are sealed in! [POKA-YOKE is a Japanese term which means “mistake-proofing”]

 

 

Safe and tough, Oomph™ 2.0 is made from the best materials available for the job. Never clouding, keeping its style and visually striking appearance use after use.

 

 

Pumping the Oomph™ 2.0 piston allows you to flush clean water back and forth through the reusable ultra-fine filter.  Watch as clogged coffee particles are blasted clear of the filter.  Just rinse out and you're ready to go.

 

 

 

Thanks to the narrowing chamber with a domed filter the used and compressed coffee cake just drops out of Oomph™ 2.0. 

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 can brew hot, cold and even tea! Our improved mechanism allows for a softer press, however producing a higher pressure! 

 

 

 

Oomph 2.0's non-drip designed spout means sharing Oomph with anyone is quick, easy and spill-free!

 

 

 

With all of the coffee makers on the market, many people ask how is Oomph™ 2.0 different, and better than other coffee makers? Oomph™ 2.0 combines contact time and erosion style brewing like that used in espresso machines. This allows you to easily produce a rich, consistent coffee, unrivalled by similarly priced coffee makers. See how it compares against other popular methods.

 

 

Now patented, Oomph™ 2.0 's brewing system is confirmed to brew like no other!

 

 

 

 

The original Oomph™ sold more than 50,000 units in 17 countries and has become the go-to coffee device for thousands of supporters around the world.

 

 

 

 

 

 

During research for Oomph™ 2.0, we asked what top 3 changes our customers would like to see on the next version of the Oomph™. We listened and made these changes. We incorporated the top 7 customer improvements within Oomph™ 2.0. We didn't stop there however and added many other additional improvements.

 

 

 

 

We have spent the last 2 years collecting and transferring all of our customers' feedback into tangible improvements and have been working hard to ensure all of the improvements are fully developed and tested. We believe we have made a coffee maker like no other on the planet and we're sure that you will love it as much as we do!

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 allows you to have hot, delicious coffee with you in the workplace or on-the-go. The fully watertight design means spilt coffee is a thing of the past, and being watertight increases Oomph™ 2.0's insulative properties. After brewing it now stays hot for up to an hour!

 

 

By integrating the seals we have reduced the number of components needed. This significantly increases the ease of use and improves the speed at which Oomph™ 2.0 can be assembled/cleaned.

 

 

Oomph™ 2.0 was built with your convenience in mind. Many travel cups are big and bulky. We designed Oomph™ 2.0 to deliver the necessary coffee brewing equipment inside one compact and lightweight package.

 

 

 

 

The Easy-Press Piston this ensures Oomph™ 2.0 performs well against even the best home coffee makers. Producing high pressure (for rich espresso-like taste) yet remaining easy to press, making coffee is a pleasure not a chore.

 

 

Due to its extremely portable design Oomph can be enjoyed anywhere (as long as you can get to coffee and hot water!).

 

 

 

It's not our first rodeo! Oomph™ 2.0 is our second project. The original Oomph™ was crowdfunded and delivered 3 years ago and has been featured by all of the above.

 

 

 

 

 

You have reached the end of the campaign - only 1 thing left to do - pledge! :)

story:
Hello! 

My name is Adrian and I have been roasting beans at home for myself for about 8 years or so and have dreamed of one day starting my own roasting business. Prior to that I was a barista for a number of years. As I've honed my roasting skills I have been encouraged by many to take the leap and be able to sell beans on a larger scale. 

In order to do that, I need to be trained on how to use a machine that roasts around 18 pounds of beans at a time compared to my home roaster that can roast 4 ounces at a time. Instead of 1 or 2 pound bags of green coffee beans I will need to buy 65 pound bags of beans! 

Once beans are roasted I will sell them via a website (where single bags and subscriptions will be available), as well as face to face (farmer's markets, etc.). My vision is to try to offer regular varietals as well limited seasonal roasts. 

I have already taken steps to start this venture. The business is registered, I have a domain and am working on a website, I have storage for roasted beans, bags, and even a logo stamp. This campaign will help with the final push to start buying beans, get the training, and purchase other needed gear and materials. 

The Story Behind The Name 

Ace Run Roasting is the name. I like to play disc golf and compete in tournaments when I can. In disc golf (and regular golf) when you are trying to make a hole in one, it's called an ace run. When I was a child my nickname was Ace, and I used to run track. That's the story.

What Is Needed

The training will be done at the place where I've been buying my personal green beans from: Mr. Green Beans in Portland, OR. The training will be in 3 hour long sessions and will cost $300. After the training I will be able to rent their machine for $35/hr. I should be able to do 3 roasts per hour.

I have to go through another source for the larger amounts of green beans. On average a 65 pound bag or box of green beans will cost around $200 each. I will need at least 3-4 boxes to get through the training.

I will need a machine that seals the bags in order to keep the coffee fresh. An entry level heat sealer machine is about $100. 

The website should cost around $90 for 3 months.

People like stickers and can be great promotional items and gifts. Those and business cards will cost me about $150

I really feel that that is about all I really need at the bare minimum to get started and have confidence that once people can taste what I have to offer that I will be able to maintain and slowly scale up from there. All in all everything listed above comes up to $1440. This platform holds money in case people change their minds and want a refund and it also takes a percentage off the top. It's probably a good idea to have a little cushion for things that I had not planned for as well as shipping packaging which is why my initial goal is higher. 

Risks & Challenges

I have confidence that I have good skills when it comes to roasting. I am admittedly nervous to learn to roast so much at a time even though the folks doing the training say that it's basically the same except for different buttons and knobs and being able to hook up a laptop to it and see what's going on! Knowing that they will be there guiding me helps me take deep breathes. Once I get the hang of it I know the quality of what I roast will surpass what I can do at home for myself.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily you can still help in a big way by helping me spread the word about this campaign. Copy the link, hit the share buttons, tell a friend, etc!

story:
[Image Description: Concept art for The Galaxy Coffee truck from three perspectives, featuring rainbow colors, unicorns, coffee beans, and stars.]

 

Overview

Have you ever gone to a coffee shop and felt out of place? Whether the atmosphere was unwelcoming, the prices were inaccessible, or the menu just wasn't your cup of tea, we know how that feels, and we want to make a space for you. 

Hi, we’re Jevonna and Kels, and we’re opening The Galaxy Coffee: a coffee truck for everyone!

As baristas and former coffee shop managers, we have a lot of pride in the coffee we serve. We also have pride in who we are — a small, local, queer and trans-owned worker cooperative with a commitment to building community and paying it forward. 

Our vision is to create a space where community gathers — people of all genders and generations — where you don't feel out of place. It's the reason we named ourselves after an idea in the queer community that gender is more than a binary, more than a spectrum, and more like a whole galaxy of possibilities. It's why we have our Community Jar for anyone to pay it forward when they can, and use when they need. It's also why, eventually, we want to open a brick-and-mortar coffee shop for everyone to enjoy each other's company as much as they enjoy our lattes and baked goods. Hopefully with your help, we can make this happen!

 

Our Goals

  • Inclusivity — we'll always be queer and trans inclusive, and our menu will include vegan, gluten-free, and sugar-free options, all for no extra charge.
  • Accessibility — we'll have accessible locations, braille and large-print menus, and with our Community Jar we can provide free food and drink options to customers who need it.
  • Transparency — we work with queer and/or locally owned businesses at every possible opportunity to source our products.
  • Empowerment — we are a worker cooperative, which means we are completely worker-owned.
  • Employment — we're prioritizing BIPOC, queer, trans, and disabled applicants of all generations.
  • Safety — we're requiring masks and social distancing, and we’re committed to creating a safe, healthy, and welcoming environment for our team and customers. 

 

Why We Need Your Help

  • Food truck ($25,000 - $35,000) — we’re prioritizing looking at used food trucks from other local businesses.
  • Brewing equipment ($12,000) — we need two espresso machines, scales, grinders, a fridge, and an oven.
  • Product ($3,000 to start) — we’ll need to buy coffee beans, tea, dairy and non-dairy milks, sweeteners and syrups, and food and bakery items.
  • Licensing and Legal Fees ($2,500) — we need inspections, certifications, and all our ducks in a row before we can officially open our windows!

 

All together, we're looking at $42,500 - $52,500 to start. With the help of loans and savings, we can get our coffee truck up and running if we make it to our $40,000 Indiegogo campaign goal, which would be incredible! And if the stars align and we're lucky enough to go past that, we can add even more vegan, gluten-free, and low carb food items to our menu, and we can go to more places in Columbus and see more of you!

 

Our Perks

We have so many perks! From coffee mugs and tumblers to t-shirts and masks, stickers and pins, as well as VIP beverage discounts and personalized thank you cards — we want you to find that perfect fit for your donation!

Our Community Jar is also included in our perks! So if you have a little extra, you can pay it forward for someone else to receive a perk, too. Or, if you need a little extra to get that perk you want, you can share our posts on social media, then email us [hello at thegalaxycoffee.com] with your perk request and a link to your post. We'll hand these out on a first-come, first-served basis with as many perks as the Community Jar will cover!

We'll unlock our 4 hidden perks for reaching each donation benchmark — our sew-on patches at $10,000; our bandanas at $20,000; our tote bags at $30,000; and our fanny packs at $40,000. 

[Image Description: The four hidden perks floating on a rainbow background. The patch and tote bag are black with a large white unicorn outline and the words "The Galaxy Coffee" in the middle. The bandana and fanny pack are black with a pattern of small white unicorn outlines and the words "The Galaxy Coffee" in the bottom right corner.]

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like, follow, and share our page — we’re on all social media! @thegalaxycoffee

Talk to your friends, family, and community about our truck — and make plans to visit us once we open!

 

Our Story 

Jevonna Morris (she/her) — I managed a coffee shop for four years and have been running a queer social group called Queer Crafting for the last five years. I have a degree in City Planning with a focus on Place Making, but it’s my thirteen years of experience in customer service that have taught me all about life, business, and the art of human connection.

Kels Wilson (they/them) — My experience is in coffee shop management and small business marketing. My degree in Business Administration with a specialization in Accounting comes in handy for operating the financial side of our business. And I’m passionate about customer service – seriously, it’s my favorite part of the job!

The Galaxy Coffee — Two years ago, we met working for a large coffee chain, and while we both loved the environment, and especially our customers, we had a bigger dream in common: a queer coffee shop. So this is the first step in that plan! With our coffee truck we can be mobile, versatile, and grow with Columbus and all of you.

We've made it a point to work with queer and/or local businesses every step of the way, from our business attorney to our credit union, and our suppliers for coffee beans, baked goods, and merchandise. We're fully incorporated as a worker cooperative, and we're working with a small business lender to secure our loans, as well as searching for the perfect truck. Our hope is to open as soon as possible, and if our campaign is successful we can do that as early as this summer! 

 

Our Menu

[Image Description: The Galaxy Coffee menu in black with bright colored font and The Galaxy Coffee truck in the bottom right corner. The title reads: "The Galaxy Coffee Food Truck — thegalaxycoffee.com". Contents of the menu are replicated in this next section.]

 

Coffee (12oz / 16oz)

Cold brew ... $3.50 / $4.00
Drip coffee ... $2.50 / $3.00
Pour-over ... $3.50 / $4.00
French press ... $3.50 / $4.00

Espresso (Hot or Cold)

Americano ... $2.00 / $2.50
Latte ... $4.00 / $4.50
Cappuccino ... $4.00 / $4.50
Mocha ... $4.50 / $5.00

Frozen 

Frozen coffee ... $4.50 / $5.50
Frozen lemonade ... $4.50 / $5.50
Smoothie ... $5.00 / $6.00
Milkshake ... $5.00 / $.600

Tea & Other Drinks

Chai latte ... $3.50 / $4.00
Hot or iced tea ... $2.50 / $3.00
Lemonade ... $2.50 / $3.00
Hot chocolate ... $3.50 / $4.00
Earl grey latte ... $4.00 / $4.50
Matcha latte ... $4.50 / $5.00

Food (Vegan & GF Options)

Scone ... $3.00
Muffin ... $3.50
Croissant ... $4.00
Breakfast sandwich ... $5.00
Omelette bites ... $5.00

Add-ons

Add espresso shot ... $1.00

story_txt:
[Image Description: Concept art for The Galaxy Coffee truck from three perspectives, featuring rainbow colors, unicorns, coffee beans, and stars.] OverviewHave you ever gone to a coffee shop and felt out of place? Whether the atmosphere was unwelcoming, the prices were inaccessible, or the menu just wasn't your cup of tea, we know how that feels, and we want to make a space for you. Hi, we’re Jevonna and Kels, and we’re opening The Galaxy Coffee: a coffee truck for everyone!As baristas and former coffee shop managers, we have a lot of pride in the coffee we serve. We also have pride in who we are — a small, local, queer and trans-owned worker cooperative with a commitment to building community and paying it forward. Our vision is to create a space where community gathers — people of all genders and generations — where you don't feel out of place. It's the reason we named ourselves after an idea in the queer community that gender is more than a binary, more than a spectrum, and more like a whole galaxy of possibilities. It's why we have our Community Jar for anyone to pay it forward when they can, and use when they need. It's also why, eventually, we want to open a brick-and-mortar coffee shop for everyone to enjoy each other's company as much as they enjoy our lattes and baked goods. Hopefully with your help, we can make this happen! Our Goals

Inclusivity — we'll always be queer and trans inclusive, and our menu will include vegan, gluten-free, and sugar-free options, all for no extra charge.

Accessibility — we'll have accessible locations, braille and large-print menus, and with our Community Jar we can provide free food and drink options to customers who need it.

Transparency — we work with queer and/or locally owned businesses at every possible opportunity to source our products.

Empowerment — we are a worker cooperative, which means we are completely worker-owned.

Employment — we're prioritizing BIPOC, queer, trans, and disabled applicants of all generations.

Safety — we're requiring masks and social distancing, and we’re committed to creating a safe, healthy, and welcoming environment for our team and customers. 
 Why We Need Your Help

Food truck ($25,000 - $35,000) — we’re prioritizing looking at used food trucks from other local businesses.

Brewing equipment ($12,000) — we need two espresso machines, scales, grinders, a fridge, and an oven.

Product ($3,000 to start) — we’ll need to buy coffee beans, tea, dairy and non-dairy milks, sweeteners and syrups, and food and bakery items.

Licensing and Legal Fees ($2,500) — we need inspections, certifications, and all our ducks in a row before we can officially open our windows!
 All together, we're looking at $42,500 - $52,500 to start. With the help of loans and savings, we can get our coffee truck up and running if we make it to our $40,000 Indiegogo campaign goal, which would be incredible! And if the stars align and we're lucky enough to go past that, we can add even more vegan, gluten-free, and low carb food items to our menu, and we can go to more places in Columbus and see more of you! Our PerksWe have so many perks! From coffee mugs and tumblers to t-shirts and masks, stickers and pins, as well as VIP beverage discounts and personalized thank you cards — we want you to find that perfect fit for your donation!Our Community Jar is also included in our perks! So if you have a little extra, you can pay it forward for someone else to receive a perk, too. Or, if you need a little extra to get that perk you want, you can share our posts on social media, then email us [hello at thegalaxycoffee.com] with your perk request and a link to your post. We'll hand these out on a first-come, first-served basis with as many perks as the Community Jar will cover!We'll unlock our 4 hidden perks for reaching each donation benchmark — our sew-on patches at $10,000; our bandanas at $20,000; our tote bags at $30,000; and our fanny packs at $40,000. [Image Description: The four hidden perks floating on a rainbow background. The patch and tote bag are black with a large white unicorn outline and the words "The Galaxy Coffee" in the middle. The bandana and fanny pack are black with a pattern of small white unicorn outlines and the words "The Galaxy Coffee" in the bottom right corner.] Other Ways You Can HelpLike, follow, and share our page — we’re on all social media! @thegalaxycoffeeTalk to your friends, family, and community about our truck — and make plans to visit us once we open! Our Story Jevonna Morris (she/her) — I managed a coffee shop for four years and have been running a queer social group called Queer Crafting for the last five years. I have a degree in City Planning with a focus on Place Making, but it’s my thirteen years of experience in customer service that have taught me all about life, business, and the art of human connection.Kels Wilson (they/them) — My experience is in coffee shop management and small business marketing. My degree in Business Administration with a specialization in Accounting comes in handy for operating the financial side of our business. And I’m passionate about customer service – seriously, it’s my favorite part of the job!The Galaxy Coffee — Two years ago, we met working for a large coffee chain, and while we both loved the environment, and especially our customers, we had a bigger dream in common: a queer coffee shop. So this is the first step in that plan! With our coffee truck we can be mobile, versatile, and grow with Columbus and all of you.We've made it a point to work with queer and/or local businesses every step of the way, from our business attorney to our credit union, and our suppliers for coffee beans, baked goods, and merchandise. We're fully incorporated as a worker cooperative, and we're working with a small business lender to secure our loans, as well as searching for the perfect truck. Our hope is to open as soon as possible, and if our campaign is successful we can do that as early as this summer!  Our Menu[Image Description: The Galaxy Coffee menu in black with bright colored font and The Galaxy Coffee truck in the bottom right corner. The title reads: "The Galaxy Coffee Food Truck — thegalaxycoffee.com". Contents of the menu are replicated in this next section.] Coffee (12oz / 16oz)Cold brew ... $3.50 / $4.00Drip coffee ... $2.50 / $3.00Pour-over ... $3.50 / $4.00French press ... $3.50 / $4.00Espresso (Hot or Cold)Americano ... $2.00 / $2.50Latte ... $4.00 / $4.50Cappuccino ... $4.00 / $4.50Mocha ... $4.50 / $5.00Frozen Frozen coffee ... $4.50 / $5.50Frozen lemonade ... $4.50 / $5.50Smoothie ... $5.00 / $6.00Milkshake ... $5.00 / $.600Tea & Other DrinksChai latte ... $3.50 / $4.00Hot or iced tea ... $2.50 / $3.00Lemonade ... $2.50 / $3.00Hot chocolate ... $3.50 / $4.00Earl grey latte ... $4.00 / $4.50Matcha latte ... $4.50 / $5.00Food (Vegan & GF Options)Scone ... $3.00Muffin ... $3.50Croissant ... $4.00Breakfast sandwich ... $5.00Omelette bites ... $5.00Add-onsAdd espresso shot ... $1.00Regular or sugar-free flavor ... $0.50Non-dairy ... Free

story:
NOSU, short for No Single Use, is the perfect solution to convenient, sustainable living thanks to its dual-purpose stainless steel tumbler with built-in cutlery.

Living sustainably shouldn't be hard, NOSU makes it effortless.

 

 

 

Rotate NOSU’s bottom cover to reveal the cutlery caddy. Push in on the spring-loaded caddy to pop out the stainless steel cutlery set. A fork, knife and spoon snap in and out of the caddy with ease.

 

 

No need to take the lid off to drink with NOSU’s innovative wheel-designed lid. Simply swipe to open or close!

 

 
 

NOSU includes a built-in handle on the lid for convenient carrying, no matter where you go!

 

With NOSU you never have to worry about your favorite tumbler not fitting where you need it to. NOSU is designed with your active lifestyle in mind– fitting most cup holders in backpacks, cars, bicycles and more.

 

Keep your drinks hot or cold for even longer with the highest level of insulation available in a tumbler.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

In recent years, there has been a shift in consumers making more eco-conscious decisions. Companies have released a plethora of natural products in hopes to reduce the amount of single-use items produced and used. Wax wraps, stainless steel cutlery, reusable food containers, and compostable trash bags are just a few examples of products that aim to reduce our carbon footprint. However, carrying a number of these products can become cumbersome and cluttered, especially when traveling or going out for the day.

Keep your hands and bags clutter-free with this tumbler and its hidden stainless steel cutlery.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hi, we’re Ryan and Aaron, long-time friends and business partners!

We both grew up in the surfing and wakeboard industry, so living a sustainable lifestyle has been a very integral part of our lives. With 15 years as partners in the marketing industry, creating a product of our own was always in the back of our minds. We were brainstorming business ideas and knew that we wanted to create something eco-friendly, which is when the idea for NOSU was born– a reusable tumbler with stainless steel cutlery stored inside. We created something that we were passionate about and are excited to launch a product that will drastically improve sustainability in people’s everyday lives. Simply put, we’re determined to make it effortless for people to be more sustainable while on the go.

 

 

 

 

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make NOSU a reality.

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or pre-order a NOSU, if you’re a supporter of NOSU, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!

 

 

As one of the first crowdfunding marketing agencies, Enventys Partners has brought more than 750 crowdfunding projects to life through lead generation, campaign page creation, public relations, email marketing, Facebook Advertising, campaign management and more.

story:
Chopsy is a modular chopping system that comes with between 1-4 different cutting boards and 5 unique pods that attach to the base unit. This means that you save time in the kitchen by being able to organize your meal preparation by separating waste and ingredients into different pods as you go. Your work area stays organized, your board stays clear and your prep time is reduced. There’s a board for vegetables, one for fish and another for meat, and they’re color-coordinated to make life easier.

     

 

Chopsy saves you time, reduces clean-up, and makes mealtime prep and organization faster and easier than ever before. It's not just a chopping board - Chopsy is a whole preparation system that you'll wonder how you managed to live without.

 

 

 

   

 

 

Let us take you through a few of the features and benefits of our ingenious, new, time-saving, food preparation masterpiece. We’ve spent years making sure every detail is just right and now we’re ready for you to see why we’re so obsessed with functionality.


No more trips to the bin between foods, with Chopsy you separate your waste and ingredients as you go saving time and energy. Just chop on the board and then slide the food or waste into the pod you wish to use, it's as easy as that and it will revolutionize your preparation for mealtimes!

 

We make your life easier with boards color-coordinated for each application to prevent cross-contamination. Vegetables & fruit on green, fish, and seafood on blue and meat on red. The boards store within the base unit when not in use and are easily identifiable with their tabs, just pull out the board you need, pop it on the base and you’re ready to go.

 

Chopsy is designed to last and the materials used in the cutting surfaces and pods are all  BPA free which means it’s safe, durable, and built to withstand use in even the most demanding family kitchen. Chopsy will be your go-to kitchen companion. 

 

Cooking has changed so why haven’t chopping boards? We’ve fixed that by incorporating a tablet holder into Chopsy, allowing you to follow your favorite recipes online, set a timer, or keep an eye on your messages.

 

Our pods don’t just allow you to organize your prep, you can also store, cook, and serve your food in them too! They’re made from durable, BPA-free food-grade polypropylene just like our boards, but are also microwave and dishwasher safe too.

 

     

 

When you're not using your pods they stack together perfectly for neat and tidy storage taking up less space in your kitchen - we've thought of everything! 

  

 

Healthy cooking is easy with Chopsy! The option of our vented / colander lids means you can prepare and cook delicious vegetables in one easy process. There's no more searching for a pan or making more utensils dirty - Chopsy makes it all more efficient. 

 

Go from board to table easily! The same lid you use for microwave cooking is perfect to use as a colander too - once you've chopped your food straight into the pod, just wash your fruit or vegetables and drain with the lid attached. More time saved and less washing to do too!

 

 

 

 

We've got 3 kits to choose from to make sure that there's a Chopsy set to suit everyone, whatever your lifestyle or needs in the kitchen. Each kit has been specifically designed to ensure you get the most out of each component and are able to start saving time and saving mess when preparing your meals. 

 

 

 

 

 

We've created add-ons to complement your Reward perfectly. Whether you need to do more prep, cutting, or storage, we've got a solution for your needs at special Kickstarter prices for our backers.


Our Expansion Sets extend the flexibility and functionality of your Chopsy, offering a combination of our unique pods and lids. Choose the set that best suits your lifestyle and how you like to prepare and cook food.

 

PREP SET: Ideal for the person who has demanding prep, we've included 2 of our Large Angled Pods, 1 Small Angled Pod, and a vented Colander Lid to help with washing and straining.


STORAGE SET: If you need to store more, we've got you! A selection of lids and our Deep Pods makes storing and prepping in bulk easier and quicker. If you love to get prepared in advance for the week ahead, this is for you!

 

CHEF SET: For the busiest family kitchens, our Chef Set gives you ultimate flexibility and convenience. Additional components across all of our pods and lids mean this is the most versatile set we offer.

 

By now you'll know that Chopsy is about more than just chopping, it's a whole kitchen prep system designed to save you time and make your life easier. But if you want to take that to the next level we've also created additional boards to expand Chopsy's functionality even further...

 

The Nano Board is $25 (Save $5 off MSRP of $30). 


The Multi-Use Board is $15 (Save $10 off MSRP of $25). 

 

We've created add-on's that complement your Rewards, simply choose the ones that suit you the best to take advantage of these offers when you pledge. Here's an example of how the add-ons work below:

 

 

All shipping fees will be collected separately once the campaign is over. Please see below for estimates: 

Shipping estimates for first Chopsy:  United States / United Kingdom: $10 | Canada / EU: $25 | SE Asia: $25 | Australia / New Zealand: $25 | Rest of the World: $25

Each additional Chopsy: +$10/Chopsy

Each Pledge Add-On: +$3/Add-On (US & Rest of the World)

 

*VAT/Customs duty will be pre-charged for customers in EU countries. In all other countries, the responsibility is at the time of delivery for the backer.

 

For EU backers only: We will be charging VAT duties in BackerKit once the campaign is over. Please see below for duties costs depending on your country.

 

VAT by country: Austria, Bulgaria, Estonia, France, Slovakia, United Kingdom: 20% | Belgium, Czech Republic, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Spain: 21% | Croatia, Denmark, Sweden: 25% | Cyprus, Germany, Romania: 19% | Finland, Greece: 24% | Ireland, Poland, Portugal: 23% | Italy, Slovenia: 22% | Hungary: 27% | Luxembourg: 17% | Malta: 18% 

 

 

This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $275MM through crowdfunding.

story:
UPDATE: My Anime Baking Cookbook is AVAILABLE NOW! Please support by getting a copy! ^o^ - https://amzn.to/3aHxLB5

If you purchase one, please fill out this form so I can send you a Thank You Gift! - http://tiny.cc/ThankYouGift

*****************************

Goal: Create an awesome Anime Baking & Dessert Recipes Cookbook

Hi! My name is Miki and I am the creator of SugarCoder. I started a YouTube channel showing how to bake and decorate different desserts inspired by anime and cute characters ever since 2012. Besides making desserts, I have been a huge anime fan ever since I was a kid. The very first anime I saw was Tonde Burin and I was hooked since then.

For years, I collected screenshots of desserts that I want to make from anime I watched. So recently, I decided that I will publish an awesome cookbook so that everyone can enjoy it. To stay updated on the cookbook, please visit http://tiny.cc/AnimeCookbook.

The reason I started this campaign

Self-publishing costs a lot because there is no financial, distribution, or marketing help from a large publishing company. Since I am currently unemployed and tight on $, I am raising money to cover costs like ingredients, paying for editing help, and misc. costs related to making the book. With your support, I hope to make this cookbook amazing! I hope that you will support this campaign and tell everyone else about it as well. I listed the rewards under different pledges.

Thank you for your support in advance. Have a sweet day!

-Miki
