story:
After a glass of wine or two, what do you do with the bottle? There is still wine in there, after all. You want to be able to pick back up right where you've left off. When you pour another glass – tomorrow, the next day, or a week from now – you want to feel confident that the wine is going to taste and feel just as good as it did the first time around. If you go shopping for wine stoppers, though, you are going to find two options, neither ideal: wine stoppers that are expensive and wine stoppers that are complicated.

The Auto Stopper is different. Both affordable and straightforward, it makes it easy for you to hold on to your bottle of wine, saving it until you are ready to finish it at your next meal or once the next weekend rolls around. Keeping your wine fresh for a full 7 to 10 days, the Auto Stopper ensures that every glass is lovely, whether the bottle is brand-new or now.

Here's how it works: After installing two AAA batteries, you place the Auto Stopper on the bottle and press down. The Auto Stopper then does all of the work for you, kicking its vacuum function into action, as signaled via the blue indicator light on top. Once the Auto Stopper has completed its vacuum function, the green indicator light will let you know.

What We Need & What You Get

We are now turning to you to help raise the funds that we need to manufacture, market, and distribute the Auto Stopper on a large scale. Our goal through this campaign is $20,000, which will cover the costs that we are facing as we put in our minimum order quantities and promote the Auto Stopper to casual wine drinkers far and wide.

To say thanks to everyone who contributes to this campaign, we are offering early access to the Auto Stopper exclusively through this campaign. That means for a limited time only, by acting now, you can get an Auto Stopper of your own before anyone else does.

Just make a contribution and pre-order now!

Risks & Challenges

 At the time of this campaign launch, we are approximately one month away from delivering the Auto Stopper's initial orders. We do not foresee any additional challenges arising – at least, nothing that would cause a delay in our timeline. Regardless, you can count on us to remain transparent throughout this process, letting you know of all the progress we are making.

One More Way to Help

In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for the Auto Stopper by sharing a link to the campaign page on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of the Auto Stopper before we start shipping out pre-orders and promoting it to a broader audience, the smoother the next several months will go for us.

We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for your time.

story:
Spotted Octopus Brewing Company!

Our focus is to build an atmosphere unlike any of the existing taprooms in the city’s booming craft brewing industry by bringing unique and experimental offerings in small revolving batches. All of our beers will be made with a majority of NY products and NY grown ingredients.  The snacks and lite fare we will serve will be obtained by local small business around the city. 

Opening a brewery comes with a hefty price tag. Having done this all on our own (to this point) through our savings, friends and family, we are left with a longer list of necessities than we have cash to support. We hope that all of you that are passionate about craft beer, local small businesses and pushing the limits of what is available in your community, will consider becoming a supporter. We are a brewery for those that love different flavors and will not settle for the same old beer day after day week after week. Our intention is to be a place for all people, all lifestyles to come be comfortable and drink great beer and crafted cocktails. Your contributions will not only validate our mission and your desire for more options, but it will also ultimately help us reach our goal of being an anchor in Buffalo, NY.

What We Need 

To serve the greater Buffalo area effectively with our awesome brews, we need to invest in furnishing our taproom. Without tables and seating, we will not be able to have a comfortable environment for our customers. Without keg racks, we will not be able to adequately stock our walk-in cold room to keep the draft lines full of delicious beer. Your support will help us finish the aesthetics with matching lighting, shelves, and other décor. Which will help make it a comfortable place where people want to hang out. Without these items our tap house will struggle to become a place where people enjoy each other’s company.

The Impact

While these items may not seem the most exciting, they are critical for our success. Your donation to Spotted Octopus will help us to produce a quality product that can be shared and enjoyed in a great location in the heart of the city. This campaign is intended to be completely transparent. So contact us with any questions you may have.

 

Risks & Challenges

Startup breweries are labor and capital intensive, and our plan is to avoid as much commercial debt as we can. We’ve done our due diligence researching every possible roadblock we can think of but, as with any new business, unforeseen expenses and delays could be a challenge. Fall of 2021 is our goal for opening and we’re working towards that goal in every spare moment. Lots of great people are behind us — and we hope to include you! Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Post about us and our fundraiser to your social media sites!
  • Tell your friends and family about us too!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Spotted Octopus Brewing Company!
Our focus is to build an atmosphere unlike any of the existing taprooms in the city’s booming craft brewing industry by bringing unique and experimental offerings in small revolving batches. All of our beers will be made with a majority of NY products and NY grown ingredients.  The snacks and lite fare we will serve will be obtained by local small business around the city. 

Opening a brewery comes with a hefty price tag. Having done this all on our own (to this point) through our savings, friends and family, we are left with a longer list of necessities than we have cash to support. We hope that all of you that are passionate about craft beer, local small businesses and pushing the limits of what is available in your community, will consider becoming a supporter. We are a brewery for those that love different flavors and will not settle for the same old beer day after day week after week. Our intention is to be a place for all people, all lifestyles to come be comfortable and drink great beer and crafted cocktails. Your contributions will not only validate our mission and your desire for more options, but it will also ultimately help us reach our goal of being an anchor in Buffalo, NY.


What We Need 
To serve the greater Buffalo area effectively with our awesome brews, we need to invest in furnishing our taproom. Without tables and seating, we will not be able to have a comfortable environment for our customers. Without keg racks, we will not be able to adequately stock our walk-in cold room to keep the draft lines full of delicious beer. Your support will help us finish the aesthetics with matching lighting, shelves, and other décor. Which will help make it a comfortable place where people want to hang out. Without these items our tap house will struggle to become a place where people enjoy each other’s company.


The Impact
While these items may not seem the most exciting, they are critical for our success. Your donation to Spotted Octopus will help us to produce a quality product that can be shared and enjoyed in a great location in the heart of the city. This campaign is intended to be completely transparent. So contact us with any questions you may have.
 

Risks & Challenges
Startup breweries are labor and capital intensive, and our plan is to avoid as much commercial debt as we can. We’ve done our due diligence researching every possible roadblock we can think of but, as with any new business, unforeseen expenses and delays could be a challenge. Fall of 2021 is our goal for opening and we’re working towards that goal in every spare moment. Lots of great people are behind us — and we hope to include you! Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
Post about us and our fundraiser to your social media sites!
Tell your friends and family about us too!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Fonte aims to build equitable communities by forming meaningful relationships with those who experience food insecurity.

Fonte was born from the idea that anyone can make a difference. We are redefining the traditional restaurant experience, placing an emphasis on equity and community. We are able to reinvest in our community through a buy one, give one model. Purchasing a meal from Fonte will provide four meals worth of food to food banks in the local Columbus area. 

Food insecurity is a serious problem.

Because of the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, more than 50 million people may experience food insecurity, including 17 million children. Prior to coronavirus, in 2019, the USDA reported that more than 35 million people in the United States struggled with hunger.

Food insecurity impacts every community in the country. And many households that experience food insecurity do not qualify for federal nutrition programs and need to rely on their local food banks for support. 

In Ohio, 1.6 million people are struggling with hunger, ranking it one of the worst states for food security in the entire country. 

In the Central Ohio community, the COVID-19 pandemic has resulted in a 38% increase in food distributed by the Columbus food banks. This translates to about 200,000 meals each day. In 2020, over 22,000 families visited one of the Mid-Ohio Food Collective's partner agencies for the first time. 

We believe the restaurant industry can do more to fight food insecurity.

The restaurant industry brings in an estimated $24.2 billion in sales each year. That's why we've crafted our business model to provide a unique dining experience while providing meals to those experiencing food insecurity in our community. 

What are we raising money for?

We are raising money to enter the first phase of a three-part startup model: pop-up locations. We plan to pop up around different parts of Columbus starting in June. The pop-up locations will  feature Fonte's original Foboccia entree as well as select appetizer options, and you'll be fighting food insecurity through our buy one, give one model!

The money raised will go towards kitchen rental, food transport, part-time staff, food supply, administrative fees, kitchen equipment, and takeout materials.

How will it work?

Your job is easy: Come enjoy one of our delicious meals. The price of your meal pays for your meal and a meal for someone who experiences food insecurity. We send that portion to Columbus food banks, who then turns your contribution into meals for those in our community.

story:
Hi my name is Marlon and I would like to tell you a little bit about my story. I’m from Los Valles Centrales Oaxaca and moved to Los Angeles 10 years ago. It was here where I discovered my passion for coffee and what I could express through it. A couple of years later I met Pilar, and I never imagined we would start the Café Santo journey together.

We have been serving our community since 2016, making coffee at Farmers Markets, pop-ups, private events, and festivals. As a locally-owned family business, connecting with our community is what we have loved the most as part of this experience.

Last year, we found a perfect place to take Café Santo to the next chapter, a place where we could open a permanent location at BLVD MRKT in Montebello. Establishing our first brick-and-mortar will allow us to serve the community by providing a space where they can enjoy quality coffee, specialty Oaxacan chocolate, and a light breakfast that will include some classic items from my hometown. As Montebello residents, we know our city needs a space to build community. We want to unite our community by offering workshops and create a space for art, music, and cultural events that everyone can have access to. 

It’s been an adventure full of surprises and experiences, and most recently we’re reminded once more that without our family, friends, and beloved costumers, Café Santo wouldn’t have come this far. We truly believe coffee connects people in a magical way. It is your support that keeps us going.

As we are preparing for this milestone in our business, we have created a fundraiser with the hopes that you can continue to support and contribute to make our first coffee shop a reality and help us grow our community.

Our team and incredibly talented artists Mariana Rodriguez Fernandez (from Oaxaca) and Juan Renteria (Born in Cuernavaca, raised in LA), have designed special and unique pieces to help raise funds. These funds will allow us to finish building the space that is being created with lots of love and gratitude for our community. As we continue to look forward despite adversity, your kind contribution will help finish building the space and make this a successful transition from mobile services to our first brick and mortar shop. You can also help by sharing this message, or even cheering us on until we reach our goal. 

From the bottom of our hearts, for your time and unconditional support, GRACIAS!

Marlon & Pilar

Café Santo

story:
Welcome!

      My name is Elizabeth Katona, founder and cheese monger of Katona's Kreamery. I'm a professionally trained chef with a bachelors in Culinary Arts. So I know my cheese, which mean I know it should be funky even without the dairy!

     I started my company over a year ago, and the demand for cheese keeps growing! The proof of its success is in the compliments of our return customers and the constant addition of vendors to the roster. It's important to have dairy free options that taste incredible, and are available to everyone!

 

What we need and Why

Katona's Kreamery is looking to raise $12,500 to take this company to the next level!

The money will be used for:

  • Private kitchen - deposits & rent
  • Multiple refrigeration units / walk in cooler.
  • Raw materials to make more product (like nuts)
  • High speed blenders, and other kitchen equipment needed to scale production.
  • Production Permits and Kitchen Inspections 

     The demand for CoCoBlue has been growing exponentially. The only way to keep up, is to expand! The $12,500 is the ideal amount to ease our growing pains and enable us to share our product with a much wider audience. 

Any additional funds will not go to waste. We have a strategy that can utilize any and all funds raised. 

Our fan base has been established and now its time to grow!

 

The Impact YOU have

     By donating today you will be helping out so much more than you realize. Our mission is to show people that they don't need dairy to scratch that cheese itch! The possibilities are endless with food, all that's required is a little imagination. 

Everyone makes a difference!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

     We know not everyone is able to contribute with money. Help us out by sharing on social media. You never know who might want to help!

If you have further questions that you don't feel we covered here;

Reach out via email: katonascreamery@gmail.com - We would love to hear your thoughts. 

Take care! & Thank you for stopping by.

 

If you are a venture capitalist looking to become a part of Katona;

send us an email to get a more detailed look at the inside of our business. 

 

 

 

Customer reviews & our product in action!

story:
Just who ARE these guys?


We are Bryan and Bri Toedtli, owners of Drop Shop Distillery.  Six years ago, we set out on a journey to Victoria BC for a long weekend of racing dragonboats, drinkin’ brews in the beer garden, and just having a great old time with our team mates and our Canadian friends.  That entire weekend we discussed opening a distillery with the possibility of eventually leaving our day jobs.  So, in March of 2016 we started Drop Shop.  Since then, our product line as well as our customer base has grown!  And we’ve managed to bootstrap it the entire way.  But now we need a little help.

What We Need & What You Get

We are wanting to expand our line into the brandy, whiskey, and bourbon spectrums.  But without a bigger still, that will be next to impossible.  We are looking to raise enough funds to purchase a 1000 liter still, solid state electronic controller, some barrels, and a new digital hydrometer.  
 
We have thought hard about some different perks we can offer as a way to say THANK YOU  and we think you will love them! We have complete faith in our friends, family, and wonderful customers that we will be able to reach our goal in no time.  However, if we don’t reach our goal, the funds we do raise will still go towards the purchase of the new still, just in the form of a down payment.  Quite opposite, should we exceed our goal (fingers crossed) we will invest in more barrels and grain, and maybe even a bigger space to store them in…

NOTE***  All perks for ALCOHOL PRODUCTS will be given in the form of a VOUCHER in order to comply with Indiegogo's rules.  Please contact us directly with any questions.

 

The Impact


With our current setup, we have to mash and ferment in extremely small batches – no bigger than about 30 gallons at a time, simply because we can only run stripping runs through our 26 gallon test still.  We currently have the ability to ferment up to 250 gallons at a time, but that amount would literally take us about 40 hours to strip.  Option B is to take the 250 gallons of bourbon mash down to our friends distillery almost 2 hours away and strip it in 1 batch.  That involves renting a utility trailer, driving down, unloading and setting up the run, stripping the run, then clean up and head back home – a 2-day process, but it gets done in one run!  The new still would cut out all of the extra time and travel.  With a busy farmers market schedule planned for this summer we just don’t have a lot of extra time. 

  
‘Still’ not convinced?


If your still on the fence about helping, we invite you to please come to the distillery and ask for a taste of the future of Drop Shop!  We have a few small test barrels aging away on Bryan’s messy desk in the back that we can tap out a sample of what we are dreaming of making!  We have a Rye bourbon, and a rye whiskey to try – at cask strength of course!  Your taste buds will be happy!


Other Ways You Can Help


We totally understand that not everyone has the means to help us out financially.  That’s ok, just help by spreading the word about our campaign, share it on your social media and let all of your friends, extended family, and co-workers know about this awesome little distillery out in Hillsboro Oregon that wants to grow!  Send them to our website or Facebook pages, or even right back here to our Indiegogo page.  We are only a husband and wife team who both still have our day jobs, doing our best to make this dream work.  We have no paid employees, but Bri’s mom helps us out with the farmers markets and bottling.  We have put every last bit of energy into Drop Shop so our customers can reap the rewards.  We just wanted to say thanks a bunch for helping us out, supporting local and small businesses, and helping us make our dream come true.  Every little bit helps.  Please stop by the distillery sometime and check it out!

story:
An overnight success story, 23 years in the making?

When Jennie - the owner of beloved Chicago vegan restaurant Kitchen 17 - stopped eating meat at 6 years old, nobody knew that her passion for animals and the environment would bring her to creating a nationally distributed brand, but here we are! All vegan and made from scratch. Now, we are asking for your support, in exchange for delicious and rad rewards, as we expand.

All of our "perks" are fair market value and exclusive to this campaign! Want to try the classics? Check out kitchen17.com - we appreciate and value your support any way you slice it!

Launching “the original vegan deep dish” frozen pizzas had been quietly in development for years before we pushed the green button - a little earlier than expected. We launched in March 2020, the day after lockdown started in Chicago. When over 1000 orders came in on the first day, we wondered if it was a fluke… but it wasn’t. Online orders have been consistent and we now ship nationally! Kitchen 17 was also just named the #2 BEST VEGAN RESTAURANT IN THE NATION by vegan authority VegOut. The vibes are excellent.

Here’s the problem: the entire restaurant is now a pizza factory… and the pizza factory is too small. 

We need to get the restaurant open, and we just went into contract on a building. It’s happening, and it’s perfect. 

It’s also large enough to accommodate Smiley Face Media - Jennie’s sister Lorry, and brother-in-law, Rick’s media production company - who are conveniently now living 5 minutes from the building after relocating from Los Angeles in March (thank you again, pandemic)! They handle a lot of Kitchen 17's content, branding, packaging, and marketing - things like this campaign's video.

The building is located in Huntington, Indiana - the old newspaper building right across from the courthouse and Little River. At the heart of this story, is the fact that Huntington is Lorry and Jennie’s hometown, with family lines on both sides going back generations. 

Our goal of 750k covers the cost of the building, the initial buildout and equipment for the pizza factory, and the initial labor for our new hires. Jennie’s visions have never been limited to pizza - we have a master plan to bring healthy, fresh, delicious plant-based foods to all the hard-to-reach places: small towns, public schools, nursing homes, hospitals… everywhere we can, one step at a time.

As soon as the pizza factory is up and running, we will begin building out “The Newsroom” - in the old newsroom - a spin-off of Kitchen 17, as well as being Huntington, Indiana’s first plant-based restaurant and coworking space. The building has a riverfront area perfect for outdoor dining, and there’s never been a better time to bring vegan food to a small town in the Midwest. For those of you that have had Kitchen 17 - you know - it’s not just good, it’s d*mn good. Craveable. Distinct. The kind of vegan food that people who “hate vegan food” find delicious. 

Once that’s up and rolling, we are going to convert the basement into a wild mushroom farm (a much cleaner project than it sounds), and add greenhouses onto the rooftop with space for rooftop dining and events. We know, we know - one step at a time. By ultimately maximizing the square footage for sustainable endeavors that relate to the business (wild mushroom pizza!) and by enhancing the arts and entertainment options in Huntington, we create a blueprint for how small towns… or big towns, anywhere... can turn unutilized, historically relevant buildings into something really rad and with real utility.  

The heat is on for us to do this right, and we won’t stop until we do. Thank you for your support, and please share!

story:
Focus-Enhancing Energy that's backed by Science!

 

A Message From Our Founders

We are EXTREMELY excited to launch our campaign for Seltz! We truly believe that this drink is far better than anything else out there, and that it can make a difference in your day. Thank you for your support - we can't wait to share some Seltz with you!

-Brandon, Gannon, and Max

Testimonials

 

Our Story

For us, it all started with a shared desire to be our best, day in and day out. 

The Seltz team met in college, that time where there are so many opportunities and things to do that it feels that there's just not enough time... and energy... to do it. That didn't stop us from trying though, and we fell into the all-so-common pattern of alternating between pots of coffee and the newest energy drink (..or both). We were mindlessly "running on caffeine" - that frustrating feeling like you're pushing your body so hard that your mental self just can't keep up.

We knew there was a more effective way to use caffeine. It became clear to us that a careful balance of both physical and mental elevation is vital for feeling genuinely energized, just like that determined, confident capableness that naturally comes with a second wind.

So we did our research and learned the science. We commandeered our roommate's SodaStream. We relentlessly pursued a natural, effective, balanced energy solution that we could truly call the best. We found Seltz, and we knew we had to share it with the world.

We believe that merely "running on caffeine" is a compromise we shouldn't have to make. Caffeine shouldn't have to come with a trade-off of sustained focus and consistency for jitters or sugar crashes. With Seltz, there is no "running on caffeine" - there's only "running on you," boosting your body and your mind together to reveal the natural high performance of you being at your very best.

Our mission is to elevate you to your peak mental performance, without compromise. Our goal is to help you reach your mental and physical best. Every day.

The Seltz Difference

  

"Seltz is the ultimate update to the traditional "energy drink," providing an improved mental and physical performance with natural, guilt-free ingredients. Our unique energy blend, featuring a synergistic combination of caffeine and amino-acid derivatives, is tailored to simultaneously boost energy and mental focus - all while eliminating the unwanted side effects of caffeine. This results in a calm, focused, sustained increase in energy and attention that sets the stage for optimal mental performance.

Our drinks are designed with an "essentials only" approach: every ingredient has a purpose, and every ingredient is its healthiest version. Our energy blend is supported by rigorous scientific research and decades of anecdotal evidence from the health and supplement community.

Our flavors are crafted from all-natural ingredients to provide a sugar-free, preservative-free beverage with less than 5 calories. Our dedication to a healthier, natural alternative to a traditional energy drink results in a refreshing experience unique to the energy drink space: our seltzers feel good to drink, feel good to work, and feel absolutely guilt free."​

Referral Rewards

Important: You must be logged into your Indiegogo account and use Indiegogo’s share tools for the analytics to track any referral contributions. Referred customers must buy $30 or more.

 

Timeline

 

Stretch Goals

Shipping

Shipping will be charged after the campaign ends. This allows us to offer you the cheapest option available due to Indiegogo taking a percentage of the total amount raised. By doing this both you and Seltz save money!

Support

story:
Who is Brew -N- Krew? 

Brew -N- Krew Ale House is a new brewery coming to Salinas City Center (downtown Salinas) late Winter. 

We need your help TODAY to bring BREW -N- KREW ALE HOUSE - the first brewery out of Salinas owned by a locals who decided to turn their hobby into a reality. Take a look at the perks we have established and click on them for more details. If more clarification is needed, feel free to send us an email. 

When this project started, we had three conditions:  to implement our Mexican/Salinas culture in every beer made, any public event hosted would be family friendly, and regardless of the circumstances we'd always try to give back to our loving community.

'Till this day we have been able to stay true to our conditions. 

What started as a hobby is about to be the new wave in Downtown Salinas! Donate today and help create a permanent space for locals to celebrate our community culture while drinking craft beer. 

MAKING DOPE BEER CON CULTURA!

WE NEED YOUR HELP BRINGING BREW -N- KREW ALE HOUSE TO SALINAS, CA. 

If you have walked down main street by the cinema you have most likely seen our COMING SOON sign. Our brewery and tasting room home will be 155 Main Street (in between Maya Cinema & Villa Azteca). We are beyond excited to open our doors very soon to every single one of you. It's been a long journey and it is slowly coming together. 

The concept of brewing our own beer started in our garage. We used to travel up and down CA visiting breweries. We love collecting and investing in beer cans from the West and East Coast. One day we decided to invest in the love we have for beer and we began to make it. We are family oriented and are committed to building a legacy of pouring exceptional craft beer. We are driven by the idea of adding our Mexican/Salinas cultura to our brew in every batch we make. Nonetheless, we want to continue making dope beer, have fun and celebrate life everyday.

Proud of one of our brewers who was featured in the Monterey Weekly! http://www.montereycountyweekly.com/people/face_to_face/marlene-garc-a/article_8bed3a94-a35b-11e9-aec4-7322af9195c1.html

A COMMUNITY EFFORT

As you can imagine, to fund a project of this magnitude is no walk in the park. It is hard and stressful. A lot of sacrifices have been made to make this dream of ours happen. Nonetheless, it’s expensive, but the end result is empowering.  With your contribution today, you will help remind our community that anything can be accomplished with hard work, dedication, corazon, creativity, intelligence and support from one another. We want everyone to know that there are great people/business in Salinas, Ca. We want people to come visit us and see the authenticity we're bringing to Downtown Salinas. Implementing our community culture to our people by the people. We will no longer just write the story, but own the narrative! We are huge on supporting locals. We want people to drink local beer and bring revenue to our city. We are proud of our city and are committed to represent it 110%.

To all our family/friends, supporters, craft beer enthusiasts, local artists, content creators and all those who appreciate dope culture, we need your help today in raising $75,000 to bring this brewpub to Salinas, Ca.

Your contribution to this campaign will send a message to the world that ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE.  It will show our community, future leaders, our children that Salinas locals can make dreams turn into realities. To everyone reading this, "los sueños, metas y propositos si se cumplen." 

IF WE DO NOT MEET OUR GOAL...

Even if we do not reach our goal, we will still move forward with opening the brewery/tasting room. A lot of time, tears, sacrifices, hard work, creativity, and love has been invested into making this brewery a reality. Our own money from our savings and loans we have received from family and friends have helped fund this project to this day. 

Everyone said this would be hard and stressful and they were right. It is not easy and we are working every day to make BREW -N- KREW happen. Brew -N- Krew Ale House is blessed to be part of this great community who truly believes in our vision and continues to root for us. 

Many of you, along with our family and friends, have seen this grow from the ground up and we appreciate you. There is still a lot of work to be done. There is a lot of great people working along us to make it happen. 

Regardless of the outcome, we will continue to work hard, have patience, make dope beer con cultura and have fun while doing so. Like mentioned before we are bringing a whole new wave by implementing our Mexican Culture/Salinas Community to not only our beer but to our location. What was once a hobby is about to be the first brewery out of Salinas, CA. owned by East Salinas locals! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

We realize that not everyone can give, but you can still help. 

Please sign up for updates and events, share, like, and repost on IG, FB and/or Twitter! Help us make noise about our campaign. Your word of mouth can make a huge difference and we greatly appreciate it. You can find us at http://www.Brew-N-Krew.com. When posting please remember to tag us @brewandcrewsalinas and #MakingDopeBeerConCultura

THANK YOU/MUCHAS GRACIAS from the bottom of our heart in advance for helping us build this vision and bring a new culture to craft beer! 

Welcome to the KREW! 

IG: https://www.instagram.com/brewandcrewsalinas/

FB: https://www.facebook.com/brewandcrewsalinas/?ref=bookmarks

story:
Demeter Mini is designed for worry-free, fully automated indoor gardening in your home.  It is packed with advanced technologies, including Artificial Intelligence, that you can only find in large commercial vertical farms.  It has a convertible planting bed where you can plant different herbs, leafy vegetables, and microgreens all year round.  Now, you have access to fresh and healthy food all the time as you grow your own vegetables inside your home. 

 

Nurture your plants with our Artificial Intelligence feature.  There is no need to think if your plants have enough fertiliser, adequate sunlight or the right pH level, and less guessing when to add water and nutrients.  Let the AI and our autonomous system do the hard work for you!

 

The main grow light is full-spectrum cool white LED. Blue and far-red spectrum are added for plant structure customisation. Blue light is for shorter stems and have smaller, thicker and darker green leaves. Far-red is for longer leaves and elongated stems. It also accelerates flowering in some plants.

 

For experienced farmers or those who love the geeky stuffs, nutrient solutions can be adjusted to get the desired taste and leaf structure.  Increasing the EC is a proven way to increase flavour in many hydroponic crops.

 

An individual can grow super-foods microgreens together with herbs or leafy greens using the included accessories.

 

Aside from viewing the latest photo, you can enjoy watching your plants growth with time lapse video feature.  You can view these remotely so you have less worry when you're on holidays.

 

There are 13 environmental sensors installed in the garden to monitor your plants.  The data are sent securely to the cloud and can be viewed anywhere through your companion App.

 

 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

LAGWERTA is an Agritech Start-up company that focuses on Urban Farming.  We develop technology that will transform people’s perception of farming.  Our vision is to help people become sustainable by growing their food, eating fresh produce and, most importantly, clean and healthy greens and herbs without pesticides or GMOs.  Our long-term vision is to provide communities easy access to healthy produce all year round and help farmers use our technology to increase their productivity and yield. 

Our team comprises Engineers, Data Scientist, Software Developers,  a finance officer, and a retail manager.  We are confident in our strength as a team to deliver this product.  We spent most of our time developing the technology started by one of our members five years ago.  In 2019, we finally made it official to start our journey in making this innovative product a possibility. 

 

 

LAGWERTA  started on year 2019 and has been doing lots of prototyping and testing with our system.  We have already contacted a few manufacturers and will start production as soon as we reach our funding goals.  Our system is ready and the software has been tested for stability.  We are just soaking the system by running it with our current hardware solutions to test the stability while developing the database at the back end.  We are committed to delivering the product on time.  We have manufactured and developed our intelligent systems and software here in Australia.

 

 

The Demeter Mini perks are available to Australia, United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Philippines and Qatar.

Shipping costs do not include any taxes or duties, which are applied by your local government and customs office, on imported goods.  The backer is responsible for any customs duties, foreign taxes or other fees which may be imposed.

Should the backer refuse to pay duties and taxes applied by customs,  the responsibility lies with the backer to arrange for the order to be returned to us in order to receive a refund.

Please contact your local customs office directly for more information on taxes, duties and regulations.

 

We already had three significant versions since we started this project.  With each version, we have learned how to make it simple and easy for the user.  We made sure that it is well designed and crafted with a minimalist and modern feel so you can proudly display it at your home.

Unfortunately, with most of the projects, often the problem comes with unforeseen issues on manufacturing or shipping timelines.  But having said that, we know that we have action plans ready when these things come.  We will make sure to check from time to time with our suppliers and manufacturers.  We do believe that we will be able to deliver the best and reliable product.  This would revolutionise the field of urban farming.  Rest assured that we will communicate to our customers for updates and status when it comes to production.

 

Even if it's just $10, every contribution helps us in getting closer to make Demeter Mini a reality.

If you can't contribute to this project financially, there are other ways to helps us.

You can follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube and join us in making home farming much easier and fun.

You can spread the word about Demeter Mini.  Tell your family, friends, neighbours, colleagues and everybody you know about our product and our vision in leading the way to healthier community through having easy access to fresh and healthy food all the time.

story:
The Flour Girl Bakery - PLEASE WATCH THE VIDEO!!

The Flour Girl Bakery started as a small group in July of 2019. I started testing sourdough and passing it out for free to friends who wanted to try it. A lot of people wanted "in"!

After becoming a licensed Cottage Food Bakery in December of that year I started officially selling bread. It was a very informal setup... when your bread was ready you would get a text from me telling you which box it was in on my front porch!

Without any actual culinary training, 3 other jobs, and 3 small kids at home, there was very little thought this would ever turn into anything more than a hobby. Boy was I wrong!

As we went into crazy 2020, and suddenly there was no bread in the grocery stores but you could order a loaf from me, get a text and pick it up warm off my front porch!

But my little bakery wasn't so little anymore! And soon the weekly ordering started selling out so fast that we had to start a lottery system. If you "won the bread lottery" you were able to order for the following week with a limit of only 1 item per person! 

We needed to get bigger and quickly. We had a lot of ideas on how to do that, unfortunately, none of them worked. When our final effort to build a food cart to sell the bread from at another location came crashing down with hurricane-force winds and we were out of ideas. 

And this is where things started to turn around. St. Peters Church came to the rescue, offering both a place to bake and a place to sell. I was able to get a commercial license, set up shop in the church kitchen, and start selling all in the same place. 

Then, amazingly, I was connected with a family who had just purchased a historic home in downtown Hebron and they wanted The Flour Girl Bakery to open inside that building. There was so much excitement, confusion, shock, and fear but I finally decided to move forward. 

And that is was brought me here! 

What you receive for participating in crowdfunding...

The way crowdfunding works is that you support the business upfront to help with the costs of start-up and in return, you receive something from the business that you can't get anywhere else, something special. I have worked very hard in making a list of special items that will only be available during this initial start-up phase. Thank you so much for your consideration and your support. 

Reward Levels

$25 - Flour Girl Magnet - Show your Flour Girl Support!

$50 - Flour Girl Mug - No better way to enjoy your coffee or tea than in your branded mug. (local pick up only, no shipping)

OR 

$50 - Cupcake Club (4 orders of cupcakes that can be used at any time on any order of 6 cupcakes. You will receive a Cupcake Club Punch Card.)

$50 - Cookie Club (5 orders of cookies that can be used at any time on any order of 6 cookies. You will receive a Cookie Club Punch Card.)

$75 -Offical Taste Taster- LIMITED QUANTITY - (When I have a new product you get to try a sample, you will be contacted first for every new product for the first full year of operation!)

$100 - Pair of Launch Party Tickets - LIMITED QUANTITY (The date is TBD but I will be hosting a launch party in the first weeks of the bakery opening. It will be catered by me, there will be special products to taste and to buy. Receive a bakery tour and spend time with all the #flourfanatics!)

$150 - Baker's Dozen Sourdoughs (Receive a punch card that can be cashed in for 13 loaves of sourdough. They can be cashed in at any time during the first year of operation and are valid for any sourdough loaf.) 

$250 - Sourdough Class for Four - LIMITED QUANTITY (a sourdough dough-making class for you and 3 of your friends. The class takes place in the bakery and each person will learn the unique flour girl technique. You will all leave with a baked loaf of bread and a jar of starter to work with at home.) 

What happens with the money?

How is the money used? This is not a nonprofit organization and therefore this is like a "donation" but not tax-deductible. The money (minus fees) go directly to The Flour Girl Bakery. They do not go into profits, payroll, or operating expenses. The money will ALL be applied to the start-up costs of putting in the commercial kitchen etc at the new location, an estimated cost of $50,000 to purchase the equipment needed, pre-fund inventory etc. By making a small contribution you will be helping me in a big way. If I get enough small contributions the weight of start-up loan will not need to be on this business and we can grow into our new space and into our community in the way I believe this bakery was meant to. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that is fine. If you are seeing this it is likely that you have already helped in some way with the growth of The Flour Girl, but helping spread word about this crowdfunding campaign is an awesome way to help! 

  • Share the campaign on social media, email, text, or just talk about it with your friends!

After becoming a licensed Cottage Food Bakery in December of that year I started officially selling bread. It was a very informal setup... when your bread was ready you would get a text from me telling you which box it was in on my front porch!
Without any actual culinary training, 3 other jobs, and 3 small kids at home, there was very little thought this would ever turn into anything more than a hobby. Boy was I wrong!
As we went into crazy 2020, and suddenly there was no bread in the grocery stores but you could order a loaf from me, get a text and pick it up warm off my front porch!
But my little bakery wasn't so little anymore! And soon the weekly ordering started selling out so fast that we had to start a lottery system. If you "won the bread lottery" you were able to order for the following week with a limit of only 1 item per person! 
We needed to get bigger and quickly. We had a lot of ideas on how to do that, unfortunately, none of them worked. When our final effort to build a food cart to sell the bread from at another location came crashing down with hurricane-force winds and we were out of ideas. 
And this is where things started to turn around. St. Peters Church came to the rescue, offering both a place to bake and a place to sell. I was able to get a commercial license, set up shop in the church kitchen, and start selling all in the same place. 
Then, amazingly, I was connected with a family who had just purchased a historic home in downtown Hebron and they wanted The Flour Girl Bakery to open inside that building. There was so much excitement, confusion, shock, and fear but I finally decided to move forward. 
And that is was brought me here! 

What you receive for participating in crowdfunding...
The way crowdfunding works is that you support the business upfront to help with the costs of start-up and in return, you receive something from the business that you can't get anywhere else, something special. I have worked very hard in making a list of special items that will only be available during this initial start-up phase. Thank you so much for your consideration and your support. 

Reward Levels
$25 - Flour Girl Magnet - Show your Flour Girl Support!
$50 - Flour Girl Mug - No better way to enjoy your coffee or tea than in your branded mug. (local pick up only, no shipping)
OR 
$50 - Cupcake Club (4 orders of cupcakes that can be used at any time on any order of 6 cupcakes. You will receive a Cupcake Club Punch Card.)
$50 - Cookie Club (5 orders of cookies that can be used at any time on any order of 6 cookies. You will receive a Cookie Club Punch Card.)
$75 -Offical Taste Taster- LIMITED QUANTITY - (When I have a new product you get to try a sample, you will be contacted first for every new product for the first full year of operation!)
$100 - Pair of Launch Party Tickets - LIMITED QUANTITY (The date is TBD but I will be hosting a launch party in the first weeks of the bakery opening. It will be catered by me, there will be special products to taste and to buy. Receive a bakery tour and spend time with all the #flourfanatics!)
$150 - Baker's Dozen Sourdoughs (Receive a punch card that can be cashed in for 13 loaves of sourdough. They can be cashed in at any time during the first year of operation and are valid for any sourdough loaf.) 
$250 - Sourdough Class for Four - LIMITED QUANTITY (a sourdough dough-making class for you and 3 of your friends. The class takes place in the bakery and each person will learn the unique flour girl technique. You will all leave with a baked loaf of bread and a jar of starter to work with at home.) 
What happens with the money?
How is the money used? This is not a nonprofit organization and therefore this is like a "donation" but not tax-deductible. The money (minus fees) go directly to The Flour Girl Bakery. They do not go into profits, payroll, or operating expenses. The money will ALL be applied to the start-up costs of putting in the commercial kitchen etc at the new location, an estimated cost of $50,000 to purchase the equipment needed, pre-fund inventory etc. By making a small contribution you will be helping me in a big way. If I get enough small contributions the weight of start-up loan will not need to be on this business and we can grow into our new space and into our community in the way I believe this bakery was meant to. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute that is fine. If you are seeing this it is likely that you have already helped in some way with the growth of The Flour Girl, but helping spread word about this crowdfunding campaign is an awesome way to help! 
Share the campaign on social media, email, text, or just talk about it with your friends!

story:
Short Summary

Hello Indiegogo !

We are Sylvie and Ebo, mother and son, who decided to launch us in the valorization of local organic fruits into refined distillates in our country Benin. 

My mother, Sylvie, is a young retiree with more than 30 years of experience in auditing, accounting and collection within an audit firm and a multinational company in the maritime sector in Benin (https://www.linkedin.com/in/sylvie-sacramento). She has also carried out several entrepreneurial projects in the past, particularly in livestock breeding and retail trade. Myself, Ebo, I have about 10 years of experience in project management, consulting in entrepreneurship and innovation in Canada, Togo, Senegal and Benin (https://bj.linkedin.com/in/ebo-sacramento). I also initiated the creation of for-profit and non-profit organizations. Together, we decided to pool our skills and experience to realize this beautiful project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to ensure the marketing of our 1st creation, ananá™ PREMIUM, a fine pineapple brandy "Pain de sucre" (Protected Geographical Identification of the Municipality of Allada in the South of Benin) organic. 

Your orders will enable us to cover the resources necessary for the production of our 1st 50cl bottles to ensure the survival of this beautiful adventure.

The collected funds include the production costs, 5% of the collected amount which will be given back to Indiegogo as a commission and the bank transfer fees. This is essentially working capital to cover the supply, storage, fermentation, distillation and bottling.

And to thank you for your support, we are offering 15% instant discount during this pre-sales campaign! And if you wish, we will mention your name in the list of our generous donors on our website.

The bottles of this campaign are produced in limited edition ! So when you buy them, you will have collector bottles at your disposal !

 

⛔️ Warning

Delivery charges for packages shipped outside Benin are at your expense !!!
But we can also keep your bottles which we will be happy to hand deliver to you on your next visit to Benin.

 

The impact

This project is valuable in many ways. 

By supporting this project through the purchase of our first bottles, you bring a whole chain of values to life!
 
Thanks to your purchase, you contribute to the economic development of the cooperatives from which we source organic pineapple. In fact, you also contribute to increase their income and improve their well-being. These producers will thus be able to send their children to school and strengthen their professional capacities more easily. 
Your purchase also contributes to the promotion of a more sustainable and responsible model of cultivation without fertilizers or chemical products that are better for humans and the earth. In turn, it encourages the transition to renewable energies.

Beyond pineapple producers, your purchase will also strengthen the economic activity of the craftsmen who design our wooden boxes that you can add to your order. The first boxes that we offer you are made of local "Melina" and are entirely designed locally. 

But above all, your purchase allows the survival of SaGA Co, our micro-distillery. You prove that the concepts of "responsible products", "developing countries" and "niche products" can converge.

 

Risks & Challenges

Please note that we are committed to do our utmost to produce your bottles within 3 months from January 1, 2021. 

We also draw the attention of those of you who would like to be delivered outside Benin. The international actors of transport and logistics know since the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic several disturbances which can lengthen their delivery times. 

We will communicate with each one of you (by e-mail) in order to validate with you the carrier of your choice.
In the meantime you can already get an idea of the shipping costs for a package of about 1kg with the dimensions 25cm x 10cm x 10 cm (https://www.dhl.com or https://www.ups.com)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you prefer not to buy a bottle, you still have the possibility to support us directly by making a symbolic contribution. In exchange and if you wish, we will put your name on the list of our donors which will be published on our website once the campaign is over. We will also take care to keep you informed of the evolution of this adventure. 

However, do not hesitate to spread the word and help us make some noise about this campaign !

Let the SaGA begin!

story:
The Biscuit: A Somerville/Cambridge Institution

  After 15 years at 406 Washington St, and 6 years of fruitless negotiation with an unreasonable landlord, The Biscuit will be forced to close on 12/31/19. We did not lose the space due to rent increase, nor because the space will be demolished for condo development. We lost the space because the owner of the property wants it empty and fallow, like the majority of their other properties in the neighborhood. This eviction is devastating, both for The Biscuit, its many, many employees, and the neighboring community. 

  We have found a new location, however, and it's in the area! It's a unique space, and subterranean, but also a short walking distance from our old spot. It does require a significant amount of renovation, and re-imagination. For the very short term, it will be a storage spot for all of our equipment and inventory. But in the long term, it can become a new oasis for baked goods and savory fare, salads and coffee creations.  We just need a little help.

What We Need & What You Get

  We're looking for fans of The Biscuit to contribute what they can to help us start up a new version of their old favorite. In return, you'll receive gift cards for purchases at the new Biscuit (currently under the moniker, Biscuit in the Basement).  The value of the gift cards will exceed the value of the gift. 

  • Currently, we've set our renovation costs at $150,000. We already own and possess the equipment and inventory - just need to redevelop the space and make it food-friendly. If you were within walking distance of the old Biscuit, you are absolutely within walking distance of the New Biscuit! 
  • Any donations will be rewarded with gift cards redeemable at the New Biscuit at a greater value than the donation!
  • If we are unable to reach our complete goal, your donation will still be honored to the best of our ability. We are using a flexible fund strategy - funds raised will be used as soon as they are available. If we are unable to reach our desired goal, well, we'l do whatever we can to get our doors open and get you the goods.

 

Risks & Challenges

    The Biscuit has been a viable business serving the Cambridge/Somerville Community for more than 15 years. We started our business with loans from friends and family, and we paid off those friends and family within 7 years. We hold a tremendous sense of pride in knowing that we've owned the business outright these last 8 years. Unfortunately, not being able to continue to lease the property further puts a dent in that pride, so...  any investment in our future business is priority to us, and we absolutely value any investment made in our new project. We are greatly appreciative of donations of any denomination.

  We also understand that there is a risk to the lender in any situation such as this. We will diligently do our best to honor any and all funds contributed, as we have in the past, but this time through this platform, and will do so with an in-kind gift rather than an interest based loan. If, however, we are unable to sustain a viable business in the new location, we will not be capable of honoring un-redeemed gift cards.  That said, we hope that, with your kind donation, you will allow us a window of time to get on our feet before redeeming your gift cards, but we will certainly not turn anyone away who presents a gift card in our early days.

  The Biscuit honored its commitments in the past, and it has every interest in doing so in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

  If you're unable to make a contribution, we totally understand - we've been there ourselves.  However, there are other ways you can help:

  • Ask friends and allies to get the word out and make some noise about how much you miss The Biscuit and want it back!
  • Follow us on Instagram  @massbiscuit for updates, and encourage your friends to do so, too
  • Subscribe to our website http://www.visitthebiscuit.com and receive updates and newsletters
  • Tell our employees how much you love and will miss The Biscuit between now and the end of the year.

story:
About Dog World

The founders of Dog World were fueled by the need for a consistent, practical and safe play space for dogs and their people. After all, they’ve got two rambunctious rescues who are ready to rumble!  

There didn’t seem to be any enjoyable options for dogs to get their social playtime.

  • Traditional Doggy Daycares? We’d watch the cameras only to find our dogs sitting in a kennel half the day due to rotated playtime. They came home going mutts!
     
  • Local Dog Parks? Sure, until rain hits and leaves the dog parks muddy for days. All too often there’s overflowing waste bins and untended grounds. Talk about ruff around the edges.
     
  • Dog-Friendly Patios? Staying on a leash isn’t always the best option for your energetic pup. Plus, the space wasn’t designed for dogs so it can be an unpredictable experience. It’s really not the most pup-ular option.
     

Introducing Dog World. Dog World is you and your dog’s dream world! Offering a huge indoor and outdoor, off-leash space means your dog has a play plan every day of the year, rain or shine. 

  • Want to stay and play with your dog at our private dog park? Come on by!
     
  • Need to drop your pup off for doggy daycare? They’ll be treated like royalty with a play-focused agenda and lots of love and attention.
     
  • Want to grab drinks out with friends without leaving your best furry friend behind? We’ll be serving beer, wine, cocktails and snacks all day and night.
     
  • Does your dog need a bath? Visit our self-wash stations equipped with everything you need to treat your pup to a spa day. 

It’s everything you love about your favorite bar and everything you love about being with your dog! 

You can expect Dog World to host curated events like Dog Prom, Outdoor Movie Night, Trivia, Wine Tastings, Beer Tastings, Game Nights, Open Mic Nights and more! 

We’re passionate about creating a space where every dog and their owner feels welcome. 

Dog World is going to be the biggest pawty in Atlanta. We shih tzu not. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We’d like to create a space designed specifically for dogs. That’s exactly what this funding will support. We have a vision for building improvements that will allow for dog owners like you to have the best experience possible at Dog World. From drainage to fencing to flooring, it’s all for a pawsitive play experience for you and your dog. 

 

In return, we’d like you to be one of the first to experience all that Dog World has to offer. That’s why we’re giving huge rewards for anyone that helps us open up the world! 

 

If you give $5,000, you can expect:

  • A custom portrait of your dog on our founder’s wall
  • An entire year of FREE, unlimited doggy daycare
  • 12 FREE dog washes using our self-wash dog spa
  • Dog World merch for you and your dog
     

If you give $3,000, you can expect: 

  • A custom portrait of your dog on our founder’s wall
  • 6 months of FREE, unlimited doggy daycare
  • 6 FREE dog washes using our self-wash dog spa
  • Dog World merch for you and your dog
     

If you give $1,000, you can expect: 

  • A custom portrait of your dog on our founder’s wall
  • 2 months of FREE, unlimited doggy daycare
  • 2 FREE dog washes using our self-wash dog spa
  • Dog World merch for you and your dog
     

If you give $500, you can expect: 

  • 1 month of FREE, unlimited doggy daycare 
  • 1 FREE dog wash using our self-wash dog spa
  • Dog World merch for you and your dog
     

If you give $250, you can expect: 

  • 4 months of FREE private dog park access
  • 4 FREE dog washes using our self-wash dog spa
  • Dog World merch for you and your dog
     

If you give $100, you can expect: 

  • 1 month of FREE private dog park access
  • 1 FREE dog wash using our self-wash dog spa
  • Dog World merch for you and your dog
     

If you give $50, you can expect: 

  • Dog World merch for you and your dog

 

Dog World Memberships and Pricing

Monthly Unlimited Everything
$400 (plus $150 for each additional dog)
This membership includes unlimited doggy daycare and unlimited dog park access. 

Monthly Unlimited Daycare
$375 (plus $150 for each additional dog)

Monthly Unlimited Dog Park Access

$40 (plus $10 for each additional dog)

Daycare Rates

  • Drop In Rate Full Day: $25 per dog
  • Drop In Rate Half Day (Up to 4 Hours): $15 per dog
  • 5 Pack Daycare: $120 per dog
  • 10 Pack Daycare: $225 per dog

Private Dog Park Access Rates

  • Drop In Rate: $10 (plus $5 for each additional dog)

Self Service Wash Rate

  • $16 per dog

 

We are so excited to be a gathering space for our community. You can trust that we always put our customers first with a clean, safe, welcoming place for people and their dogs. 

If the time isn’t right for you to toss in a few bucks, be our virtual cheerleader by following us on Instagram @dogworldatlanta.  Tell your friends, family and dogs too!

story:
PLANT POWER | THE NEXT BIG THING?

The Nordic Grocery Market is screaming for creative and sustainable options built for the future! Yet, slow movers and traditional ways keep plant-based entrepreneurs, organic produce and eco-friendly alternatives from reaching their full potential. 

 

 

It’s about time we introduce BIG THINKING and FAST ACTION! LOCO represents Norway’s brand new 100% plant-based chain of grocery stores, and now we need your help to open our very first flagship store in the heart of Oslo! 

Are we crazy to think we can change the world? Oh yes, but isn't that what's needed?

 

THE  REAL QUESTION IS...

 

 

SO, WHAT'S THE HEADACHE?

It is a strong-willed myth in the fairy tales of the North that meat was the only staple in the diet of our ancestors. The vision of a hardcore viking gulping down beer with a bloody piece of meat is still standing strong. Truth is that plants have been an essential part of the Nordic diet ever since the beginning. Cold weather, harsh winter storms and snowy landscapes may have made it difficult, but certainly not impossible to grow food, resulting in the Nordic cuisine traditionally being more creative than most. 

Fast-forward till today, the market for plant-based food is growing rapidly! The pandemic has boosted an interest in healthy foods, natural origin and organic produce. Plants are trendy and it’s not stopping there.

 

 

However, the overall grocery industry is a damn slow mover, so slow in fact, that even in tiny Norway, we’re still stuck with an astronomic food wastage percentage, abysmal variety in plant-based foods, plastic packaging dominion, expensive organic options and an overload of processed food in the plant-based grocery segment. 

The market longs for a new player bold enough to take on the big boys, yet fast and flexible enough to cater to dynamic consumers and a fast-paced market.

 

 

Enter LOCO  - A brand new grocery concept made for the future! With the objective of creating lasting ripples in the industry, LOCO strives to make adopting a plant-based lifestyle fun, colourful, easy-peasy and most importantly; super duper nutritious! 

No more empty shelves lacking high quality plant-based products! No dusty soy milk tucked away in the inner corners of the store. No hidden “special interest” section making vegans and people with allergies alike cringe when shopping at the local corner store. 

Nope! We all deserve better and we want colour, we want taste and we want options! It’s about time people open to plant-based diets, sustainable alternatives and allergy friendly products can pick from the top shelf. There’s a firework of wonderful suppliers out there, ready to take on markets high in purchasing power and with an eye for great food. And we promise you, Norway is definitely one of them! All they need is the facilitator, the one player daring to take the first step! And hey! Here we are! 

 

 

CHANGING THE GAME | OUR JOURNEY

Our goal is to commercialise products and solutions friendly to the planet. To scale quickly and to lift others on our path. Check out our journey this far as well as our plans ahead in the infographic below.

 

 

OUR IMPACT | THE PERKS OF BEING LOCO!

  • Norway’s very first 100% plant-based chain of grocery stores!
  • BIG THINKING and Juggernaut attitude! We will revolutionise an industry defined by centralised power and slow movers in terms of sustainability. 
  • LOCO is more than a niche! We aim to attract  a wide audience spanning way beyond those already adopting a fully plant-based lifestyle. Together we make a change! 
  • We aim to be a catalyst for small businesses and entrepreneurs who strive for a gateway into the Nordic grocery market. 
  • And hey, we’ve already got all the suppliers and relationships we need to create the best ever portfolio of plant-based groceries available in Norway! Below are just a fraction of the brands you’ll find on our shelves.

 

With your help we can “click play” and enter the stage where dreams become reality!

 

 

THE TEAM BEHIND THE SPECTACLE

What's a good idea without a team of doers? The guys behind LOCO are both creative and filled with action. With extensive experience spanning from groceries and HORECA to finance, fitness, marketing and economics, our team's got what it takes to scale a grocery business! 

 

WHAT WILL YOUR FUNDS BE SPENT ON?

All funds raised will be earmarked for the creation of our very first flagship store in Oslo! Indeed, we are well on our way towards the goal of making the very first shop a reality. We recently raised MORE THAN USD 200 000 through our first ever capital increase, just enough to get the first shop up and running. However, we want to create something spectacular, and to do that, we need just a bit more. The funds you donate will thus contribute in pimping up our very first store, making it sparkle amidst a traditional grocery scene screaming for renewal. Specifically speaking, the funds raised will be spent on:

  • Exterior and Interior of the flagship store, including shelves, flooring, freezers, decor, paint, signage, recycling station, containers, fridges and everything else needed for our very first physical space.
  • Filling the shelves: Investment in initial product catalogue.
  • An operational buffer for the first few months of operation.
  • Deposit for rental premises.
  • Hired services: Marketing & branding, essential carpentry, electric systems and so forth. 
  • Tech:  POS systems, web development and as a next step; an improved online shop.

 

MAKE SOME NOISE!

We would be eternally  grateful if you spread the word about LOCO and our campaign! Share this page through the Indigo links at the top of the screen or spread this page with the world to make the news explode!

Follow us on Instagram

Follow us on Facebook

 

The Grocery Industry needs to change and we are ready to get our hands dirty! What about you?

 

THANK YOU FOR BELIEVING IN US!

story:
Update!

We have our first backer and her perk will be sent out tomorrow!  As we get backers we will continue to fill perks in a first come first server basis so you don't have to wait for amazing flavor!

We dared to dream!

My family has been on the Keto diet for years.  We have followed this diet not just for weight loss, but also because we have a history of inflammatory and insulin resistance issues.  Like any other family, we like game night with snacks and quick meals and all the things that sometimes are impossible to eat on Keto.  It does not have to be this way! 

Just Look What We've Done!

My family now enjoys chips and dip on game nights, and I can make nachos in the air fryer quickly and without feeling guilty.  That is a good feeling!  Even my picky 8 and 6-year-old boys never ask for store-bought chips.  They ask for my chips.  And, because it is a low glycemic food, even my diabetic family members are now able to join in family events and have snacks.  It has been a gift. 

The process, however, to turn these ingredients into a chip is unique.  It is not your average chip, so it was not easy, but we feel it was worth all the work to make it happen!  It will take a specialized chip processing line to bring these to mass production and being a small cottage manufacturer, we are not able to do that.  WE NEED YOUR HELP!  We need a commercial kitchen to install specialized equipment to upscale production and bring the cost of the chips down, so they are readily accessible to all!  Simple ingredients not so simple process.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need a specialized frying and bagging system that will produce thousands of bags a day.  The frying line alone will be roughly 30,000 dollars.  We have purchased the land needed to build the facility, so we are all in!  The more funds we get, the bigger the equipment we can purchase, the more chips we can produce!
  • Once completed you will be the first to receive these chips from our brand-new facility, and if you put us in contact with a local vendor, we will make sure they have first rights to get them in your area!
  • Also, each person making a donation will get chips sent to them as soon as it ends!  That is unique for an Indiegogo campaign.  No waiting to get your perk.  We send them out in the order they are received!  You can start enjoying your perk!!
  • Even if we do not reach our full financial goal, we will still put all funds into building a new larger facility because our hearts are dedicated to giving you the ability to join in the fun but not the carbs!

Our goal is to spread the joy.

This has made a difference to our family.  I can eat nachos and still have a fasting glucose in the 80's the next morning.  For someone that is insulin resistant, that is epic!  We want to bring this same experience to people all over the world.  It is a big goal, but it can make a big impact!  Take a minute to imagine that young person that has never been able to just open a bag of chips with lunch and enjoy them just like their friends.  For them, its freedom. 

Challenges

We have already scaled this up to small production so we know we can get there.  However, it will take time since we must learn to do this with large scale equipment.  We expect this challenge, and we are ready to take it on!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to our campaign, you can always share our message so we can accomplish the dream of guiltless snacks that taste like you are not compromising at all. You really need to taste these to believe it.  I love seeing the surprised look on peoples face when they first try them and exclaim, “Wow, this tastes good!” Please watch the video and see the surprise for yourself.  Thank you for helping us share this with everyone!

Check out our Facebook Reviews!

People were asked to try our product and se we could use their photo and name on this site to give you a better idea about how these chips taste.  We know you are used to Keto tasting just "Ok" or "I can live with it".  These chips are not just OK they are game changers!

Live Taste Tests!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwddP0R9KkU

story:
Lady and the Chocolate is a luxury chocolate dispensary, made with love in New York City. Our mission is to spread joy + love to people who need people! It is chocolate meets fashion. Some of our best-selling flavors include 'The Best S'mores You Ever Had', 'Karma is a B***H',  and 'White Trash'. Fresh and fabulous, with a preference for the finer things, Lady and the Chocolate offers the kind of indulgence that will keep you coming back for more!

Our Story: Lady and the Chocolate

In the midst of a global pandemic, Founder Sara Armet woke up one day with a calling to make ‘the best chocolate you ever had’.  Designing chocolate bark with larger than life personality became the ultimate remedy for connection during uncertain times.

Word quickly spread of a 24/7 luxury chocolate dispensary, a bootstrapped operation with an open door policy and a sense of humor. Chocolate lovers from far and wide, day and night, ventured to the Upper East Side for a drive-by, a taste, and a woman's wisdom. Lady and the Chocolate was born. 

Since inception, Lady and the Chocolate has been a community-driven, collaborative initiative. From recruiting friends as taste-testers and making deliveries on Citi-bike to partnering with NYC based small businesses, including Spice Lab and Candle Cafe,  Lady and the Chocolate boasts an 'all hands on deck' approach. When one of us wins, we all win.

Now, the time has come to take our neighborhood hustle and passion project to the next level!

Our Plan and Our Perks 

We are seeking $25,000 and we are inviting you to come along for the ride! 

The purpose of our crowd-funding campaign is to transition our home-grown labor of love towards a scalable model.  

Lady and the Chocolate seeks resources in order to move our production to a local confectionery, fine-tune our packaging, and complete beta-taste-testing (see 'Use Your #Influence for [Chocolate]' below).

Crowdfunding empowers our dedicated following of chocolate lovers to decide what our future looks like! Together, we are stronger.

 

Use Your #Influence for [Chocolate]

How do we keep up the momentum as we continue to spread love and grow organically? 

Our aim is to roll out the ultimate-unboxing-experience as we boost our sphere of influence.

Through our beta-taste-testing initiative, Lady and the Chocolate has the opportunity to perfect our operations and simultaneously deliver the best product to an influential target audience.

Our strategy is simple: 

Chocolate for everyone!

(well, everyone who is anyone... if you know what I mean!)

It's all about the influencers, baby!

Since day one at Lady and the Chocolate, Instagram has been our primary sales channel. Our friends served as brand ambassadors posting their favorite flavors and chocolate reviews. Lady and the Chocolate gained traction, converting our followers into repeat customers.

Social media influencers are the retailers of tomorrow. Influencers set trends. Influencers introduce and direct consumers to their favorite brands, helping to drive sales. Their followers trust them and value their taste. Influencers dictate the marketplace. ​

Let’s enter the next phase of our product development while placing LATC in the right hands (and the right @handles)! 

Meet Our Contributors

From day one, we have been a community driven initiative with an all-hands on deck approach. When one of us wins, we all win.

New York or Nowhere

Our dreams are big. One day at a time we work to achieve our goal of having a chocolate shop on Madison Avenue. 

But one thing the past year has taught us is that some things are simply outside of our control. 

Recently, all eyes have been on New York City.

‘New York is dead.’ ‘New York will never be the same.’ ‘Get out of NYC’. ‘Ghost town.’

Through pandemics, protests, curfews, and dining in the bike lane, we have been here, pounding the pavement, taking the next right action. They say if you can make it here, you can make it anywhere. 

We love New York and we are proud to partner with NYC small businesses.

For the love of New York City. For the love of chocolate. Lady and the Chocolate will do whatever it takes to get the job done!

Get Your Hands [Chocolate-y]!

We understand that currency comes in many forms and we are so grateful for every contribution. Here are actions you can take today to help us achieve our goal:

The bark is worth the bite and everyone wants a piece of it!

www.ladyandthechocolate.com
