story:
Are you an Espresso lover?

We designed this for you: the First Reusable Espresso Cup for Take Away. Your best Espresso always with you.

The cup is part of the tasting experience

Drinking a good  Espresso coffee is an experience that starts from the bean to the cup. Normal take-away cups don't value your espresso coffee.

Espresso Away with its shape and texture makes you feel like drinking coffee as in the cup at an italian coffee shop.

It is reusable over and over again.

 

Designed to enhance the aromas of coffee

  • Size of the classic italian espresso cup, 2 oz.
  •  Truncated-conical shape, which allows a better formation and permanence of the cream over time, favoring the best perception of aromas.
  • The internal base must follow the classic "egg" shape to prevent the cream from breaking and to preserve its compactness and color for longer.
  • The most suitable color for the inside of the cup is bright and glossy white because it facilitates the evaluation of the espresso and, thanks to the strong color contrast, enhances the warm and inviting color of the espresso cream.
  •  The cap with thread guarantees a hermetic seal against spill and can thus be placed in a pocket or bag.
  • Keeps heat 3 times longer than disposable cups.

Respect for the Environment

Espresso Away is reusable and helps reduce the use of disposable cups. Around the world 50 billion are thrown away every year. Most end up in the environment and in the sea. Take part in the movement to reduce disposable cups, every gesture is important.

 

Always carry it with you

You can also use Espresso Away at home to make yourself an espresso before going out.
Or you can use it in the office instead of disposable cups.
Its airtight cap also serves not to dirty after use, you can put it in your pocket or leave it on your desk.

So you can easily clean it with water whenever you want.

Approved by professional barista


Giacomo lo Cascio, Italian coffee cup tasting champion, World cup finalist and professional barista:

""It is the best solution for take-away coffee, it maintains the organoleptic properties of coffee much better than the disposable cups used up to now. It is a real innovation that marks a turning point towards higher quality."

 

High quality material, BPA Free

It's made in Tritan: a latest generation polymer used for food containers at high temperatures. Completely safe, Bpa Free, it is also used for baby bottles.

Its characteristics give it a very resistant ceramic-like effect.

Dishwasher safe.

 

Italian  Passion for Coffee

My name is Giorgio Gentili and I 'm the manager of a beach café in Tuscany. I'm a professional barista, and I have always tried to give the highest quality to my customers by offering them a perfect espresso.


To do this, I constantly update and follow courses with the best coffee professionals in Italy.
From my years of  experience came the idea of Espresso Away.


I immediately received support from several coffee professionals in Italy, enthusiastic about this product which marks an evolution in the take-away or office espresso coffee experience.

To make it, I followed the suggestion of the best experts and of tradition: the perfect espresso cup must have simple but fundamental characteristics. Inspired by study and tradition, I created Espresso Away.


But the best thing is the possibility of helping the environment: too many disposable cups are consumed, spreading the use of Espresso Away can have an impact on waste reduction.
For this I need your help: to let more people know that it is possible to drink a better Espresso and at the same time to help the environment.

Use Espresso Away at the coffee shop or office.

Are you a coffee shop owner? Offer Espresso Away to your customers.

Espresso Away is meant to be used in coffee shops.
If you are the owner of a coffee shop do not miss this important news.
You can propose it in two ways:
  Serve take-away coffee to your regular customers of offices and shops in Espresso Away, instead of disposable cups. These will then bring it back like a normal cup. It is a small investment that pays for itself in a month by saving on the purchase of disposable cups.

Or you can sell it to your customers who will have their own personal cup.
You can put your logo on it so that it also gives you great publicity, because customers will carry it around with them and their friends will see it.

For information send an email: amministrazione@espressoaway.com

 

Risks & Challenges

Thanks to the support of some Italian coffee companies, we are almost ready to making molds for mass production. My engineering team has taken care of all the technical aspects and now we are ready to go.


Now we need your support and Espresso Away will be available very soon. Help me to spread the culture of Espresso coffee and help the environment by reducing disposable cups.
It's a small gesture but very important, thank you

The cup is part of the tasting experience
Drinking a good  Espresso coffee is an experience that starts from the bean to the cup. Normal take-away cups don't value your espresso coffee.
Espresso Away with its shape and texture makes you feel like drinking coffee as in the cup at an italian coffee shop.
It is reusable over and over again.

 
Designed to enhance the aromas of coffee

Size of the classic italian espresso cup, 2 oz.
 Truncated-conical shape, which allows a better formation and permanence of the cream over time, favoring the best perception of aromas.
The internal base must follow the classic "egg" shape to prevent the cream from breaking and to preserve its compactness and color for longer.
The most suitable color for the inside of the cup is bright and glossy white because it facilitates the evaluation of the espresso and, thanks to the strong color contrast, enhances the warm and inviting color of the espresso cream.
 The cap with thread guarantees a hermetic seal against spill and can thus be placed in a pocket or bag.
Keeps heat 3 times longer than disposable cups.


Respect for the Environment
Espresso Away is reusable and helps reduce the use of disposable cups. Around the world 50 billion are thrown away every year. Most end up in the environment and in the sea. Take part in the movement to reduce disposable cups, every gesture is important.

 
Always carry it with you
You can also use Espresso Away at home to make yourself an espresso before going out.Or you can use it in the office instead of disposable cups.Its airtight cap also serves not to dirty after use, you can put it in your pocket or leave it on your desk.
So you can easily clean it with water whenever you want.

Approved by professional barista
Giacomo lo Cascio, Italian coffee cup tasting champion, World cup finalist and professional barista:
""It is the best solution for take-away coffee, it maintains the organoleptic properties of coffee much better than the disposable cups used up to now. It is a real innovation that marks a turning point towards higher quality."
 
High quality material, BPA Free
It's made in Tritan: a latest generation polymer used for food containers at high temperatures. Completely safe, Bpa Free, it is also used for baby bottles.
Its characteristics give it a very resistant ceramic-like effect.
Dishwasher safe.

 
Italian  Passion for Coffee
My name is Giorgio Gentili and I 'm the manager of a beach café in Tuscany. I'm a professional barista, and I have always tried to give the highest quality to my customers by offering them a perfect espresso.
To do this, I constantly update and follow courses with the best coffee professionals in Italy.From my years of  experience came the idea of Espresso Away.
I immediately received support from several coffee professionals in Italy, enthusiastic about this product which marks an evolution in the take-away or office espresso coffee experience.
To make it, I followed the suggestion of the best experts and of tradition: the perfect espresso cup must have simple but fundamental characteristics. Inspired by study and tradition, I created Espresso Away.
But the best thing is the possibility of helping the environment: too many disposable cups are consumed, spreading the use of Espresso Away can have an impact on waste reduction.For this I need your help: to let more people know that it is possible to drink a better Espresso and at the same time to help the environment.
Use Espresso Away at the coffee shop or office.
Are you a coffee shop owner? Offer Espresso Away to your customers.
Espresso Away is meant to be used in coffee shops.If you are the owner of a coffee shop do not miss this important news.You can propose it in two ways:  Serve take-away coffee to your regular customers of offices and shops in Espresso Away, instead of disposable cups. These will then bring it back like a normal cup. It is a small investment that pays for itself in a month by saving on the purchase of disposable cups.
Or you can sell it to your customers who will have their own personal cup.You can put your logo on it so that it also gives you great publicity, because customers will carry it around with them and their friends will see it.
For information send an email: amministrazione@espressoaway.com
 
Risks & Challenges
Thanks to the support of some Italian coffee companies, we are almost ready to making molds for mass production. My engineering team has taken care of all the technical aspects and now we are ready to go.
Now we need your support and Espresso Away will be available very soon. Help me to spread the culture of Espresso coffee and help the environment by reducing disposable cups.It's a small gesture but very important, thank you

story:
Hello, I am Kinnari, a high school junior working to become a biotechnical entrepreneur. I created True Things to get one step closer to my dream. 

My first project in True Things is the Relax & Sleep Tea.

Your New Night Routine 

The new Relax & Sleep Tea incorporates ancient Indian herbs in an unique formula to make a perfect cup of tea for a perfect night of sleep. In a stressful world of work and toil our beds become a safe haven where we keep our troubles aside, and nothings worse than the feeling of uncertainty when sleep doesn't arrive.  

Now you can cross trying to relax off your to-do list because you have found the solution as the Relax & Sleep tea. The tea helps lower your cortisol levels to decrease stress gathered from the day, creating the perfect sleep that you have dreamed of. 

Why This Tea? 

Your brain works hard to make melatonin to help you sleep. Yet sometimes your body doesn't make enough, so you might look for other sleep solutions and could stumble upon melatonin tablets. These tablets could help you have a restful sleep for a night or two, but when you decide it's time to sleep without any help you would realize that you can't. Why? Because the brain starts to rely on the outside helping hand of melatonin, causing it to produce less. 

Unlike melatonin tablets, the Relax & Sleep tea helps your brain naturally produce melatonin itself while working to decrease stress and cortisol levels. This along with triethylene glycol (a naturally occurring substance found in roots- particularly Ashwagandha - that further helps sleep) creates a restful sleep. 

So all you need is a scoop of the Relax & Sleep Tea and some hot water and you have created a golden key for sleep. 

BTW - measuring scooper included :)

Here's a fun video to provide a glimpse towards your new night routine -

 

Going Deeper 

Ashwagandha, Gotu Kola, Tulsi, Lemon Balm, Turmeric, Ginger

As you need caffeine to keep you going through the day, you need the Relax & Sleep tea to help you get a good night sleep. These 6 ingredients are going to be your new best friend as they help end your day with the best sleep ever. 

So, what do they really do?

Ashwagandha - Improves sleep quality by decreasing insomnia (Deeper REM sleep)

Gotu Kola -  Promotes rejuvenating sleep 

Tulsi - Helps improve the bodies natural response to stress 

Lemon Balm - Decreases anxiety and stress 

Turmeric - Lowers anxiety levels 

Ginger - Helps you wake up feeling refreshed and rejuvenated

 

About Me

 

 

Video Transcript - 

Nowadays stress has become a part of our everyday lives. It could be from virtual school and office, social distancing, being away from our friends and family, and so much more. Stress comes in many forms, and mine came in the shape of TMJ. 

 

6 months ago I fell into a rollercoaster of emotions and pain as my jaw started hurting. At that time my dentists didn’t completely understand how to treat TMJ and how to decrease the pain. During this period hope was hard to grasp as the pain increased by the day. I started to get treatment as a few months passed by and I slowly started to feel relief from the pain. 

 

During these months of recovery I was given drugs to handle and decrease the pain. These drugs also impacted my sleep as I would constantly feel drowsy and tired. After I eased out of the medication I realized how my sleep pattern got affected as my body grew to be dependent on the sleep effects the drugs produced. 

 

When sleep became a hurdle I decided that I needed help, so I started to use melatonin tablets. Even though the tablets worked for a while, the nights I didn’t use it were sleepless, this meant my body grew to get used to another drug. At this point I understood that I didn’t want drugs to replace drugs so I set to research other methods to achieve sleep. 

After seeing melatonin inhaling pods, gummies, tablets, mists, and more I realized that the solution I was looking for wasn’t an easy thing to find. 

 

I then started to read about ancient Indian herbs that produced these sleep giving effects without the addicting melatonin or any other side effects. Being Indian myself I felt a greater connection towards these herbs. This is when I decided to make my own tea using the herbs I had researched about, creating the True Things Tea. 

 

My Goal

My goal is to expand and create awareness of True Things. I want to share my love of ancient ingredients and a good nights sleep with everyone. To achieve that I need funds to improve the inventory. Via Kickstarter I hope to bring light to these ancient ingredients and I hope to share more teas in the future.

Learn more about each ingredient and their histories on www.truethings.co 

 

Disclaimer

True Things products are not reviewed by the FDA. We do not make any claims, promises, or about the health benefits of any products. All statements are not intended to diagnose, cure or prevent disease. We only offer our opinions and resources based on research, product testing, and customer reviews. Use at your own risk. We are not responsible for accidents, misuse, or adverse reactions. Not to be used during pregnancy. If you have a medical condition or take pharmaceutical drugs please consult with your doctor before use.

 

Credits

Music: Rain

Musician: @iksonmusic

Music: Time

Musician: ASHUTOSH

Music: Words

Musician: music by audionautix.com

License: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/leg...

Video Clips: pexels.com

Video Inspiration: COGNURO

story:
Maehem Spirits is owned and operated by us: Ellie & Mike Hadley (our name spelling is inspired by our two basset hounds Daisy-mae & Molly-mae who star in our video)

  • Ellie was born in Norwich, UK and trained as a dancer and teacher before emigrating to Canada in 2007. She's lived and worked in the Alberni Valley for over 12 years and she's enjoyed being a hands on member of the community, taking part in projects such as: the Five Acre Shaker music festival, 2020 new years eve fundraiser and many community events at McLean Mill Historic Site in her former role as office manager.
  • Mike was born and raised in Port Alberni, trained as an electrician and has a successful career in the trades. He's also a big part of the local Kinsmen club, where he helps give back to the community. He was the driving force behind bringing back the Soap Box Derby that became an annual favourite starting in 2016.

 

 

Maehem Spirits started as a passion for craft cocktails and home brewing... we saw the popularity of the craft beer scene in Port Alberni, and realized it was time for a distillery. Our mission is to bring delicious, locally crafted cocktails to Port Alberni, for locals and tourists alike to enjoy in our covid-safe cocktail lounge!

 

 

Ellie has years of social media, marketing and administration experience and is currently finishing a further education course through North Island College in Craft Brewing (if you're in Campbell River visit Merecroft Village Pub to try one of our brews in the coming months!) and completed an intensive "internship" at Sons of Vancouver craft Distillery in North Vancouver in October 2020.

Mike is a fully licensed electrician with a passion for all things technical and an avid home-brewer.

 

 

We love being part of the community and want to create a space where our guests can feel that sense of togetherness. It's going to be a place where people can get dressed up, try something different and get that big-city night out feeling without having to make extensive plans like it's a vacation.

Our cocktail lounge is a huge part of this mission: we want to create a fun, modern space with a 70s glam rock vibe.

 

By contributing to our campaign you'll be helping us bring this vision to life.

From luxe vintage chairs to a living wall, neon signs to a statement viewing window (where you can see how your drink gets made)... we want this to be the coolest place in town to go for a cocktail and we need your help!

 

 

Here's what our vision for the lounge looks like...

There are a lot of elements to our vision and we'll be looking for ways to stay under budget and support local, renewable sources as much as possible.

Here's a breakdown of costs and necessary equipment we'll need:

  • $25 per set for cocktail glasses/bar ware
  • $50-100 each for bar stools
  • $100-150 each for vintage chairs
  • $250-500 each for live edge tables
  • $1000 for lighting
  • $2000 for the bar
  • $2500 for bathrooms
  • $1500 for neon signs
  • $10,000 for a living wall installation where we hope to grow some of our garnishes for cocktails!

Every contribution to our campaign helps us get our lounge ready to welcome you!

 

 

Some perks we're especially excited to share with you are:

  • Spirit tasting & distillery tour
  • Online/in-person mixology classes: to help you learn how to make amazing cocktails and craft your own!
  • Fun, catered bottling party: where you can be a part of the Maehem Spirits production process and ask us as many questions as you like!
  • Access to our Founders Club: where you'll get frequent mixology classes, access to early releases and discounts and get your name on our Founders Club Board or on our Copper Still!
  • Unique, limited edition merchandise that nobody else will have access to!

 

We will use all the funds raised towards designing and renovating our lounge area, throughout the campaign we'll be updating you on our progress, and asking your help on key choices like glassware... by being part of our campaign you'll also get to help us design it!

 

Craft beer isn't just beer... and craft spirits aren't just spirits.

Like all good things, when it's hand crafted by passionate people who care more about creating a great product than the bottom line, the results speak for themselves. 

But craft spirits aren't just for making great cocktails... they bring people together.

After a year where staying apart is necessary, we want to help people feel that sense of community and togetherness whether it's through virtual happy hours or a nice night out with your bubble.

 

If you live in Port Alberni you've probably been to an event that one of us has organized or volunteered at already so you know we love to make sure others are having a good time!

 

 

As with all best laid plans... things might go wrong!

Some of the problems we might run into are:

  • chairs being hard to find or in bad condition requiring more costly restoration
  • issues constructing the living wall
  • difficulty sourcing elements requiring design changes

And as with all best laid plans... we have back up plans.

Which include:

  • sourcing vintage style chairs from online retailers, if we can't find them locally
  • working with our construction team and local plant nurseries, to make sure the living wall can happen
  • sticking to our theme, so that even if we have to change the design a little the vibe will remain the same

We know money isn't everything and there are so many ways you can help us with our campaign!

  • Share this on your social media and enter our giveaway
  • Follow us on social media and interact with our content
  • Sign up for our email list and get your FREE mixology 101 class

If you live in Port Alberni you've probably been to an event that one of us has organized or volunteered at already so you know we love to make sure others are having a good time!

Some of the problems we might run into are:

chairs being hard to find or in bad condition requiring more costly restoration
issues constructing the living wall
difficulty sourcing elements requiring design changes

And as with all best laid plans... we have back up plans.
Which include:

sourcing vintage style chairs from online retailers, if we can't find them locally
working with our construction team and local plant nurseries, to make sure the living wall can happen

story:
The Matrix Shower Screen - what is it and how does it work?

This is a patented professional tool for espresso lovers with an E61 compatible group and can be installed in several seconds. 

The shower is very different than your usual etched or holed espresso shower.  Made of porous stainless steel (99.7% uniform), the shower is compiled of tens of thousands of channels as small as 4-5μ. This technology acts as a pressure damper (similar to a Gicleur) at the absolute last point in the system before the water meets the coffee puck. 

Why is this better than other screens?

- No more channeling! The matrix material structure ensures a uniform flow which lowers the risk of channeling, even when the barista is messing up the tamping. 

- No more dirty groups! Well, that's a big claim and not entirely true. What happens is that since the channels in the material are much much smaller than any of the coffee grounds, none travel back up the 3/2 valve. However, oily molecules can still travel back with the water being chucked at the end of the action. So it will get dirty, but to an amount that a flush with some cleaning material at the end of the day will be more than enough to keep the group spotless. 

- Get more out of less - Improving the flow ontop of the coffee allows the barista to grind the coffee finer and use less of it to reach a similar result. 

- Thicker cremier espresso - the micro-bubbles created inside the tiny crevices of the material make their way into the coffee brew. With the fats and fibers, this micro-bubbles build a thicker crema and full body feel.

- No more - "excuse me, i ordered an espresso but i think you served me a brown hot lemon juice" - the acidity of the drink drops significanty compared to other screens. It is the immidiately noticeable. This means you can roast your coffee even lighter for more flowery-fruity notes, while being able to compensate for the aggressive acidity a light roast can cause.  
BTW, there's a good chance you will not like your coffee's taste with the matrix screen. You'll probably have to tinker with the grind, amount and brewing profile. Maybe even change the roast. And maybe, even with all of that, you'd prefer the older more acidic version of your coffee.

 

So what are you buying?

The matrix shower was tested and developed using a KVDW speedster, SR opera, Lelit bianca and a banged-up old Grimac. That was Alpha testing and took place over 6 months.

The 100 units being sold are basically a Beta version and you will be my Beta tester. I'd appreciate your private or public feedback (though i'd appreciate a heads-up before posting anything). 
All the units are tested and function as intended, yet once the final product gets to production, you'll receive a replacement to the Beta unit. The main difference will have to do with the bonding.
If you're asking yourself - why am i selling Beta versions instead of simply distributing 100 units? Well producing and shipping 100 units is a few thousand euros which i can't afford and also I've realized that people that have something in stake (even if it's just 25euro) will have more interest and input that someone that got a free gizmo to try. No? don't you think?

 

The production will be done in September with the support of the good people of IMS filters. 

 

Del Creatives?


I'm Omri Almagor, living in Milano Italy. I've been working in the espresso industry as an engineer and designer for several years. I've worked for Kees Van Der Westen and then Faema, when i decided to start my own activity - Del Creatives S.R.L. - A company focused on innovative products in the field of food extraction, mainly coffee. The Lu-Lu is the first product we're launching, still as a one-man operation, but surrounded by friends and partners (see thanks). 

You can (and totally should) follow us on:
https://www.instagram.com/del.c.coffee/

 

What else?
Check out my other campaign!

 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lu-lu-the-mo...

The main difference will have to do with the bonding.If you're asking yourself - why am i selling Beta versions instead of simply distributing 100 units? Well producing and shipping 100 units is a few thousand euros which i can't afford and also I've realized that people that have something in stake (even if it's just 25euro) will have more interest and input that someone that got a free gizmo to try. No? don't you think?
 
The production will be done in September with the support of the good people of IMS filters.
